story:
Who we are

TINGÓ: Grita Fuerte is a cultural, spiritual and human rights organization for Afro womyn. Its purpose is to create a platform for Afro Womyn to heal through embracing our culture, traditions and rituals. Its belief is that going back to the roots of our cultures, we can transform our life. 


                    Legacy

For the past 3 years TINGO has been celebrating the Legacy of Florinda Soriano better known as Mamá Tingó with the  Annual Mamá Tingó Festival: The Full Cycle of Life

This year festival is in honor of Worldwide Rebirth.              

                  4th Annual Mamá Tingó Festival:

The Full Cycle of    Life honoring Worldwide Rebirth


Date: Saturday, November 15, 2014
Time: 12noon to 5pm
Place: Alianza Dominican Cultural Center located at at 530 West 166 St, New York, New York
Snacks will be served

Panel: Will be composed by a group of community leaders, organizers, mentors, and visionaries talking about Worldwide Rebirth from their own experiences. Be ready to experience how through their processes, challenges, fears, and doubts served as a platform to embrace themselves like a butterfly giving birth to a brand new Self.

                                      *Community Leader, Nieves Ayres
                                                        *Esq, Julie Novas
                                      * Doctor, Martha Moreno Vega

Music: Mano Viva and Claudio Fortunato y Sus Guedeses

Art Workshop: Sally Hyppolite, Founder/Coordinator at Artistas Curanderas - The Healing Artists Cooperative and Founder, CEO at DIVINE DESIGNS for the (god'is) in you

The 2014 festival is sponsored by Alianza Dominicana Culture Center and co-sponsor by El Taller Experimentar de Arte.

This is a family event!!

           What do we need


To make this event totally free to the community we need your DONATION $$$. Consider making a contribution that will give us the chance to continue carrying our legacy, celebrating Worldwide Rebirth, and connecting as communities.

We need to raise at leat $800 dollars
This money will be used to give a donation to the musicians, art workshop, and to cover the food

                              What You Get

An event totally free for the entire community. We have space for 250 people.

               The Impact

1) Continue carrying our Legacy

2) Building Bridges

3) Serving as a platform for Afro Womyn to own their voice

4) Transforming the Conversation

5) Family, friends, community coming together

6) Wonderful time

7) REBIRTH


 Collaboration!

Let's work together. There are many ways that you can work with us.

  •  Donating through the Indiegogo Campaign
  • Promoting the campaign by spreading the word with friends and family
  • Talk about it on Facebook, Blog, Instagram,Tweet it all day, Email, and other social networks
  •   Donating your talents/skills during the festival
  • Bring New Ideas to raise the funds and take it on

                        Other Ways You Can Help

There are many ways you can contribute! If you can't make a financial contribution, below are some of the ways you can work eith us.  

You can: Share, Share, Share the campaign.

You can: Ask, Ask, Ask others to donate

You can: Write, Write, Write an article on the Festival

You can: Teach, Teach, Teach our kids and friends about the legacy of Mamá Tingó. 

PS:

If you want to send a donation via check, please make the check payable to:

TINGO: Grita Fuerte

Memo: Festival

Mail to: 65 west 192nd Street Apt 3I Bronx, NY 10463

Paypal:

tingogritafuerte@gmail.com

Thanks for checking out the page. The campaign will run for 25 days.


"Just when the caterpillar thought the world was over, it became a butterfly..." Proverb

Grita Fuerte.

story:
People of Coloring at FPAC 2014

Help People of Coloring at the Festival of Philippine Art and Culture print more coloring books tailored for this event! We're aiming to print 200-500 booklets at the very least to share with children and families to enjoy at FPAC 2014's programming. The illustrations feature recent works from community artists, many of whom will be present during the festival. 

What We Need & How We'll Use It

About The Filipino Edition: People of Coloring dedicates a Filipino Edition coloring booklet, which features illustrations and information of Philippine history, culture, and experiences provided by local artists of our community. Their work, including that of People of Coloring, is all volunteer-based. This edition aims to introduce, enlighten, excite and expand the dialogue of our rich cultural heritage for generations new and old.
  • Funds raised will be used for printing costs, but if our goal is exceeded we will be able to...
  • Buy crayons
  • And coloring pencils
  • And print even more books!
Our fun quirk-perks are waiting for you too, so be sure to check them out!

About People of Coloring

People of Coloring aims to promote multi-cultural visibility, awareness and acceptance to youth and adults through conscious coloring books. We address the need to start conversations about race, culture, ethnicity and gender identity earlier in life. As we enhance the dialogue of common and shared experiences among diverse peoples of color, we hope to dissect stereotypes and dissolve barriers by which society divides. By working with artists who create with and for the community, we capture the cultural and socio-political climates in the places and times we live. We might not solve the world's problems, but we may create more conscious kids of color. People of Coloring - it’s not a race.

About The Program

For the Kid's Pavilion at FPAC this year, People Of Coloring will provide children and adults with illustrations and booklets to practice Conscious Coloring. This activity encourages participants to engage with artistic expression, ask critical questions, share stories and spark important conversations centered on diversity and challenging social norms in every-day encounters. Families can come together in a safe and fun environment to share stories, color, and discuss topics invoked by the illustrations of this year's coloring book. People Of Coloring dedicates a Filipino Edition for this year's festival, which features illustrations and information provided by participating artists.

Meet the Artists!

  • Paula Abad
  • Marconi Calindas
  • Coco Chanelis
  • Michael Dalupo
  • Norman de los Santos
  • Nicanor Evangelista, Jr.
  • Ray Haguisan
  • Therese Javier
  • Alfie Numeric
  • Robert Sison
  • Diyan Valencia

For Kapwa

Not only does this project intend to raise awareness and pass on knowledge to future generations of our culture, but we also hope to create a space for sharing stories and exchange through each of our experiences as being Filipino. Please help us drive these connections deeper by sharing with a friend, through social media, over the phone, or in person - anything helps!

About The Artwork

Here's a sneak peek of one of the coloring book pages! Image: The Mangyan Writer, Norman de los Santos, 2014. Courtesy of the artist.

We might not solve the world's problems, but we may create more conscious kids of color. People of Coloring - it’s not a race.

About The Program
For the Kid's Pavilion at FPAC this year, People Of Coloring will provide children and adults with illustrations and booklets to practice Conscious Coloring. This activity encourages participants to engage with artistic expression, ask critical questions, share stories and spark important conversations centered on diversity and challenging social norms in every-day encounters. Families can come together in a safe and fun environment to share stories, color, and discuss topics invoked by the illustrations of this year's coloring book. People Of Coloring dedicates a Filipino Edition for this year's festival, which features illustrations and information provided by participating artists.
  Meet the Artists!

Paula Abad

Marconi Calindas


Coco Chanelis


Michael Dalupo


Norman de los Santos


Nicanor Evangelista, Jr.


Ray Haguisan

Therese Javier


Alfie Numeric


Robert Sison


Diyan Valencia
 
  For Kapwa Not only does this project intend to raise awareness and pass on knowledge to future generations of our culture, but we also hope to create a space for sharing stories and exchange through each of our experiences as being Filipino. Please help us drive these connections deeper by sharing with a friend, through social media, over the phone, or in person - anything helps!
About The Artwork



Here's a sneak peek of one of the coloring book pages! Image: The Mangyan Writer, Norman de los Santos, 2014. Courtesy of the artist.

story:
Summary

More Than Nothing, is focused on removing, and reporting on, dislodged land mines in Bosnia. The charity effort works with filmmakers, photographers, musicians and visual artists to create short documentaries, photo essays, paintings and music in order to use art as a means of raising money to support land mine removal efforts.

On Oct 9th, we held a charity event  at Kinfolk 94 in Brooklyn, where the most recent film taken was screened and art displayed.  

The artists involved include photographers Kareem Black and Wyatt Gallery, filmmakers Araby Williams and Maria Juranic, visual artists Jean Pierre Roy, Isaac Arvold, Lindsay Mound, George Thompson V, Craig Duffney, Alex Nowak and Eric Carlson, musicians P.O.S., Dirtyfinger, Paper Tiger and Grant Cutler.

If you missed the event, or if you missed purchasing something at the event, you can still support us and do so now! 

Below are prints available for purchase. There are only seven remaining of each.

 Kareem Black, "Last man standing"


Kareem Black, "Where do we go from here?"


Wyatt Gallery, "Mud like water"

Wyatt Gallery, "On our wedding day"


Thanks so much!

story:
I am Laura Thoms, of Red Press Printing, a letterpress shop in Austin, TX.  www.redpressprinting.com  In November 2014, two of my favorite letterpress printers, Rory Sparks of Em Space in Portland, OR and Kyle Durrie, of Power & Light Press--- best known for her Movable Type Truck adventure, asked me to apply as part of their group to take over the print studio for the Winter Residency at the renowned Penland School of Crafts   http://penland.org/programs/special_programs_wi...

in the smoky mountains of North Carolina.

I applied & got in and now I am leaving for this adventure on SUNDAY!!!

It is just now sinking in that I am leaving my home and work for much of the month of January--- and while I put some money aside to be able to do this, I'd like to raise just a bit more to really cover all my costs without worry. 

In return you will get to travel with me on this adventure. Perks include: postcards from the road, photos of winter mountain walks, and prints from the work I make while I am there.

While I am there, I will get to take time off from running my business--- and work on making art. I will further my exploration of type collage using my collection of wood type, and that from Penland's collection --- and work on new woodcuts and linocuts to be included in my solo art show in March 2015.

You all know what a workaholic I am am--- driven to work as much as I can to be able to continue doing the printing that I love, and to have pockets of time for making art and travel to learn from my peers. This opportunity at Penland not only affords me a chance to take  2 weeks to focus completely on my work --- but to collaborate and be inspired by some of the best printers in my field while working in Penland's state of the art facility...and go on snowshoe walks in the winter mountain woods. I have a feeling that will be just the thing to let the creativity flow.

Thank you so much for considering helping me with this residency! Please share with any one who might be interested!

story:
Hello Everyone,

I have been selected to display some of three pieces of my work at the Truckee stop of the Wild and Scenic Film Festival tour. This will be the very first time my work has been displayed in an art show. I'm very excited to get my work in front of a larger audience. 
The fund raised through this indiegogo will help me cover expenses related to canvas printing and framing for three 16" x 20" pieces. In return for your support I will be providing a unique opportunity to get any of the art from my Flickr that you really enjoy. https://www.flickr.com/photos/100977783@N08/
If you can help out at the moment maybe you can share my project with your friends! 
Hope you love the work you get as a reward. Thanks for checking out my project!

story:
The Messengers is a spectacular world-touring exhibit comprised of twelve epic-scale murals that reveal the essence of what renowned mythologist, Joseph Campbell coined as The Hero's Journey ... the basis of all story throughout time. The unparalleled collective work explores the deepest truths passed down through history about our human existence.  Humans and divine beings powerfully portray each of the twelve stages in the most awe-inspiring classical realism.  Furthermore, the partially curved frameless murals are animated and interactive -- giving the viewer the experience of being a part of the art, as opposed to simply being an observer.  An original sound score and narrated prose complete this powerful creative triumvirate that promises to make this one of the most sensational and revelatory events of our time.  

The mission of The Messengers is use media at its highest function -- which is to remind us of our human potential.   Furthermore, The Messengers is a timely humanitarian effort to generate substantial funds for the purpose of caring for the children of our world.

Director Thomas Christian Wolfe has gained the alliance of some of the world's most outstanding artists, along with Emmy award-winning composers, and new-thought leaders -- whom have all joined together to produce this epic portrayal of The Human Odyssey at the museum-quality level with which it was conceived. Having dedicated the past four years to developing this vision down to every last detail, the team reaches out now for the support of the global community to take this dream for humanity into full flight.  Your support on any level will be credited and honored for the lifetime of this world-touring event. 

Read further to discover more about this years-in-the-making unparalleled vision.


Above video: A fuller "overview" of this epic event (4 minutes).

                           :

Click the following link: To read Positive Impact Magazine's 6-page article on The Messengers Event (starting on page 21): http://issuu.com/positiveimpactmagazine/docs/volume_3-2?e=2938531/2621976

IS THIS A FILM?

The main aspect of the The Messengers is a twelve room exhibit, where each room houses an epic-scale mural that portrays one specific stage of the Human Odyssey. Visitors will tour the exhibit in a precise sequence.  However, a film about the making of this event, as well as a live performance of the original sound score serve as exciting additions to this world-touring expose.  

IS THE THEME RELIGIOUS?

No.  The theme is completely universal and generally avoids all correlation to any specific religion or ideology.  While the event will surely provoke inner contemplation and possible revelation, the director's intention is purely to strike the universal chord of being human.

WHAT IS THE THEME AND SUBJECT OF THESE ARTWORKS?

Angels powerfully interact with humans to dynamically portray each of the twelve stages of the Human Odyssey ... the essence of all story throughout human history.

ARE ANGELS THE MAIN FOCUS OF THIS EXHIBIT'S ART?

Angels are portrayed in the most glorious manner -- which may well invite coining this event as the most spectacular event of angels ever seen.  However, the sole purpose in using angels is strictly for what they represent as a universal archetype -- being reminders of our human virtues and divine essence.  As such, the humans portrayed in these powerful scenes would still be the chief focus in this art.

WHY IS IT BEING CONSIDERED A NEW ART FORM?

The Messengers event uses the familiar technology we find in art, film and games.  However, it's the way they are combined that makes it unprecedented.  As Assistant Director Jeff Bedrick says: "It's like walking into a museum and seeing the paintings come alive."

WHAT IS THIS CAMPAIGN'S OBJECTIVE?

Now that this vision has been developed down to every last detail the objective is to raise enough funds to carry the project into full production.  This first phase of production targets three main aspects: 1) Designing and story-boarding all twelve murals; 2) Creating one working prototype, 3) Building the new website and online store in HTML5.  With enough funding support the "pilot" of the 12-part webisode series of "The Making of The Messengers Event" will also be created.

HOW LONG WILL IT TAKE TO TOTALLY PRODUCE THE FIRST EVENT?

It should take anywhere from 18-24 months to premiere the first live event.

IS THIS JUST A ONE-TIME EVENT?

Commencing with the premiere event The Messengers is designed to continue touring thereafter, one major city at a time.

WHERE IS THE FIRST EVENT SCHEDULED TO BE?

The Messengers is slated to initially launch in the US ... specifically San Francisco, California.

HOW ARE THE EVENTS TIED IN WITH CHARITY?

The world-touring exhibit is designed to make significant funds online, as well as at each of the tour points.  The objective has always been to use a significant amount of the profits to address the most pressing needs of our time ... especially our world's children.  There is an in depth plan already designed for this, which will be divulged in full detail to the global community at a near future point.



Thomas Christian Wolfe's distinguished career spans over three decades with epic murals and paintings for such prestigious clients as The California Academy of Sciences, The Oakland Museum, Yellowstone Club World's Emerald Cay, Kenny Loggins, Dreamworks, Disney, Sony, and many others. His work has been described as classical, romantic, epic, visionary, universal, and unforgettable.

Over the four years of developing this vision down to every last detail, Wolfe has had no trouble inspiring some of the world's most outstanding artists to join on his mission to use art for its highest purpose.

Our dream team is comprised of world-renowned artists, writers, musicians, and technical experts who have all received great esteem and admiration for their professional achievements in their assorted fields. This includes a roster of accomplished masters, each of whom have contributed their talents to productions that have collectively garnered Oscars, Emmys, Grammys, and earned billions of dollars worldwide. 



The Messengers is an ambitious endeavor. The designs and committed team are ready to go. However, significant production costs include video and lighting equipment and crew, model fees, studio space, marketing and promotion costs, website development, venue rental, printing, display construction, etc. We can only do this with a substantial working budget to meet these considerable costs. This is where you, as a part of the global community can step in to be a part of this noble cause by contributing whatever you can to help it launch.  

Here is a list of our goals with this initial outreach to our global community:

  • Designing and Storyboarding all twelve murals
  • Creating one or more fully functioning protypes
  • Creating the all new exciting website in HTML5 (which will be accessible on all devices), including its online store.  This will be our "eye" to the global community -- which includes showcasing a series of twelve behind-the-scenes short films that will show the trials and triumphs of creating a global event.

In addition to helping us meet our budget needs, there are many other ways that you can help The Messengers meet its goals: 

  • Sign-up at our official website via the JOIN button
  • Good at social networking?  We can always use more team members!
  • Spread the word about The Messengers Indiegogo campaign through your own social media resources including Facebook, Twitter, Reddit, etc. 
  • Use the Indiegogo share tools right on The Messengers page!  
  • If you have marketing or project management skills and wish to join our promotion team, then please contact the project director at: Director@WolfeStudios.com



The Messengers team is going all out to give you some exciting gifts in our heartfelt appreciation and gratitude of your enthusiasm for our success 

All levels of contribution will give you a permanent credit in all future promotions and actual events.  

Shown above: The Messengers desktop comes signed by our core team.


Shown above: The hand-created and numbered "Angelicus Plumis" edition.  Own a tangible piece of divinity. (Donate soon to acquire the earlier series numbers!) These truly are divine gifts, literally imbued with actual high-frequency holy energy. Rest assured that no divine beings were harmed in the making of this product.

Our gifts range from high-quality t-shirts designed by our director, as well as limited edition prints of the plethora of images created for The Messengers event.   All prints are available in various sizes, quantities, standard numbered prints, APs, and remarks, framed and unframed -- all relative to your donation amount.  Special gifts include original drawings and artwork. 

Shown above: Woman's short-sleeved "Calling all Humans" tee.  Available in all sizes, men and women's.

Above: Premium gifts include mural-size limited-edition Giclee prints on canvas.

Above: Only the finest inks and printers are used in the making of all event prints..

Above: The "Inspiritus" painting was created specifically for this Indiegogo campaign and is available in various sizes as a signed and numbered limited edition. The actual murals will be far more ambitious. However, “Inspiritus” is emblematic of the event's message about the inseparable connection between ourselves and our divinity.


Above: Premium gifts include custom frame and title plaque designed by artist.

Above: Detail of "Inspiritus", created specifically for this campaign by our director, Thomas Christian Wolfe.  The Giclee prints retain the original's masterful detailing.


As with any endeavor, this project is being created in stages.  This is the first of a series of four Indiegogo campaigns we’ve planned over the upcoming 12 months.  Our goal with this initial campaign is to get us into actual production after years of astute designing and planning that has finally brought us to the place of total assurance this vision is completely viable and realistic.

The costs are significant to create this altogether new art form.  Pre-production begins with extensive “storyboarding” of the twelve epic-scale murals.  This is followed immediately with designing costumes, hiring numerous professional models/actors, extensive green-screen and underwater photo shoots, and designing the background sceneries.  Post-production includes weeks of editing and preparing reference imagery, months of painting, and composing an original score, as well as composing the powerful prose that is to align with each of the twelve murals.

Every plateau we reach in contributions takes the project to the next level of production.  Below is a breakdown of what we will be able to achieve with each contribution milestone we reach from your generous support: 

$100,000 plateau:

  • Storyboard all twelve animated murals
  • Create a prototype of one live animated mural
  • Create a new website in HTML5 to cross all devices (in 7 languages).

$250,000 plateau:

  • Create more of the fully functioning twelve animated murals
  • Create the “pilot” of the 12-part webisode series entitled: “The Making of The Messengers Event”, which will give our global community a behind-the-scenes viewing of the exciting stages of creating this epic event.

$500,000 plateau:

  • Complete creation of remaining twelve animated murals
  • Create 5 more webisodes of the 12-part series of “The Making of The Messengers Event”.
  • Compose original sound score to align with 12 murals
  • Compose original prose to align with 12 murals

$1,000,000 plateau:

This is what is needed to create all the content for this epic event! 

  • 12 completely animated and interactive mural works
  • Produce the original sound score (recorded with live orchestra)
  • Produce all the original narration
  • Expand the new HTML5 website to all top world languages
  • Entire 12-part webisode series of “The Making of The Messengers Event”.

Above and Beyond:

Producing the first “live” premiere event of The Messengers will require considerably more than the seed funding to create the content.  Once we have reached the plateau of creating all of the content for The Messengers, we will be ready to present to a panel of celebrity investors needed to build the infrastructure of the world-touring exhibit. This activates all the associate production teams and individuals who will build the actual exhibit including the state-of-the-art unique projection system, curved screens, venue planning, marketing, promotion, and all further aspects of managing and producing the "live" experience.

Throughout all of our Indiegogo campaigns, as well as on our official website, we will keep our subscribers and the global community updated on a daily basis as to our project’s progress.


The Messengers team sincerely wishes to thank everyone who has been so supportive from the very inception of this vision four years ago -- including all of our newest friends and supporters here, who can consider yourselves to be no less than executive producers of this unprecedented event.  

Adobe
Black Cat Studio
Dell
Pearl Printing
Positive Impact Magazine
Robert Arnot Productions
Thrive Movement
Wacom
Wernher Krutein Photography

“Magnificent.”                                                                                                                                    ~ Foster Gamble (Thrive Movement)

“The Messengers takes art to the level of a spiritual experience.”                        ~ Positive Impact Magazine 

“The Messengers could not arrive at a more timely moment as a divinely inspired wake-up call to a slumbering humanity to co-create a future worth living.”                                                                                                                                 ~ Rama Mani / World Future Council

“Thomas Christian Wolfe’s art has universal appeal.”                                              ~ State Foundation on Culture and the Arts

"Representing a new mastery in storytelling, this event will inspire all who experience it to continue their relationship with the Divine long after they leave the actual event itself.  Once in a generation a new art form emerges that revolutionizes the way that humans see themselves in the Universe --   The Messengers Event is this new art form."                                                                             ~ Julia Melanie Vaughns, Rabbi 


Phone: 808.652.7100 (Pacific Time USA)

Email: Director@WolfeStudios.com

Website: www.TheMessengersEvent.com

6-page article in the latest issue of Positive Impact Magazine (page 21): 
http://issuu.com/positiveimpactmagazine/docs/volume_3-2?e=2938531/2621976

-------------------------------------- SEE MORE BELOW --------------------------------------


Beginning with the powerful, time-proven mediums of art, music, and prose, The Messengers innovatively blends timeless classical mastery with the revolutionary technology of today to become one of the most uniquely immersive and revelatory experiences of our time. 

This unparalleled tour takes us on an unforgettable journey through twelve rooms where we find ourselves being an integral part of larger than life illuminated scenes that envelop us in a 90-degree arch. 

Above image: The initial room of an actual exhibit.

The Messengers revisits the same aesthetic refinement of art by the classical masters of the past with the added elements of animation and interactivity created by today's most cutting edge techniques in cinematography and animation.  Meticulous attention to detail is evident in every frame of movement from beginning to end.   Narration and an original score combine to take these art forms to the level of a revelatory experience, resulting in what could be described as an altogether new art form that stands on its own alongside classical art and cinema.

The intention here is beyond the superficial sensationalism that is so prevalent in the over-saturated world of modern entertainment.  It is to provide visitors with the immersive experience of being a part of the captivating scenes before them.  These epic works powerfully portray the dynamic interplay between humans and angelic beings, representing the archetypal stages of our collective Human Odyssey. The journey takes us through every phase of the human experience from despair to the most exalted states of self-realization. 

The Messengers draws upon the wisdom of the greatest minds throughout human history.  These include spiritual icons such as Christ and Buddha; scientists including Einstein and Carl Sagan; philosophers like Rumi and Dante; and what world-renowned mythologist Joseph Campbell defined as The Hero's Journey, which is the essence of all mythology. 

The Messengers endeavors to kindle a rediscovery and reawakening of the wisdom and understanding that innately dwells within each of us. It is that universal essence that transcends all ideologies. It is a map for navigating our inner life as we dwell in the physical world. It is a gentle reminder that each of us has the power in every moment to reclaim a purposeful connection with our innate virtues and divinity. The shadows of our forgotten ancestors are reawakened and brought into full light, awareness, and understanding. If we are to connect as an integrated humanity, then the only effective time is now.  The Messengers endeavors to illuminate this deepest truth, and to deliver what hope merely promises.

Above image: Painting one of the frames of this new art form.

Far beyond creating mere sensationalism, the deeper motive here has always been to provide visitors with an incomparably and viscerally-rich experience of being a part of the compelling scenes before them, as opposed to simply being a spectator.

Above image: Viewers will become an integral part of the larger than life scenes before them.

Following its premiere launch after 12-18 months of production The Messengers will commence to tour the globe, debuting at some of the world’s most prestigious venues.

In addition to helping us meet our budget needs, there are many other ways that you can help The Messengers meet its goals: 



Sign-up at our official website via the JOIN button
Good at social networking?  We can always use more team members!

Spread the word about The Messengers Indiegogo campaign through your own social media resources including Facebook, Twitter, Reddit, etc. 


Use the Indiegogo share tools right on The Messengers page!  

If you have marketing or project management skills and wish to join our promotion team, then please contact the project director at: Director@WolfeStudios.com



The Messengers team is going all out to give you some exciting gifts in our heartfelt appreciation and gratitude of your enthusiasm for our success 

All levels of contribution will give you a permanent credit in all future promotions and actual events.  



Shown above: The Messengers desktop comes signed by our core team.


Shown above: The hand-created and numbered "Angelicus Plumis" edition.  Own a tangible piece of divinity. (Donate soon to acquire the earlier series numbers!) These truly are divine gifts, literally imbued with actual high-frequency holy energy. Rest assured that no divine beings were harmed in the making of this product.
Our gifts range from high-quality t-shirts designed by our director, as well as limited edition prints of the plethora of images created for The Messengers event.   All prints are available in various sizes, quantities, standard numbered prints, APs, and
remarks, framed and unframed -- all relative to your donation amount.  Special gifts include original drawings and artwork. 

Shown above: Woman's short-sleeved "Calling all Humans" tee.  Available in all sizes, men and women's.


Above: Premium gifts include mural-size limited-edition Giclee prints on canvas.


Above: Only the finest inks and printers are used in the making of all event prints..




Above: The "Inspiritus" painting was created specifically for this Indiegogo campaign and is available in various sizes as a signed and numbered limited edition. The actual murals will be far more ambitious. However, “Inspiritus” is emblematic of the event's message about the inseparable connection between ourselves and our divinity.


Above: Premium gifts include custom frame and title plaque designed by artist.




Above: Detail of "Inspiritus", created specifically for this campaign by our director, Thomas Christian Wolfe.  The Giclee prints retain the original's masterful detailing.





  




  

As with any endeavor, this project is being created in stages.  This is the first of a series of four Indiegogo campaigns we’ve planned over the upcoming 12 months.  Our goal with this initial campaign is to get us into actual production after years of astute designing and planning that has finally brought us to the place of total assurance this vision is completely viable and realistic.
The costs are significant to create this altogether new art form.  Pre-production begins with extensive “storyboarding” of the twelve epic-scale murals.  This is followed immediately with designing costumes, hiring numerous professional models/actors, extensive green-screen and underwater photo shoots, and designing the background sceneries.  Post-production includes weeks of editing and preparing reference imagery, months of painting, and composing an original score, as well as composing the powerful prose that is to align with each of the twelve murals.
Every plateau we reach in contributions takes the project to the next level of production.  Below is a breakdown of what we will be able to achieve with each contribution milestone we reach from your generous support: 
$100,000 plateau:

Storyboard all twelve animated murals
Create a prototype of one live animated mural
Create a new website in HTML5 to cross all devices (in
     7 languages).

$250,000 plateau:

Create more of the fully functioning twelve animated murals
Create the “pilot” of the 12-part webisode series
     entitled: “The Making of The
     Messengers Event”, which will give our global community a
     behind-the-scenes viewing of the exciting stages of creating this epic event.

$500,000 plateau:

Complete creation of remaining twelve animated murals
Create 5 more webisodes of the 12-part series of “The Making of The Messengers Event”.
Compose original sound score to align with 12 murals
Compose original prose to align with 12 murals

$1,000,000 plateau:
This is what is needed to create all the content for this epic event! 

12 completely animated and interactive mural works
Produce the original sound score (recorded with live orchestra)
Produce all the original narration
Expand the new HTML5 website to all top world languages
Entire 12-part webisode series of “The Making of The Messengers Event”. 


Above and Beyond:
Producing the first “live” premiere event of The Messengers will require considerably more than the seed funding to create the content.  Once we have reached the plateau of creating all of the content for The Messengers, we will be ready to present to a panel of celebrity investors needed to build the infrastructure of the world-touring exhibit. This activates all the associate production teams and individuals who will build the actual exhibit including the state-of-the-art unique projection system, curved screens, venue planning, marketing, promotion, and all further aspects of managing and producing the "live" experience.

Throughout all of our Indiegogo campaigns, as well as on our official website, we will keep our subscribers and the global community updated on a daily basis as to our project’s progress.



The Messengers team sincerely wishes to thank everyone who has been so supportive from the very inception of this vision four years ago -- including all of our newest friends and supporters here, who can consider yourselves to be no less than executive producers of this unprecedented event.  AdobeBlack Cat StudioDell
Pearl Printing
Positive Impact MagazineRobert Arnot ProductionsThrive MovementWacomWernher Krutein Photography
“Magnificent.”                                                                                                                                    ~ Foster Gamble (Thrive Movement)

“The Messengers takes art to the level of a spiritual experience.”                        ~ Positive Impact Magazine 
“The Messengers could not arrive at a more timely moment as a divinely inspired wake-up call to a slumbering humanity to co-create a future worth living.”                                                                                                                                 ~ Rama Mani / World Future Council
“Thomas Christian Wolfe’s art has universal appeal.”                                              ~ State Foundation on Culture and the Arts
"Representing a new mastery
in storytelling, this event will inspire all who experience it to continue
their relationship with the Divine long after they leave the actual event itself.  Once in a generation a new art form emerges
that revolutionizes the way that humans see
themselves in the Universe --   The Messengers Event is this new art form."                                                                             ~ Julia Melanie
Vaughns, Rabbi 


Phone: 808.652.7100 (Pacific Time USA)Email: Director@WolfeStudios.com
Website: www.TheMessengersEvent.com
6-page article in the latest issue of Positive Impact Magazine (page 21): http://issuu.com/positiveimpactmagazine/docs/volume_3-2?e=2938531/2621976
-------------------------------------- SEE MORE BELOW --------------------------------------


Beginning with the powerful, time-proven mediums of art, music, and prose, The Messengers innovatively blends timeless classical mastery with the revolutionary technology of today to become one of the most uniquely immersive and revelatory experiences of our time. 
This unparalleled tour takes us on an unforgettable journey through twelve rooms where we find ourselves being an integral part of larger than life illuminated scenes that envelop us in a 90-degree arch. 


Above image: The initial room of an actual exhibit.
The Messengers revisits the same aesthetic refinement of art by the classical masters of the past with the added elements of animation and interactivity created by today's most cutting edge techniques in cinematography and animation.  Meticulous attention to detail is evident in every frame of movement from beginning to end.   Narration and an original score combine to take these art forms to the level of a revelatory experience, resulting in what could be described as an altogether new art form that stands on its own alongside classical art and cinema.
The intention here is beyond the superficial sensationalism that is so prevalent in the over-saturated world of modern entertainment.  It is to provide visitors with the immersive experience of being a part of the captivating scenes before them.  These epic works powerfully portray the dynamic interplay between humans and angelic beings, representing the archetypal stages of our collective Human Odyssey. The journey takes us through every phase of the human experience from despair to the most exalted states of self-realization. 
The Messengers draws upon the wisdom of the greatest minds throughout human history.  These include spiritual icons such as Christ and Buddha; scientists including Einstein and Carl Sagan; philosophers like Rumi and Dante; and what world-renowned mythologist Joseph Campbell defined as The Hero's Journey, which is the essence of all mythology. 
The Messengers endeavors to kindle a rediscovery and reawakening of the wisdom and understanding that innately dwells within each of us. It is that universal essence that transcends all ideologies. It is a map for navigating our inner life as we dwell in the physical world. It is a gentle reminder that each of us has the power in every moment to reclaim a purposeful connection with our innate virtues and divinity. The shadows of our forgotten ancestors are reawakened and brought into full light, awareness, and understanding. If we are to connect as an integrated humanity, then the only effective time is now.  The Messengers endeavors to illuminate this deepest truth, and to deliver what hope merely promises.

Above image: Painting one of the frames of this new art form.
Far beyond creating mere sensationalism, the deeper motive here has always been to provide visitors with an incomparably and viscerally-rich experience of being a part of the compelling scenes before them, as opposed to simply being a spectator.


Above image: Viewers will become an integral part of the larger than life scenes before them.
Following its premiere launch after 12-18 months of production The Messengers will commence to tour the globe, debuting at some of the world’s most prestigious venues.

story:
Arts for Mental Health:

Stop the Stigma

 

Our Story: 

In the U.S. alone, there is one death by suicide every twelve minutes. As a statistic, this is an extremely troubling number. As someone who has been touched by this reality, it is even more devastating.

On July 7 of this year, my aunt Mary became one of those statistics. She graduated from Wesley Memorial School of Nursing at Loyola University (magna cum laude) and the University of California, San Francisco. She was a Nurse Practitioner. She was vibrant, intelligent, kind and generous. She enjoyed reading, gardening, music and art. Every twelve minutes, we lose someone just like Aunt Mary, my loved one who touched thousands of lives through her work and service. 

 

Our Why:

According to the CDC, 80-90% of people who seek treatment for depression are treated successfully using therapy and medication. But, so many people struggling with mental health issues do not seek help for a myriad of reasons, including some are too ashamed, some cannot afford it, and some feel they can’t be helped. There is still a stigma in today’s world surrounding mental health, and this stigma needs to end.

This is why we have created “Arts for Mental Health”. Beginning on January 3, 2020 we will record a song that was based on the thoughts and feelings that came as result of my aunt’s death. All proceeds from this campaign, plus future purchases, streams, and royalties of this song will be donated to two leaders in the mental health community: No Stigmas and the National Alliance on Mental Illness. Our goal is to support and raise as much money as possible towards this cause and helping those in need with this same crisis.

We want to make sure no one is denied help or shamed into feeling like seeking help is not an option, regardless of their means. Through the power of the arts and music, we want work towards a brighter future for those struggling with their own depression and mental health issues. 

 

How It Came Together:

When I first had the idea for this campaign, I knew I wanted to use the arts and music to help others living with depression or mental health issues. This is not an epidemic that will go away or resolve itself, and something needs to be done. The suicide rate in the U.S. rose 24% from 2007 to 2017, according to the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention. Among people ages 10 to 24 years old, it jumped 56%. 

Mental illness and suicide are epidemics that affect so many, proving that even if someone has the means to get help, they don’t always do so. Knowing how much my aunt had been suffering in silence for so many years, and knowing how many others feel the same way, I felt I needed to do whatever I could to help as many people in similar situations as I could. I decided to use my own personal outlet and strength, music, to accomplish this. Music helped me cope with this loss, and I hope that by creating and performing this song, it can help others with their own battles, whether it is depression, coping with loss, or giving them the courage or means to seek treatment.

 

The Song:

The music portion for “Holding Pattern” has actually been completed since 2015. Though I never had any inspiration to write lyrics for the music until all the feelings surrounding my aunt’s death came flooding in and I knew I needed to get them out in a positive and healthy way. With the help of Tyler and Keaton, we finished the song and lyrics this past fall. The song portrays someone battling with depression and thoughts of suicide, something that we don’t see or hear often in the media or today’s music. It is so important for people to understand they are not alone in these thoughts and feelings and there are others who understand and are coping with the same. 

 

Our Team:

To accomplish this, we have put together an amazing team of individuals:

Me (Dan): (Ridgeway Recording) I am a multiple award-winning producer, engineer, musician, and educator and I am also the creator and organizer behind this campaign. As stated above, this tragedy has made me want to do everything in my power to end the stigma around mental health issues. I will be producing, writing, playing and engineering the song. My donations include studio time, mixing time, pay, the website and associated fees, etc.

Kobi Swissa (Swissa Creative Inc.): Kobi has generously donated his time and expertise in videography and production this campaign. 

Marco Degadillo: Marco, along with Kobi, did all of our storyboarding, scripting, shot the footage for the campaign video and will be shooting footage during the recording process. He also was the director for our promotional video.

Jill L. Ferguson (jillferguson.com): Jill, a best-selling author, was key to our script editing and gave amazing advice and words of wisdom.

Diana Torres (egg-plantation.com): Diana has played a vital role in building our website.

Keaton Snyder: Keaton (formerly of The Dodos) is the music producer for the song being recorded.

 

Musicians: (Alphabetical order)

James Fixx: James (fixxmusic.com) assisted in engineering as well as playing keys and singing.

Andrew Green: Andrew (twintalkmusic.com) is the percussionist and drummer.

Sean Jacobi: Sean is the bass guitar player for Holding Pattern.

Ben Norsworthy: Ben is the guitar player, keyboard player, and background vocal. 

Tyler Warnygora: Tyler is the co-writer and singer for Holding Pattern. 

 

Where Your Money is Going:

-Making sure the musicians and producer are paid for their time

-Mastering the song

-Uploading fees for the song for distribution

-After these expenses are met, 100% of your donations will go towards our partner charities to help end the stigma of mental health issues.

 

Thank You.

This is an extremely personal and meaningful project for me and my family, and I know so many others will feel the same. I want to thank everyone for their time and effort put toward this project and for the support my friends and family have given me through this process. I want to especially thank my mother, Ann, for her support and guidance during this difficult time. Losing her sister has been understandably difficult for her, but the help she has given me is unmatched even through that devastation. Please know that with your donation, you will not only be helping those struggling with depression and mental health issues, but also their families and loved ones. 90% of those who died by suicide in 2018 had a diagnosable mental health condition at the time of their deaths. There is help, and with your donation, we work towards a brighter future. We understand that not everyone will be able to make a monetary donation but please know that sharing this campaign with your friends and family is just as important.

 

Thank you for helping us change the culture of mental health through art and the power of music. We weren't able to save my aunt, but together, we can help save others.

story:
My name is Amritha and I am an environmental and transdisciplinary artist whose work includes painting, installation, performance and community engagement. 

Through an initiative I have started called KalkiCreate (kalkicreate.com), I engage communities and school groups in collective projects that nurture our creativity in connection with the earth. Some projects I have done with students include making sound art with recycled materials and putting on a whole school musical performance, creating collage art out of repurposed materials, outdoor observation and drawing from life. The aim of these projects is for students to be empowered creatively and feel connected to their environment. 

I seek to further this work through this funding campaign, which will allow me to develop and implement art and nature immersive projects with communities and schools. It will also afford me the opportunity to participate in two art residencies with the organization La Wayaka Current, where I will create art in remote regions of Central and South America, working with the indigenous communities there. 

This opportunity will allow me to learn about and experience the remote, natural environments of the Atacama desert, Chile and Guna Yala, Panama, and to learn from the indigenous communities, the Lickan Antay and the Gunas. I will be able to create work in response to the environmental impacts these communities are facing and curate educational projects that raise awareness about these impacts. In supporting this campaign, you will help to further enrich my ability as an artist and educator working with the environment and in community.  

The funding I need is $15,000. This covers the cost of two residencies, the cost of airfare, of travel insurance, supplies, art supplies and living expenses. Each residency is three weeks long, where I will be immersed in the local cultures, learning about land conservation, sustainable practices, subsistence farming, archeology and botanic healing. All of the funds will go towards funding these two residencies and growing KalkiCreate into a fully operating entity. 

In helping to fund this campaign, you are helping to further my work with KalkiCreate, supporting art that addresses environmental and social concerns, and helping to bring this work into communities and schools. You are also helping to support me as an emerging artist, the non-profit arts organization La Wayaka Current and the indigenous communities, the Lickan Antay and the Gunas, of the Atacama Desert and Guna Yala.  

If you are not able to contribute financially, you can help by sharing this campaign with others and anyone you know who may be interested in supporting. Thank you so much for your time and for your support!

story:
Lets Help Jessie!

If you're reading this, that means that you probably know Jessie Maranda.   A wonderful friend and extremely talented makeup artist, Jessie has been in the industry for eleven + years and has poured all of her time, money and efforts into making her passion a career.  She's almost there!  In the last year, she's done countless commercials, independent films, a mini series and several creative, successful music videos.   She's also been doing an unpaid internship for a well respected special effects artist here in Austin.  We all know she has what it takes to do this for a living, but now she really needs our help!   Jessie has a really big opportunity coming up, but she needs to be a unionized film industry worker in order to qualify.  It costs $1,000.00 to be a member, and Jessie is spread so thin trying to make ends meet with many low-paying or non-paying gigs that it seems nearly impossible for her to come up with this on her own in the necessary time frame (one month!).  So...LETS HELP!!!  Jessie is always the first person to want to help everyone else, so I'd love for us to be able to make this happen for her so she doesn't have to feel so stressed out.
IF THE CAMPAIGN GOES OVER $1,000.00, THE MONEY WILL GO TOWARD A FILM-WORTHY KIT FOR JESSIE TO WORK WITH!!!  
She needs a tremendous amount of supplies, but we didn't want to ask for too much in case we didn't reach our goal.  If you continue to contribute after the goal is reached, it will still be put to great use, so please feel free!


Here's what you can do:

  • Throw some cash her way!  Anything is great...just please include your name when you contribute!  I think it would really mean a lot for her to see how many people believe in her and her talent!
  • Do NOT mention this campaign to her!  When the two weeks is up, we'll expose all of this to Jessie so she can see what we all did, but until then, lets keep this under wraps so it's a surprise.

story:
My name is Jaymee, and I'm a pansexual non-binary 4th year illustration student at KCAD!

I've always loved creating merch, and I love the internet. Why not combine the two? Unfortunately, I'm a poor art college student who can't afford to drop eight hundo to get these made, so here's where I turn to indiegogo!

Basically, how this is gonna work is I need to cover manufacturing costs. Manufacturing is going to cost around $600. The reason I'm asking for $800 is to cover the fees IGG takes, and to cover shipping so i can mail all these out to you! I'm hoping to get 100 of each pin made, but if i surpass the goal i'll obviously get more made! These pins will be 1" gunmetal plated hard enamel.

Of course, there are perks to supporting this fund! If you support these pins being made early, you can get them for $2-$3 cheaper than everyone else! The full pack of 3 is $20, normally the full pack will be $22. Each individual pin is $8, normally they would be $10.

If you can't support monitarily, then sharing/posting this wherever you can really helps! Tell a friend, tell your dog, tell your aunt's cousin's grandmother's goldfish, I don't care! PLEASE help me spread the word and get these pins funded!

You can choose to get the full set of three, or just one! Each pin will have its own unique backing card (i don't quite have the art done for those yet, it's a secret shh) and a number (1/50), and the set will have its own backing card (shown in the picture) and a number (1/50). If you choose either individual pins or the full set, you will get a signed card from me (with a lil doodle on it), some yummy candies, and some hand-made stickers (to match the pins)! I will also include locking pin backs for each pin you order so that they don't fall off of your jacket/bag/purse/etc! Locking pin backs are essential, trust me.

story:
"Face the person you were before and the person you have become"

We (Kari Leigh & BB Fou Fou) have been crafting a healing offering known as MERCURY CHAMBER -- A multimedia space to stimulate all of the senses, explore the nebulousness of headspace, experiment in a cosmic wizard's temple and emerge anew. This mind palace will materialize in September at Barbershop Theater and we are reaching outward to our community to ask for help in making this chamber a reality. This appeal for funds will go towards keeping the installation affordable to all, paying the artists' for our work and supplies as well as helping out our friends at Barbershop who were forced to cancel all upcoming events for the foreseeable future. In return for your contribution to the creation of this space, we have designed some small gifts to say thank you: stickers, postcards, spirit candles, and hand-engraved refillable lighters for our biggest supporters, plus each donation over $5 receives admission to the event (time permitting) as well as an entry to win one of the installation pieces from the chamber.

  • We are shooting for the goal of $2k to split equally between supplies, artists and venue. Any additional funds will have a portion donated to Teens 4 Equality.
  • $5+ donations receive a sticker designed by the artists and one admission to the event (time permitting).
  • $10+ donations receive a sticker and postcard designed by the artists and admission to the event (time permitting).
  • $30+ donations receive a sticker, postcard and spirit candle designed by the artists and admission to the event (time permitting).
  • $50+ donations receive a sticker, postcard, spirit candle and hand-engraved matte-black refillable lighter designed by the artists and two admissions to the event. 

     

Some additional info about this event:

  • A maximum of 2 humans are permitted at a time in the temple, by appointment only and masks required

  •  

    Your time in the portal may range from 30 - 60 minutes depending on usage

     

  • A portion of ticket sales for this event will benefit Teens 4 Equality

  • The chamber is handicap accessible and appropriate for ages 13 and u

  • Discount admission for BIPOC humans and youth ages 13 - 17

  • Temple keepers will be sure to follow utmost safety in virus precautions

  • Donors will be contacted regarding their entrance to the chamber starting September 1st with admittance beginning September 10th, show closes September 24th
     

Some info about the artists:

Kari Leigh Ames is an inter-dimensional magician who works in a multitude of mediums & co-founder of Far Out Nashville's annual solstice celebration. BB Fou Fou is front-person for Nashville-based Primary Sound and wand-wielding wizard of High Thought and Visions.

please share with those who would might be interested in exploring this intimate installation!

story:
Short Summary

I have been photographing the human body for the past 30 years. Much of my work originates from my mental approach to image production—from the myriad paintings I produce, textures I create, and photographs I take. The resulting images include allusions to the material by which the models are absorbed or into which they disappear.

I find contentment with the use of more than the single image. With the combination of multitude images, my work strives to present the incongruous dualities of beauty and ugliness, change and transformation, dream and reality, human and nature. The power of mythology in our complex universe fascinates me and in many ways my work is simply trying to make sense of our own existence, from life to death.

This will be my ninth book, but the first comprehensive retrospective of all my work to date!

I’ve created all kinds of incentives, from small to big—signed books and prints of images from the book, limited edition unique folios, and even photo session in my studio.

****Please note the book will not be shipped until March 2018***

Your contribution will help showcasing John Bernhard’s work to a broader and creatively informed audience, keeping the journey moving forward and continue the dream.

 

Book Details

Foreword: 

  • Steven Evans is Executive Director of FotoFest in Houston, TX.

Contributors:

  • Bill Kouwenhoven is an Independent Photography Critic in New York City.
  • Dr. Anselm Zurfluh is the former director of the Museum of the Swiss Abroad, Geneva. 
  • Dr. Marc Robert is a Professor in Chemical Engineering at Rice University in Houston, TX.
  • Marc Douglass is a Writer and Co-Pastor at the University of Montana. 
  • Holly Walrath is a Freelance Editor in Houston, TX.
  • Excerpts: Multiple contributors

Details:

  • Book design: John Bernhard
  • Hardcover Book with tipped on photo on deboss cotton cloth and foil stamped title.
  • HUGE 12”x12” inches (30.5 x 30.5cm) 
  • 244 pages with 222 plates
  • High quality 105lb gloss paper  (150.5g/m2)
  • Retail price: $85 US
  • Publication date: March 2018
  • Distribution Worldwide from USA

 

Book and 5 Prints

You’ll receive Five Signed limited edition archival prints. The Museum quality set includes the following artworks: Nudewood, The Dive, Marfa #2, Stone #13, Blue Marble # 25. (14”x11” inches). The set comes in a black folio with the name John Bernhard silver foil stamped on the cover. (Edition of 10) 

 

 

LET’S MAKE SOME NOISE!!!

I hope that this project will engage you and thank you so much for your contribution!

Other Ways You Can Help:

If you can’t contribute, that doesn’t mean you can’t help: Please share this campaign with your friends on facebook, twitter or send to your email contacts who you think might be interested in photography.

The Indiegogo share tools on this site can help get the word out!

Help us make some NOISE!

Thank you so much for your support!

story:
Me: I am a 26 year old artist and transman living just outside London, England. I love animals, nature, cartoons, reading, cooking, and ice cream.

The campaign: I am making an animation, around thirty minutes long, telling the stories of four trans people - two male and two female - who are at different stages of their transitions. The purposes of the project are numerous:

  1. to reach out and give support to people who are questioning their gender or beginning their journey
  2. to support and educate families and friends of trans people
  3. to promote the education of trans issues which are very often overlooked
  4. to bring an artistic and creative element to this education
  5. to open opportunities for transgender people to be paid for their creative work - I will be hiring trans musicians to make the sound track and trans voice actors, among other things

The animation will be a mixture of drawings and collage, and figures and models. It will be entirely handmade, and at 24 frames a second for 30 minutes, this adds up to 43,200 individual images!Your donations will help to fund an exciting, ground breaking project that could reach out to thousands of people in need of support.

Where your donations will go: Funds are needed primarily for computer software to put the animation's audio and visual elements together. In addition to this, donations will cover the cost of hiring musicians to write and record original music, and voice actors.
Also needed is, of course, the huge amount of paper, scissors, glue, pens, ink, spray paint, tweezers, wire, tape, paint brushes, etc, that will go in to producing over 40,000 handmade frames of animation!
Funds also will go to the production of DVDs and the cost of sending these out to LGBTQ charities and support groups. 
If the campaign doesn't reach its full financial target, any funds raised will still go towards the production of the film.

What you get: Perks range from a big thank you, through one off pieces of art, and on to me coming to your house and using my many years of chef experience to cook a three course meal for you and a couple of your mates!
See the perks list on the right for full details.

Everyone who donates will be mentioned in the credits of the film!

Why I am making this film: When I began to question my gender in my teens, there were no resources available to me. I didn't even know what 'transgender' meant until I realised I was transgender myself. As a result of this, I was left feeling depressed, scared, and like there was something really wrong with me. If the availability of this film can make other people aware that they are not alone and that there are other people like them, that will be a wonderful thing.

There is still so much prejudice and ignorance surrounding gender change. The progression of gay rights is fantastic, but the T in LGBT is being left far behind, The only way to fight ignorance is though education, and this animation can help that education.

Other ways to help:I know that not not everyone is able to donate, and just tweeting, sharing, reblogging, and telling your friends about the campaign is a great help!

This is an entirely not - for - profit project. I am not getting paid, and I will not be charging groups and charities for the film.

story:
CoDM in Multimedia is a Cutting-Edge Program that Puts the Subject of the Black Male Image On Stage - By sharing images, film, text and music that illustrate the complexities of life as a black male in America and beyond, this multimedia program is designed to encourage discourse on the subject of the black male image.

CoDM in Multimedia brings together diverse visual and performing artists whose work seeks to impact public perception of black men and reposition how black men are viewed.

  • CoDM in Multimedia will feature the musical impresario, King Britt, who will improvise to films by notable photographer/filmmakers Larry Cook, Rashid Johnson, Alexis Peskine, and Jefferson Pinder, with narrations by nationally acclaimed poet, Major Jackson.

  • AND a musical performance by DC's own The Cornel West Theory.

  • Your support will help bring together this impressive group of musicians, filmmakers, and poets for a one night performance at The Lincoln Theatre on December 12, 2014 that is FREE and open to the public. The Lincoln Theater is located at 1215 U St NW, Washington, DC 20009 

  • Click Here to reserve your free tickets to the event.


What We Need & What You Get

So why do we need $10,000?

  • Bringing together this many talents is ambitious. It takes a lot of hard work and money. We need your financial support to help make it possible. The money we raise will go toward production and marketing costs, such a fees for the stage crew and graphic designer, and printing for postcard invitations and concert booklet. With such a unique line-up, we also want to make sure we document the performance so some of the funds will go toward a videographer for the evening. Anything extra we raise will go toward printing portfolios documenting the CoDM project, featuring the imagery and poems from the billboards that are now on display throughout Washington, DC

  • We want you to know how much we appreciate your support! If you make a donation we'll show you how thankful we are by offering these great perks:

    1. CoDM merch including T-shirts and Postcards

    2. CD of the recordings from the five CoDM billboards featuring audio with artist and project information and  recitations of the selected poems.

    3. Limited Edition Archival Prints from a CoDM artist,

    4. A Special portfolio documenting the entire project with images.
       

Other Ways You Can Help

Can't contribute financially, but you still want to support this campaign?

  • Help us get the word out and make some noise about your campaign.
  • Use one of the indiegogo share tools and spread the word via Social Media.
  • If you have a blog or email list you send to, let us know and we can send you a widget to include.

Ceremonies of Dark Men is part of 5×5: A Project of
The DC Commission on the Arts and Humanities.
CoDM was curated and produced by A.M. Weaver.

story:
Odessa is a progressive, community-based arts organization that works to support emerging artists. Odessa’s mission is to enhance the cultural experience of its Memphis community and specifically the Broad Ave Arts District by providing forward-thinking emerging artists with a progressive and supportive open environment.  We are presently seeking non profit-status and are actively programming and promoting new media, such as video, performance, and installation, as well as traditional forms of work.

 

Located in a burgeoning arts community on Broad Avenue in Memphis, Odessa is the only gallery in Memphis that is solely focused on fostering the work and careers of emerging artists, regardless of their age.   Our aspiration is to create a sustainable, affordable, and inviting space for artists that are early in their careers, particularly with regard to exhibiting work.  Odessa is by design not prescriptive or discriminatory about a definition of what conforms to a traditional definition of art.  Rather, we recognize the unmet need in Memphis to broadly support the creative endeavors of a nascent, but potentially powerful, emerging artist community.

 

Odessa originated in Memphis in 2008.  However, its current management has been responsible for its development and operations since April 2010.  Ashle Bailey, recent graduate of Memphis College of Art, was asked by a group of other forward-thinking Memphians to head the role of Art Director for the space. Towards the end of 2010, the space  became primarily focused on the gallery aspect of Odessa, allowing Bailey to be the lead conductor of the alternative organization, with the help of her better half: Adam Gilreath.  The creative couple knew first-hand the need for such an open and non-discriminative space in Memphis, away from the mainstream establishments that had become so institutionalized.  In the last 12 months, Odessa has established itself as an essential member of the Memphis arts community and is a vital component to the continued revitalization and rebirth of the Broad Avenue Arts District. Odessa was recognized with a grant from the Tennessee Arts Commission (via ArtsMemphis’ Arts Build Communities program) to commission a new mural on the side of our building.

 

Odessa produces approximately three one-night shows per month, each of which draw upwards of forty attendees. These shows include group and solo art exhibitions, installations, one-time-only shopping opportunities, movie screenings, and musical showcases. Our intent is to cultivate an atmosphere that will provide new opportunities for connecting and networking artists at all stages of their careers. 

 

Odessa believes that our creative community must have a regular outlet to foster inspiration and productive dialog with the larger community.  Therefore, we purposefully program events as often as possible to continuously create an inviting and encouraging environment for the benefit of artists and the public alike.

 

With the proper support, Odessa has the vision and ability to play a significant role in shaping the future of Memphis’ arts community. Specifically:

 

1. Based on a successful year of programming and community-building, we believe that we can expand our efforts and grow as an organization – which includes diversifying our revenue streams beyond artists’ gallery fees.  Over the last year, we have only been able to have single-night showings of each artist’s work, although we hope to sustain a more regular gallery program with longer showings as well as regular gallery hours.

 

2. We want to partner with public schools and non-profit organizations that focus specifically on reaching out to our community’s youth to provide free gallery exhibition opportunities to an even younger generation of emerging Memphis artists.

 

However, we cannot accomplish these objectives, nor sustain our commitment to our mission of supportive emerging Memphis artists, without help from our community. In order for Odessa to evolve while still providing our unique and supportive environment for future generations of Memphis artists, we must have the resources to focus on them – not our month-to-month overhead expenses.  Your contributions to our mission will preserve an essential, arts-oriented anchor in a quickly developing urban neighborhood while supporting a larger segment of Memphis’ creative class at the same time.

 

HOW YOU CAN HELP!

Currently, Odessa needs to raise enough money to sustain our organization for the remaining months of May, June, and July to ensure that the shows that have been already scheduled can proceed. Our expenses each month are as follows:


  • $800 for rent 
  • $150-$200 for utilities
  • $150 for cleaning supplies, toiletries, paint, spackle, and hanging supplies (gallery essentials)


This brings our total monthly expenses to $1,150.00. 


Odessa, as stated earlier, has an average of three shows per month, with a gallery rental fee of $100.00 per show.  This brings in a revenue of  roughly $300.00, which is substantially less than our monthly expenses.  Why not raise the rental fee? That is because Odessa aims to be an affordable space for emerging, and often 'starving', artists that cannot afford the space rental most other galleries charge.

With enough regular funding, we would be able to eliminate this fee all together, allowing these artists to have this experience for free. 


Please consider becoming one of our supporters, because your help is greatly needed right now.  Your contribution will help pay our monthly rent and utilities while allowing us to expand our regular programming and share more of our artists’ work with a larger audience.  You will be guaranteeing a home for experimental and ambitious creative expression in Memphis that quite literally has nowhere else to go in our city.  While our surrounding neighborhood continues to evolve and diversify every week, securing a venue where ambitious art can thrive is more and more vital.

 

Odessa fills this need. We exist to support artists in Memphis, and we hope you will join us in that mission.
