story:
So What is a Tiny House?

Tiny, or micro, houses are itty bitty homes that utilize space in a unique way. The model that I will be building is only 130 sq ft, and fits onto an 7' x 18' flatbed trailer. More specifically, the design that I will be using is a Tumbleweed Tiny House "Fencl." Tumbleweed is a really fantastic group of people, and you can learn more about them here: http://www.tumbleweedhouses.com/

Why Do This At All? And Who The Heck Is Baba Yaga?

Several months ago, I wrote an article for Tumbleweed on this very topic, and I've re-posted it below.
 

If I were forced to provide a single, unqualified answer to the question, “Why are you building a tiny house?” I would have to say: instant love. I was 8 years old when I first saw the inside of an RV trailer, while on a road trip with my parents. Afterwards I demanded of my mother, “Why don’t we live in one of these?” On some level I was wounded. My parents had always known about these perfect, tiny, ship-like houses on wheels, and had chosen to abide in our irritatingly stationary home instead.

Perhaps this instant love of mine was influenced by my fascination with hobos during the Great Depression. I didn’t understand the economic desperation or the myth of the West that had created these men. I only saw that they were tough, that they had what it took to ride the trains. They were free. Somehow the ideas of homelessness, wheeled vehicles, and the ability to carry your home with you became crossed in my mind. An RV seemed to embody both that feeling of home and the ability to leave home to my 8-year-old self.

My childhood dream of living in an RV eventually subsided, and I moved on to other pursuits. Skip forward a decade or so, to the day when I stumbled on the website for the Tumbleweed Tiny House Company. And it happened again. I was instantly, irrevocably in love. And this time it was less impractical. In fact, it seemed that here was the answer to many of my personal dilemmas: how to live sustainability in a culture of consumerism that was simultaneously facing a housing crisis, how to travel the road and feel safe, and how to have my own home while moving across the country for graduate school. I was in love with the aesthetic of Tumbleweed, and with the lifestyle it seemed to offer.

Shortly after I had made the somewhat wild decision to actually build my own house, I began to connect the project to my academic interests. My fields are religious studies and anthropology, and I realized that the tiny house could be studied as material culture, with my own experience as the basis of anthropological research. So I’ve started to study sacred architecture as well as building science, and I hope to one day include my tiny house experience as part of a graduate thesis proposal.

As a woman, a Jew, a woodworker, and the anthropologist conducting a mild field study on myself, several questions have been raised so far. How significant is it, in this day and age, for a woman to be working in construction, or even to be building her own house? What does it mean to be an American Jewish craftsperson, when almost the entirety of my family’s material culture was lost in the pogroms and the Holocaust? What does it mean to live in a home purposely built for wandering, when the anti-Semitic legend of “The Wandering Jew” has been around since the Middle Ages?

I woke up in the middle of the night a few months ago, jerked awake with the force of one thought: I am building Baba Yaga’s house. Baba Yaga (roughly translated to “demon grandmother”) is a Russian fairytale character, a witch who lives in a house on chicken legs. She is a symbol of Russia. So why am I building her house? As I build, I’m also attempting to deconstruct the folk tale of Baba Yaga, in order to shed some light on my own roots, and my own desire to build a little house in the woods. It is a house that walks, and is full of either danger or help, for those who know how to ask for it.

 

“Little hut, little hut, stand with your back to the woods, and your front to me!”

 

And the hut turns around, and the protagonist enters. This is the beginning of my tiny house journey. Possibly some of my questions with be answered, or there may be new questions raised. But in the meantime, I’m building, researching, and documenting my tiny Baba Yaga house.

The Beginning of the Journey

This summer, I will begin building my tiny house. I am planning on doing the entire thing myself, which means with the help of my friends and community but very little input from paid professionals. The first step is to purchase a Big Tex 18' flatbed trailer, which runs approximately $2,500 and is the single most expensive purchase I will be making on this project. By contributing at this time you will be aiding in laying the foundation of my new home.
story_txt:
So What is a Tiny House?
Tiny, or micro, houses are itty bitty homes that utilize space in a unique way. The model that I will be building is only 130 sq ft, and fits onto an 7' x 18' flatbed trailer. More specifically, the design that I will be using is a Tumbleweed Tiny House "Fencl." Tumbleweed is a really fantastic group of people, and you can learn more about them here: http://www.tumbleweedhouses.com/


Why Do This At All? And Who The Heck Is Baba Yaga?
Several months ago, I wrote an article for Tumbleweed on this very topic, and I've re-posted it below.
 

If I were forced to provide a single, unqualified answer to the question, “Why are you building a tiny house?” I would have to say: instant love. I was 8 years old when I first saw the inside of an RV trailer, while on a road trip with my parents. Afterwards I demanded of my mother, “Why don’t we live in one of these?” On some level I was wounded. My parents had always known about these perfect, tiny, ship-like houses on wheels, and had chosen to abide in our irritatingly stationary home instead.
Perhaps this instant love of mine was influenced by my fascination with hobos during the Great Depression. I didn’t understand the economic desperation or the myth of the West that had created these men. I only saw that they were tough, that they had what it took to ride the trains. They were free. Somehow the ideas of homelessness, wheeled vehicles, and the ability to carry your home with you became crossed in my mind. An RV seemed to embody both that feeling of home and the ability to leave home to my 8-year-old self.
My childhood dream of living in an RV eventually subsided, and I moved on to other pursuits. Skip forward a decade or so, to the day when I stumbled on the website for the Tumbleweed Tiny House Company. And it happened again. I was instantly, irrevocably in love. And this time it was less impractical. In fact, it seemed that here was the answer to many of my personal dilemmas: how to live sustainability in a culture of consumerism that was simultaneously facing a housing crisis, how to travel the road and feel safe, and how to have my own home while moving across the country for graduate school. I was in love with the aesthetic of Tumbleweed, and with the lifestyle it seemed to offer.
Shortly after I had made the somewhat wild decision to actually build my own house, I began to connect the project to my academic interests. My fields are religious studies and anthropology, and I realized that the tiny house could be studied as material culture, with my own experience as the basis of anthropological research. So I’ve started to study sacred architecture as well as building science, and I hope to one day include my tiny house experience as part of a graduate thesis proposal.
As a woman, a Jew, a woodworker, and the anthropologist conducting a mild field study on myself, several questions have been raised so far. How significant is it, in this day and age, for a woman to be working in construction, or even to be building her own house? What does it mean to be an American Jewish craftsperson, when almost the entirety of my family’s material culture was lost in the pogroms and the Holocaust? What does it mean to live in a home purposely built for wandering, when the anti-Semitic legend of “The Wandering Jew” has been around since the Middle Ages?
I woke up in the middle of the night a few months ago, jerked awake with the force of one thought: I am building Baba Yaga’s house. Baba Yaga (roughly translated to “demon grandmother”) is a Russian fairytale character, a witch who lives in a house on chicken legs. She is a symbol of Russia. So why am I building her house? As I build, I’m also attempting to deconstruct the folk tale of Baba Yaga, in order to shed some light on my own roots, and my own desire to build a little house in the woods. It is a house that walks, and is full of either danger or help, for those who know how to ask for it.
 
“Little hut, little hut, stand with your back to the woods, and your front to me!”
 
And the hut turns around, and the protagonist enters. This is the beginning of my tiny house journey. Possibly some of my questions with be answered, or there may be new questions raised. But in the meantime, I’m building, researching, and documenting my tiny Baba Yaga house.


The Beginning of the Journey
This summer, I will begin building my tiny house. I am planning on doing the entire thing myself, which means with the help of my friends and community but very little input from paid professionals. The first step is to purchase a Big Tex 18' flatbed trailer, which runs approximately $2,500 and is the single most expensive purchase I will be making on this project. By contributing at this time you will be aiding in laying the foundation of my new home.

story:
HI  

We are an award-winning team of young interior designers and architects who share the same passion for design. 

 

HI! DIMITRIS, AIMON, CHRISTINE, MANOLIS, NATHALIE, MYRSINI, THALIA

THE PROJECT

“Interiors Revisited” is a project about creating a portfolio that consists of interior design solutions in affordable prices. The project begun by observing the hesitation of people to consult an interior designer in order to make the maximum visual change with the minimum structural interventions in their spaces.

THE PORTFOLIO

The portfolio will consist of interior design proposals for everyday people, based on real spaces and budgets. In order to prove that interior design can be affordable we need to undertake as many real spaces to decorate as possible. All projects upon completion will also be presented (nameless) at mydezigner.co.uk among other paradigms of interior design solutions. The projects will also be presented in an ebook version. 

E BOOK

HOW IT WORKS  

Each proposal in the final published portfolio will consist of a plan view of the proposal, a written description and a 3d visualization of the space.

As we mentioned earlier, in order to materialize this project we will need as many spaces to work on. This is where you come in. Upon funding you can send us photos and some basic dimensions of a chosen space (up to 100 m² or 1000 ft²) you would like to refresh.  

 

We have also created a list of interior design styles, so you can choose which style fits you best: 

  • Contemporary 
  • Country 
  • Industrial
  • Minimal 
  • Modern
  • Mydezigner proposal*

* None of the above style fits you? No worries! We are going to design an ideal space for you based on the drawings and photos you’ll send us. 

THE FUNDING

Our first target is to include 10 completed projects in this portfolio, but we are more than happy to make our portfolio bigger and propose cozier spaces for you.  

Note that each designer of our team needs about 3 days to complete the layout, 2d and 3d drawings for each space you send us.  

Please make sure you send all the information as soon as possible and not later than 2 months after the funding period ends. We will be processing the proposals to you in the order we are receiving your information. Supporters will receive a personal estimation about our delivery time for their reward. We will keep you updated on the progress of our work.

REWARDS


POSTER

E BOOK

WRITTEN DESCRIPTION 

PLAN VIEW

 

3D VIEW

 

If you want to learn more about us, please visit www.mydezigner.co.uk

You can also join us on our Facebook page www.facebook.com/Mydezigner.

Thank you for supporting us in the creation of an inspiring design portfolio.

Dimitris, Aimon, Christine, Manolis, Nathalie, Myrsini, Thalia

 

NOTE

We have estimated that for the completion of each project we need about 1 day. If we have the opportunity to receive over 50 projects there are going to be some delays in the delivery time for each proposal.

 

FAQ:

1. What information do I need to send you in order to produce a 2d or 3d drawing of my proposed space?

Concerning that we are designing in 2d and 3d software environments, we need as many information as you can gather. The more you send us, the more accurate the drawings will be. If you have a plan of the space, the floor height and up to 10 photos taken from different views, would be perfect for us. If you don’t have a plan, then do a quick sketch outline of your space, note some basic measurements and the floor height on it and then take up to 10 photos from different viewpoints. Send them to us and will do the rest for you.

2. Are there any limitations about the total area of the space that I can send? 

Due to the amount of work that has to be done in the specific time, we can only accept spaces with total area up to 100 m² (1000 ft²). More specific: The rewards are valid for only one space that is up to 100 m² (1000 ft²). If you wish to redecorate more than one space and also help us in the creation of a richer portfolio then feel free to back us more than once.

 3. How much time do you need to complete a project?

Each designer of our team needs about 3 days to complete the layout, 2d and 3d drawings for each space you send us. 3 members of our team will do such a work so we estimate that each proposal needs 1 day to be completed.

4. Where and when do I send my photos and sketch?

So you have already chosen a perk containing a proposal of ours for one of your spaces ! You can send everything at info@mydezigner.co.uk as soon as you can. The sooner the better since we will be getting on with it immediately, although all proposals will be delivered to you (and included in the eBook and poster in case its one of the 3d packages) at the delivery dates noted under each specific perk !

story:
Mitchieâ€™s Gallery is blessed and honored to have served the Austin community for over 24 years now.

During their existence - the gallery has given back to the community by providing weekly children programs to include story time with sign language, science tutoring, monthly art workshops, monthly poetry for the entire family, Easter Egg Art Workshop, annual photos with Santa Claus, and a host of other events - all at no charge.

Mitchieâ€™s Gallery has allowed the community to use their conference room and meeting areas for a variety of events such as town hall meetings, political rallies, book signings, artist shows, health fairs and stage plays, just to give a few examples. And again - all at no charge. They have provided numerous donations and facilitated event ticket sales to event for promoters at no charge. In 1991, Mitchieâ€™s Gallery became the first African American owned retail center in Austin to be designated as a early mobile voting location.

*Mitchie's Gallery extensive accomplishments and support for the community is literally too long and extensive to capture in a list. They are the largest and oldest African American retail gallery in Austin, Texas - and have transcended being a business and in fact they are a community staple and centralized gathering point.

Due to plummeting store sales brought on by the economy and extended multiple absences because of the owner's (Joyce Adejumo) health - Mitchieâ€™s Gallery may soon be forced to close their doors forever. Joyce was blessed to survive a Pulmonary Embolism last year. However, it has required her to make numerous hospital visits and attend Pulmonary Rehab three times a week for the last two months.

Joyce has used her personal savings over the last several months to cover the gaps between the store's income and operating expenses. The combination of declining store sales and increased personal health expenses has depleted all of her personal savings.

It is at this point that the community is rallying our collective resources to do our part and prevent Mitchie's Gallery from closing; but beyond helping Mitchie's Gallery during their time of financial need - we are banding together to return their extensive support and love for the community and give Mitchie's Gallery their flowers now!

All of Austin and friends all over the world are invited to join us in the Biggest Rent Party Austin has ever seen!

We know the current economy has been rough on all of us. But in the Kwanzaa spirit of Ujamaa - or cooperative economics - a little bit from all of us will get the job done! Mitchie's Gallery has an IMMEDIATE financial need of $15,000 to relieve the pressure and keep their doors open.

Here's how you can help:

If you are able to - RIGHT NOW - at any amount - please make a financial contribution that goes directly to the gallery's Paypal Account.

If you have any art, framing or afro-centric gift purchases you need to make, please make a concerted effort to do so THIS WEEK. The gallery now has extended hours from 10a- until 9p, Monday - Saturday and will be open on Sundays from 1:30 - 6p until they have met their funding goals.

Join the gallery on Saturday, February 4, 2012, from 1:30-6p. Mitchieâ€™s Gallery will be kicking off Austin's Black History Month with full day cultural events and Old Fashioned Rent Party benefiting the gallery. The event will host a variety of activities to include live music and entertainment by renowned visual artist LaShun Beal, who will be selling his originals, limited editions, home essentials and other collectibles; vocal artist includes Jazz vocalist Pamela Hart, Funk and Jazz Band â€œAll U Need Jazz and R&B Band,â€ NeoSoul & R&B vocalist Courtney Sanchez, Youth music group â€œSoul Tree Collective,â€ and special guest Jazz trumpeter Kyle Turner; poetry hosted by South Flavs Entertainment - just to name a few. It you are unable to make it, please mail a check to Mitchieâ€™s Gallery, 7801 North Lamar Blvd. Bldg. B Ste. 148, Austin, Texas 78759.

If you are not able to make a donation here on Indie Go-Go, please come by the gallery and make a purchase or join us at the Biggest Rent Party in Austin - you can still be a tremendous help to us by sharing this message and link among your personal and professional networks.

With your help, financial support and prayers - we will be able to help Mitchie's Gallery continue to serve the community for years to come!

The Official Program Schedule

1:00 pm - LIVE Radio Remote with KAZI 88.7 FM, Radio and Talk Show Host, Steve Savage

1:30p Prayer â€“ Hannah Hooks, Associated Pastor of Metropolitan A.M.E. Church

1:30 - 8p - Renowned African American Artist â€“ LaShun Beal

1:45p Community Spotlight
Rep. Dawnna Dukes, TX House Representative District 46
Judge Yvonne Williams, Justice of the Peace, Pct 1 Travis County
Judge Cliff Brown, 147th Criminal District Court
Stanley Wilson, Travis County Property Tax Office

2:30p Spoken Word/Poetry South Flavas Entertainment â€“ Hosted by Herman Mason

3:15p Dance Group Flava Dance Company â€“ Hosted by Leola Smith

4:00 pm Readings Jeanette Hill, Producer and Playwright -â€œHarriet Tubman, From Slavery Til Todayâ€

Musical Entertainment 5:00pm - 8:00pm (In Order of Appearance) Soul Tree Collective All You Need Pamela Hart Courtney Sanchez Kyle Turner

To view the full flyer click on this link: http://www.mitchie.com/catalog/articles.php?tPa...

â€œNow unto him that is able to do exceeding abundantly above all that we ask or think, according to the power that worketh in usâ€ Ephesians 3:20 (KJV)

Click here to view the event flyer: http://www.mitchie.com/catalog/articles.php?tPa...

*(Click link to view our community awards: http://www.mitchie.com/catalog/articles.php?tPa... )

story:
Good day to you!

My name is Mr. David Dolittle. You may be very well familiar with my dear grandfather, Doctor John Dolittle, a veterinarian who could speak to animals and took it upon himself to learn their somewhat uncouth but altogether endearing languages. Responsible for the first Oxford Meow-Meow Dictionary and deciphering that the Call of the Wild actually translated to, “I am actually an indoor wolf, please let me back inside,” my dear grandfather certainly had his merits and array of accomplishments, yet he could be a hard-boiled egg at times, especially in his latter years when he tried speaking to one and I was forced to enter with him a hard-fought chicken vs. egg debate. While my dear grandfather yearned for me to follow in the field of mathematics, engineering, or science, I was determined to study art. I took after the great Henry Meow-tisse and Pablo Pekingese-o, and trained fervently to depict how animals wanted to be seen, as I was given the great gift of animal-talk as well.

I come to you today, after a summit meeting with all of our beloved fur-balls and feather-heads, scaley friends and flippers. After discussing with the other members of this magnificent Animal Kingdom, what I have come to find that they really want, besides more gourmet tuna and at least 20% more attention a day, is to be immortalized in the great historical pantheon of art. They have come to me and woofed, meowed or otherwise called out in some form that no onomatopeia could properly transcribe, and asked you, their beloved owner, for the cutest, lovable portrait in the most high of fashion stylings. I must say my dialogues with our kindred animal family suggest that they prefer fun, lively portraits, maybe visiting far-off destinations or conversely, galavanting in the yard at home.

It is my hope to establish Mr. David Dolittle's Peculiar Menagerie of Painted Portraits & Things, Inc., and with your generous benefaction and support, I can realize this artistic operation and open my practice here in the wonderful city of New York. The $3,000 will enable me to open up an illustration practice, from purchasing artist materials, creating an official website, keeping a studio space in the city, and spreading publicity about my artworks. As an artist and animal aficionado, who can tell you what Spot really wants (he abhors running), we can work together to create unique and one-of-a-kind paintings of your pets. Please help me to open Mr. David Dolittle's Peculiar Menagerie of Painted Portraits & Things, Inc.!


david.dolittle.portraits@gmail.com

story:
The project is to fund and enhance an art show featuring a wide variety of work created with and inspired by McDonald's Food. Conceptually, the reason behind the show is to comically highlight the parallels between Ancient Egypt, McDonald's Food, and Modern Society. Some of the more interesting pieces include a hamburger that is over a year old and a life sized mummy made of McDonald's food. In the future I would also like to expand this art show to encompass many different aspects of popular culture and add my own style to them as well.

A short explanation of the reasoning behind the show is as follows.

1. Ancient Egypt was preoccupied with achieving a form of immortality through odd customs such as constructing pyramids and mummification.

2. Modern society is preoccupied with achieving a form of immortality through odd customs such as celebrity status and the construction of corporations.

3. McDonald's is highly representative of American culture, even iconic.

4. McDonald's food doesn't decompose if left to dry out. Seriously, just google it. As such archaeologists from the future will be digging this stuff up thousands of years in the future. Especially if something cataclysmic happens to our society.

5. The questions. What could that something cataclysmic be? How can we prepare for it? Do we still want to invest in distractions instead of real solutions and in each other?

6. And finally, if we don't learn to laugh at ourselves future generations are going to do it for us.

Currently I have two McDonald's food mummies completed and would like to make many more. Other works include preserved hamburgers in commercial plastic cases, McDonald's food skulls, and large scale paintings. The funds generated here will be used to purchase more materials, to pay for gas to haul everything from place to place, and to cover other expenses related to the show. Since I am based in Texas, the first shows will be within the state with later shows taking place across the country. If you are interested in booking the show for your gallery or you have any questions, feel free to ask.

Just in case some of you are unsure or on the fence about supporting this project, I'll talk a bit more about myself and what I would hope to accomplish with this and more in the future.

At my core I'm a joker who likes to get people thinking, always have been, always will be. With this Ancient McDonald's Food art show I feel that so far I have done that and can carry it much further as it and my career develops. I've noticed when people begin to take themselves less seriously and can experience the humorous connections between what were once considered harsh realities, they become open and aware of newer, more vibrant solutions. As such I would like to bring my brand of humor to fields such as pop, geek, and internet culture.

By funding this project you will also be helping me lay the foundation for other really cool endeavors that will more directly impact the world around us in a positive manner as well. Apart from art, sociology, and pop culture I'm really drawn towards engineering, computer science, and architecture. Some of my particular interests include constructing efficient and beautiful geodesic domes for habitation/agriculture, robotics for agriculture, video games that harness our creativity into real world solutions, and all manner of manufacturing.

Any amount helps, even $1 but if you want to really help me out I have some fantastic pieces that would fit well with any serious art collector. So if you're interested check it out, grab a piece of my art, and enjoy the ride. And if you can't help out financially but you want to see this project succeed, feel free to pass it along.

Thanks for your time,

-Ben

story:
Check out what you get here!

About Invisible City Audio Tours

Invisible City Audio Tours is a fiscally sponsored community-arts nonprofit that introduces new ways of experiencing literature, art, and geography by producing alternative self-guided walking audio tours. Each tour leads participants through liminal neighborhoods and forgotten or unknown histories, creating heretofore unseen realities through original works of fiction, poetry, music, sound, and visual art.

About The Armada of Golden Dreams

A surreal, literary-based, 60-minute audio tour that uncovers dozens of the vessels still buried beneath San Francisco's Financial District.

James Marshall’s discovery of gold at Coloma in 1848 set in motion a world-wide migration of fortune-seekers to the gold fields of California. In the first year of the gold rush, over 62,000 of those immigrants came by ship, landing in San Francisco and abandoning their vessels as fast as their legs could carry them.

By 1850, the bay held nearly 600 abandoned brigs, barks, ships, and whalers, left to rot by the starry-eyed Argonauts who had crowded aboard to reach their dreams. For most of the Gold Rush fleet, San Francisco was not only their last voyage, but their final mooring, as scores of those vessels still lie beneath the skyscrapers, restaurants, bars, and plazas of downtown San Francisco.

This spring, twelve Bay Area authors, one composer, three visual artists, and a team of designers will resurrect the history of this once mighty fleet.       

What We Need & What You Get

Invisible City Audio Tours is currently funded in part by a grant from Southern Exposure, which covers the cost of the visual art for this tour and our fall tour, Everywhere Man. However, there are many additional costs that we still need funding for.

Though $6,000 would cover the remaining costs for The Armada of Golden Dreams, we are hoping to raise even more. If we hit $7,500, we’ll be able to buy much-needed equipment. If we raise $10,000 or more, we'll be well on our way to funding future tours.

By donating, you get the chance to support a growing arts nonprofit that uses new technology and collaborative art to create surreal geographies, and you'll get some amazing, limited-edition Armada booty (click to see images)! You will find the donation levels to your right. You'll also get your name permanently engraved on our Supporters page!

How it Works

1. Donate to receive your Armada map (and other amazing booty). 

2. Once you receive your map in the mail, download the audio. You can either download the tour through our iPhone app or off the Armada page on our website.

3. Take the tour anytime! The tour begins at the foot of Market Street in San Francisco.

The Building of The Armada (The Backstory)

Five years ago, Armada's tour director L.J. Moore (author, poet, journalist) stumbled upon a map created by Ron Filion (SFGenealogy.com) that featured suspected locations of over 50 Gold Rush era ships buried beneath the streets of modern-day San Francisco.

After interviewing Filion for The Bold Italic, L.J. was haunted by the idea that scores of brigs, barks, and ships still sailed silently through the mud below the city grid, and that somehow, there must be a way to resurrect the vessels which have carried the dreams of San Francisco on their decks for over 150 years. How could one illuminate this oft forgotten (and amazing) piece of San Francisco history?

LJ happened to mention the ships to us as we were finishing the production of our first tour, Heliography. It was a true Godsend! We could not have thought of a more appropriate project for us to take on. 

Within weeks after the launch of Heliography, we started building The Armada. LJ mapped the route and selected a group of her favorite local authors to write pieces for the ships, and before we knew it our staff composer Jesse Solomon Clark (Agents Del Futuro) had written and recorded a full-length album of music dedicated to the ships: "Underwater/Underground".

We then commissioned the ever-talented George Pfau, cartographers Lohnes+Wright, and designer Sarah Ciston to create the map. Simultaneously, art curator Clare Haggarty invited Joshua Churchill and Rebecca Ebeling to make art for the tour.

After all the audio was in, we brought sound designers Michael Maurillo and Jeremiah Moore in to create the audio.

story:
WHAT IS THIS PROJECT ABOUT:

THEEOTS.COM

At the age of 25, I went through a depressive episode. Everything was going good. Great. And, then just like that, everything changed. As a way to move forward from that instance, I developed a series of works that captured the quintessence of that pain and my struggle to define “self”. Each work tells a small instance of what happened and collectively they narrate the entire story.

Through Photography, Film and Mixed Media I will investigate how our society's social constructs cultivates one's understanding of self. Is it possible to operate outside our social norms? What would these images look like? Can the "self" survive independently without such constructs?   

I believe that Individuality is an aberration and without our social constructs-race, gender or classism-we have no sense of self. Ultimately I would like my images to ask, “to what credit do we give the individual?”

Some of the highlights from this project are "She Fell From Normalcy;" a 16mm experimental short about one girl’s fall from grace and venture into the wild. Following that is "The Manuscript;" a series of journal entries and notes documenting my life’s experiences over the past 3 years. These entries will be formatted in braille and turned it into a piece of art for the public’s disposal. Lastly, there is "Within-A Shadow of Self;" a photo-series that juxtaposes modern day examples of our society’s social constructs against subject matter devoid of it’s social weight.

With your help, I would like to present these works in my first solo show as an exhibiting fine artist.

To produce this project I need to raise $5000. Donate today! There are a host of incentives that I am providing folks who can help bring this idea to fruition. Share this on your facebook! Retweet this to your friends and colleagues. Anything that you can do now to help would make a tremendous impact on this project’s success. 

(Eye of the Storm logo T-shirts in sizes S, M, L and XL.)

Untitled #70 Screening at Maysles Documentary Center in Harlem

As part of EYE OF THE STORM, I will be screening Untitled #70 at the Maysles Documentary Center in Harlem. Untitled #70 is a Multi-media experimental Performance Piece that fuses experimental film, by Visual Artist, Christie Neptune; with performance art by recording artists Sky James and Xhris. In a 10min presentation I will give audiences a small insight into my forthcoming project, Eye of The Storm. Come out and see for your self what this project is about Thursday June 26th at 7pm. 


THURSDAY JUNE 26TH @ MAYSLES DOCUMENTARY CENTER 
7:30PM. $10 SUGGESTED DONATION . 
343 Lenox Avenue/Malcolm X Boulevard . 
ALL CONTRIBUTIONS GO TO THE EOTS INDIEGOGO. 
IGG.ME/AT/EOTS     | THEEOTS.COM

VISUAL ARTIST, CHRISTIE NEPTUNE CHRISTIENEPTUNE.COM

My name is Christie Neptune and I am a Brooklyn based Visual Artist. I received my B.A. in Visual Arts from Fordham University. I have exhibited at the 440 Gallery, the Greenpoint Gallery and the Rush Gallery in New York City among others. I work primarily with photography, film and mixed media and I use these mediums to create provocative images that challenge the limitations of self and individuality within the collective world.

Special Thanks: 

Thanks to Anthony Sylvester of and Gian Carlo for Cinematography and Sound. You guys did an awesome Job!!!!

RISK AND CHALLENGES: 

Like many projects, the final look that I have set out to achieve during preproduction, may not necessarily be the visual that unfolds in post. It may be even better! I may find another way to better narrate my message and story to the greater public. As a supporter of this project, understand that this project may evolve in lots of different ways and the final outcome may look different from what you expected.

Thank you for your support,

Christie Neptune

story:
Overview :

Who is Marchesa Casati?
Who am I? 
Our project
What we need
Perks
Impact + Risks Challenges
**UPDATE : our schedule **


LA MARCHESA CASATI ; WHO IS SHE? 

In the early 20th century, the Marchesa Casati held some of the most grand and luxurious parties for high society; invited guests included royalty and the rich and famous. She was the muse of notable artists such as Agustus John, Giovanni Boldini, Kees Van Dongen, Alberto Martini... as well as photographers such as Man Ray and Adolph De Meyer. She was dressed by Erté and Paul Poiret and was the direct inspiration of Cartier's panther design... She was possibly the most portrayed woman of the 20th century after the Virgin Mary and Cleopatra, appearing in over 300 art pieces...

Paintings, photographs, sculptures and wax figures could fill up an entire art gallery dedicated to La Casati. That said, for such a grand legend and provocative figure, what has become of her?

Before her decline and fall into poverty, she accumulated a personal debt of over 25 million. She was one of the wealthiest women in Europe and clearly the most notorious and scandalous woman of her day. Known for her eccentrics, she turned heads wherever she went, inspired artists, set trends… She wore live snakes as jewelry, painted her servants in gold leaf and infamously, was remembered for taking nude strolls at night, wearing nothing but her fur coats while walking her pet cheetahs. Casati’s striking features included her fire red hair, alabaster white skin, thin blood red lips and extremely large kohl ringed eyes.

WHO AM I?

Hi there! My name is Steben Alexander, I'm a student studying in  a professional photography  program here in Montreal.  

"Coming from a family of aspiring artists, Steben had the chance to develop his creativity at an early age. He found inspiration in 1920′s film noire as well as vintage 50′s Japanese horror films which attracted him to the dark and enigmatic figures and aesthetics. He soon found the works of Manray
and David Lachapelle, which introduced him to the world of photography.
At the young age of fifteen he was able to meet and eventually work
for photographer David Lachapelle’s muse Amanda Lepore amongst many others.... "

At the moment I am dividing my time between school and my artistic projects which includes my celebrity portrait series of Canadian figures who bring international recognition to our entertainment and art scenes, including my current focus a short film and photographic art series based on the life and legend of La Marchesa Casati.

With my great interest in art history and enigmatic figures it comes to no surprise of my admiration and constant flow of creativity  due to the most influential muse of the 20th century La Marchesa Casati....

------------

MY PROJECT

This campaign is meant to raise funds for my artistic short film and photographic series which will follow the life and legend of The Marchesa Casati and her quest to commission her own immortality. It will make references to artistic works she has appeared in, her life and historical events. Staying true to the legend of La Casati, Guests  at the premiere and exhibition will be surrounded by the luxuries and visual treats that she  would have provided her own guests.

 As this is my first major solo exhibition, the help and success of this campaign will guarantee the completion of my project. Which not only is very personal and important to me but also guarantees to keep the legend of a La Casati alive and promotes her influence into the 21st century to young art lovers and artists.

Short film : 

The short film will start in 1954 London towards the end of her life, when she was living in relative poverty; where she arrives at a social gathering. She is then raided by guests and photographed without permission by Cecil Beaton. People wonder who is this old dark enigmatic figure… A forgotten silent film star? An old eccentric widow? The name of La Casati is whispered among guests as she covers her face from the camera and flashes...

**Flashback **

Returning to her glory days and making references to historical figures, moments and artworks. A young Casati poses for notable artists such as Boldini, Agustus John, photographer Man Ray and dances at the Beaumont ball with her pet boa constrictor. She was on a quest to commission her own immortality!


What We Need 

**All  funding received will go directly to the production of the art work which includes the 7-10 min artistic short film and the 10-14 large format photographic art works. The goal is set relatively low as in reality a 10,000$ goal would be more realistic but due to the restricted time might not be possible.***

500-800 +$ Will be used for location rental at Le Château Dufresne in Montreal, which is an almost identical architecture replica of La Marchesa's Palais Rose in France and plays a very important role for this project. (Note: Money received for Château Dufresne rental also go directly to restoration and the castles up keep fee)

800+ $ (2-4 day shooting) for equipment rental (estimate)

The rental of certain costumes will also be a very important part for the short film and photographs as we are trying to be as authentic as possible. There are about 8-12 costume changes ; an estimate of 300$ .

Antique rentals for the shootings and event it self will also be an additional cost. Along with costumes an additional 300$ will be used for Hair and makeup for 2 days on set shooting which does not include additional artistic talents such as actors,extras,animal rentals,assistants, etc...

The funding will also cover the costs for printing and framing of the artwork for the exhibition ,which gets quite pricey; easily in the  2000-3000$ range.

If we exceed our 6500$ goal, the additional money will go to costs of the event itself which includes the location rental of Le Château Dufresne, props from the early 20th century (rentals) and theatrical thrills for the atmosphere of the vernissage night, Complimentary absinthe (La Marchesa's favorite drink) , security and staff etc... 

If we do not reach our 6500$ goal for our deadline of July 4th all money received will go directly to the creation of the artwork and short film as described above.

Palais Rose ;  Paris , France

Château Dufresne ; Montreal , Canada

What you get

Take a look at our unique perks !

A list below will show you what you can get as a contributor to our ''Ma Muse M'amuse'' Marchesa Casati project! 

1$-  Positive vibes- Even this little help will bring us closer to our goal

5$- A Personalized thank you email from myself and our crew! 

10$-Personalized thank you e-card from myself and our crew! (artwork from our very talented storyboard artist!) 

25$- A big thank you! and a 4'' X 6'' postcard of Steben Alexander's Casati

35$- Wow! For 35$, we will send you a personalized e-card , email from myself and our crew with postcard while thanking you with a link to a down-loadable PDF of storyboards from our talented artist.

50$-  All of the above including a limited print of the film poster by talented traditional illustrator artist

  • http://stebenstudio.daportfolio.com

85$- Thank you so much for your contribution! by thanking you ; you will get all of the above, including your name in the credits as a contributor and a down-loadable link to the finished  film when completed.

150$- all of the above and a limited print of Artwork of La Marchesa Casati by Steben Alexander, printed on high quality luster paper, signed and numbered by the artist (only 75 copies)

250$- a RSVP ticket to the vernissage night of the 4th of July which includes ; the short film premiere, exhibition of artwork, complimentary drink of Absinthe (wine available as well), food, live instrumental music, visual and theatrical atmosphere within the Château Dufresne, with a special guided tour of the castle provided : you also get to meet the artist!

500$- All of the above which includes ; positive vibes, thank you e-card, download to the story boards, a 4x6" postcard with artwork by Steben Alexander, the film poster (artwork by

  • http://stebenstudio.daportfolio.com
), a link to view the finished short film online, A limited edition artwork print by Steben, Alexander, a RSVP to the event which includes a guided tour of le Château Dufresne, Premiere of the short film, revealing of artworks, and chance to meet the artist. In addition a copy of the signed DVD of the short film with your name in the credits as a Major Contributor .

1000$-All of the above, including +1 guest to the unforgettable VIP evening of the 4th of July within Le Château Dufresne including a very special thanks with your name in the credits as a major contributor and an invitation to  Steben's VIP Canadian celebrity portrait exhibition in fall 2014.

  • ***Shipping costs are already included in the perks! *** 
  •  Visit back to our fundraiser page for weekly updates of our project!

The Impact

This project is important as it will resurrect an important cultural icon into the 21st century. Introducing her life and legend to art lovers and young artists who may not have known of the great influences of La Casati in the arts and culture.

You are helping with the creation of artwork which is educational and insightful to one of the 20th centuries most scandalous and influential women. By helping to fund this project you are not only keeping her legend alive but helping an emerging artist with his first major solo exhibition and vision.

You will help create a once in a life time visually theatrical event; including the premiere of a short film, exhibition of art works and a luxurious grand atmosphere. 

Portions of the money received at the vernissage will also go directly to the restoration funds of Le Château Dufresne .

Risks & Challenges

Our tight schedule means there is a great importance in time management, and keeping to our schedule. At the moment,  we have already made great progress. I have part of the photographic series already done. The locations we would like to shoot the short film at are already found and we have gathered a very talented crew together to make this short film happen... Its now down to the final 30 days.


**UPDATES on Production Schedule and more**


Due to our tight schedule we will be pushing the Vernissage date back to August with an official date to be announce in the next few days... 


Our Current Schedule:

May 26th- June 5th... : Pre Pre-production

June 7-8th Costume, Makeup and Hair tests. --- creation of artwork for illustration for official poster and flyers (promotion)

June 11th : Filming of the short film in studio. And also the creation of photographic artwork. 

June 10th-16... : Editing of artworks and  the film . We will also start promotion and teasers of the film.

June 16 -  work work work work work and more work ...

July 4th : The vernissage and premiere of the short film at Le Château Dufresne 




Other Ways You Can Help

Any way you can help is contribution to this once in a life time event ! Below are a list of ways you may contribute and help us reach our goal!

-By passing this fundraiser link around to friends and family.

-Speak to other artists and art lovers about our project!

-Posting our fundraiser on social medias  such as Facebook, twitter etc... Help us create a buzz!

-Sponsoring our project with your services, products, or any other means to make this event and project come to life!

-Suggestions, constructive pointers and comments are always helpful!

  •  Note :use the Indiegogo share tools!


Follow our group page on Facebook :

story_txt:
Overview :Who is Marchesa Casati?Who am I? Our projectWhat we needPerksImpact + Risks Challenges**UPDATE : our schedule **LA MARCHESA CASATI ; WHO IS SHE? In the early 20th century, the Marchesa Casati held some of the most grand and luxurious parties for high society; invited guests included royalty and the rich and famous. She was the muse of notable artists such as Agustus John, Giovanni Boldini, Kees Van Dongen, Alberto Martini... as well as photographers such as Man Ray and Adolph De Meyer. She was dressed by Erté and Paul Poiret and was the direct inspiration of Cartier's panther design... She was possibly the most portrayed woman of the 20th century after the Virgin Mary and Cleopatra, appearing in over 300 art pieces...Paintings, photographs, sculptures and wax figures could fill up an entire art gallery dedicated to La Casati. That said, for such a grand legend and provocative figure, what has become of her?Before her decline and fall into poverty, she accumulated a personal debt of over 25 million. She was one of the wealthiest women in Europe and clearly the most notorious and scandalous woman of her day. Known for her eccentrics, she turned heads wherever she went, inspired artists, set trends… She wore live snakes as jewelry, painted her servants in gold leaf and infamously, was remembered for taking nude strolls at night, wearing nothing but her fur coats while walking her pet cheetahs. Casati’s striking features included her fire red hair, alabaster white skin, thin blood red lips and extremely large kohl ringed eyes.WHO AM I?Hi there! My name is Steben Alexander, I'm a student studying in  a professional photography  program here in Montreal.  "Coming
 from a family of aspiring artists, Steben had the chance to develop his
 creativity at an early age. He found inspiration in 1920′s film noire 
as well as vintage 50′s Japanese horror films which attracted him to the
 dark and enigmatic figures and aesthetics. He soon found the works of 
Manrayand David Lachapelle, which introduced him to the world of photography.At the young age of fifteen he was able to meet and eventually workfor photographer David Lachapelle’s muse Amanda Lepore amongst many others.... "At
 the moment I am dividing my time between school and my artistic 
projects which includes my celebrity portrait series of Canadian figures
 who bring international recognition to our entertainment and art 
scenes, including my current focus a short film and photographic art 
series based on the life and legend of La Marchesa Casati.With my
 great interest in art history and enigmatic figures it comes to no 
surprise of my admiration and constant flow of creativity  due to
 the most influential muse of the 20th century La Marchesa Casati....------------MY PROJECTThis campaign is meant to raise funds for my artistic short film and 
photographic series which will follow the life and legend of The 
Marchesa Casati and her quest to commission her own immortality. It will 
make references to artistic works she has appeared in, her life and 
historical events. Staying true to the legend of La Casati, Guests  at the premiere and exhibition will be surrounded by the luxuries and visual treats that she  would have provided her own guests. As
 this is my first major solo exhibition, the help and success of this 
campaign will guarantee the completion of my project. Which not only is 
very personal and important to me but also guarantees to keep the legend 
of a La Casati alive and promotes her influence into the 21st century to
 young art lovers and artists.Short film : The 
short film will start in 1954 London towards the end of her life, when 
she was living in relative poverty; where she arrives at a social 
gathering. She is then raided by guests and photographed without 
permission by Cecil Beaton. People wonder who is this old dark enigmatic figure… A forgotten silent film star? An old eccentric widow? The name of La Casati is whispered among guests as she covers her face from the camera and flashes...**Flashback **Returning to her glory days and making references to historical figures, moments and artworks. A young Casati poses for notable artists such as Boldini, Agustus John, photographer
 Man Ray and dances at the Beaumont ball with her pet boa constrictor. 
She was on a quest to commission her own immortality!What We Need **All
  funding received will go directly to the production of the art work 
which includes the 7-10 min artistic short film and the 10-14 large 
format photographic art works. The goal is set relatively low as in reality a 
10,000$ goal would be more realistic but due to the restricted time 
might not be possible.***500-800 +$ Will be used for location rental 
at Le Château Dufresne in Montreal, which is an almost identical 
architecture replica of La Marchesa's Palais Rose in France and plays a very important role for 
this project. (Note: Money received for Château Dufresne rental also go directly
 to restoration and the castles up keep fee)800+ $ (2-4 day shooting) for equipment rental (estimate)The
 rental of certain costumes will also be a very important part for the 
short film and photographs as we are trying to be as authentic as 
possible. There are about 8-12 costume changes ; an estimate of 300$ . Antique rentals for the shootings and event it self will also 
be an additional cost. Along with costumes an additional 300$
 will be used for Hair and makeup for 2 days on set shooting which does 
not include additional artistic talents such as actors,extras,animal 
rentals,assistants, etc...The
 funding will also cover the costs for printing and framing of the 
artwork for the exhibition ,which gets quite pricey; easily in the 
 2000-3000$ range.If
 we exceed our 6500$ goal, the additional money will go to costs of the 
event itself which includes the location rental of Le Château Dufresne, 
props from the early 20th century (rentals) and theatrical thrills for 
the atmosphere of the vernissage night, Complimentary absinthe (La Marchesa's favorite drink) , 
security and staff etc... If
 we do not reach our 6500$ goal for our deadline of July 4th all 
money received will go directly to the creation of the artwork and short
 film as described above.Palais Rose ;  Paris , FranceChâteau Dufresne ; Montreal , CanadaWhat you getTake
 a look at our unique perks ! A list below will show you what you can 
get as a contributor to our ''Ma Muse M'amuse'' Marchesa Casati 
project! 1$-  Positive vibes- Even this little help will bring us closer to our goal5$- A Personalized thank you email from myself and our crew! 10$-Personalized thank you e-card from myself and our crew! (artwork from our very talented storyboard artist!) 25$- A big thank you! and a 4'' X 6'' postcard of Steben Alexander's Casati 35$-
 Wow! For 35$, we will send you a personalized e-card , email from 
myself and our crew with postcard while thanking you with a link to a down-loadable PDF of 
storyboards from our talented artist.50$-  All of the above including a limited print of the film poster by talented traditional illustrator artist http://stebenstudio.daportfolio.com85$-
 Thank you so much for your contribution! by thanking you ; you will get
 all of the above, including your name in the credits as a contributor 
and a down-loadable link to the finished  film when completed.150$-
 all of the above and a limited print of Artwork of La Marchesa Casati 
by Steben Alexander, printed on high quality luster paper, signed and 
numbered by the artist (only 75 copies)250$- a RSVP ticket to the vernissage night of the 4th of July which includes
 ; the short film premiere, exhibition of artwork, complimentary drink 
of Absinthe (wine available as well), food, live instrumental music, visual and theatrical 
atmosphere within the Château Dufresne, with a special guided tour of 
the castle provided : you also get to meet the artist!500$- 
All of the above which includes ; positive vibes, thank you e-card, 
download to the story boards, a 4x6" postcard with artwork by Steben 
Alexander, the film poster (artwork byhttp://stebenstudio.daportfolio.com),
 a link to view the finished short film online, A limited edition 
artwork print by Steben, Alexander, a RSVP to the event which includes a
 guided tour of le Château Dufresne, Premiere of the short film, 
revealing of artworks, and chance to meet the artist. In addition a copy
 of the signed DVD of the short film with your name in the credits as a Major Contributor .1000$-All of the above, including +1 guest to the unforgettable VIP evening of 
the 4th of July within Le Château Dufresne including a very special 
thanks with your name in the credits as a major contributor and an invitation to  
Steben's VIP Canadian celebrity portrait exhibition in fall 2014. 
***Shipping costs are already included in the perks! *** 
 Visit back to our fundraiser page for weekly updates of our project! 
The ImpactThis
 project is important as it will resurrect an important cultural icon 
into the 21st century. Introducing her life and legend to art lovers and
 young artists who may not have known of the great influences of La 
Casati in the arts and culture.You are helping with the creation 
of artwork which is educational and insightful to one of the 20th 
centuries most scandalous and influential women. By helping to fund this
 project you are not only keeping her legend alive but helping an 
emerging artist with his first major solo exhibition and vision.You
 will help create a once in a life time visually theatrical event; 
including the premiere of a short film, exhibition of art works and a 
luxurious grand atmosphere. Portions of the money received at the vernissage will also go directly to the restoration funds of Le Château Dufresne . Risks & Challenges Our tight schedule means there is a great importance in time 
management, and keeping to our schedule. At the moment,  we have already
 made great progress. I have part of the photographic series already 
done. The locations we would like to shoot the short film at are already found and 
we have gathered a very talented crew together to make this short film 
happen... Its now down to the final 30 days.**UPDATES on Production Schedule and more**Due to our tight schedule we will be pushing the Vernissage date back to August with an official date to be announce in the next few days... Our Current Schedule:May 26th- June 5th... : Pre Pre-productionJune 7-8th Costume, Makeup and Hair tests. --- creation of artwork for illustration for official poster and flyers (promotion)June 11th : Filming of the short film in studio. And also the creation of photographic artwork. June 10th-16... : Editing of artworks and  the film . We will also start promotion and teasers of the film.June 16 -  work work work work work and more work ...July 4th : The vernissage and premiere of the short film at Le Château Dufresne Other Ways You Can Help Any
 way you can help is contribution to this once in a life time event ! 
Below are a list of ways you may contribute and help us reach our goal!-By passing this fundraiser link around to friends and family. -Speak to other artists and art lovers about our project!-Posting our fundraiser on social medias  such as Facebook, twitter etc... Help us create a buzz!-Sponsoring our project with your services, products, or any other means to make this event and project come to life!-Suggestions, constructive pointers and comments are always helpful!  Note :use the Indiegogo share tools!Follow our group page on Facebook : https://www.facebook.com/casati.project http://www.stebenalexander.com/
http://instagram.com/stebenalexander

story:
Short Summary

We would like to request your support for our student-initiated project called VON.

The German word VON is a preposition meaning from, or of, used to describe belonging to, or originating from a specific geographic location. Inspired by Alexander von Humboldt, the famous explorer, geologist and naturalist, we seek to confront questions of identity and one’s relationship to their surroundings.

Our project takes the form of an artist residency that will take place from June 23 to July 23 in Cuernavaca, Mexico.

This residency will establish an artistic collaboration between artists from Concordia University and UQUAM in Montreal Quebec, and Centro Morelense de las Artes del Estado de Morelos in Cuernavaca, Mexico. The residency will include artist talks, conferences and will culminate in a public exhibition and catalogue. We believe this opportunity will give us a chance to further our artistic research. This is an important collaboration between Canada and Mexico. It is a celebration and exploration of diversity as we bridge two different cultural and artistic communities.

Artists from Concordia University and UQUAM

Andréanne Abbondanza Bergeron

David Bellemare

Dayna Danger

Kate Puxley 

Kevin Beaulieu

Laurence N. Beland

Mathieu Cardin

MAW Collective: Craig Spence, Max Evans, John Gunner, Simon Zaborski, Jackson Darby, Gabriel Baribeau 

Mona Ayyash

Nicole Levaque

Petur Mar Gunnarsson 

Philippe Caron Lefebure 

Pier Anne Mercier Tremblay 

Raul Aguilar Canela 

Shanie Tomassini

Curated by Marcelino Barsi and Minerva Ayon


What We Need & What You Get

Our goal is to reach a minimum of $3 000 to help cover our travel expenses and material fees for the 20 artists participating in this project. All donors will receive an invitation to our post-residency events in Montreal. These events will include an exhibition, conference, and catalogue launch.

While we have perks for donations of $100 or more, any contribution would be greatly appreciated. For donations of:

$ 100 or more: you will receive an exhibition catalogue

$ 250 or more: we will add ½ page publicity or gratitude mention in the catalogue

$ 500 or more: will add a full-page publicity or gratitude mention in the catalogue

$ 1,000 or more: you will receive a large format print of your choice (edition 1 of 3) taken from the catalogue of the artworks produced during the residency.

$ 2,500 or more: you will be gifted an original artwork by the artist of your choice (the artist will choose the artwork).

Thank you for your support!!!

story:
Guerrilla Theurgy Introduction

Imagine living in a better, happier, more peaceful world. Imagine a world where creativity, pleasure, joy and spirit received as much attention as commerce, industry, war and competition. We can create a better, more balanced world together, but it requires a shift in consciousness. 

Guerrilla Theurgy is a plan to make the world a better place one step at a time by taking small actions in the world to help people feel happier and better, and to awaken ourselves. The specific actions are inspired by the set of 72 angels most well known as the Shemhamphorash. The power of each angel inspires a positive action or instruction.

72 short Videos are in production, each demonstrating one of these angelically inspired actions. See the video above for a fun example. These will be uploaded individually and collected with extras in a DVD.

A deck of 72 cards has been created which give detailed instructions for carrying out these actions. This deck is somewhat like a Tarot, but a Tarot of action rather than oracle.

Together we can change the world in a big way through small things that can be done every day or any day.

This material is created by Jason Augustus Newcomb, author of many books, meditation recordings, and Tarot decks.

What is Happening

The physical results of this campaign will be: 

  • Guerilla Theurgy Cards - a 72 card deck and booklet
  • Guerilla Theurgy Movie DVD
  • Seven Archangel Boxed Sets
  • Dodekameron - a book of invocations

The practical results of this campaign will be that hundreds, hopefully thousands of people will be out in the world doing small good deeds every day. Each of the actions will make both the person doing them and the people around uplifted in small but noticeable ways.

How You Can Help

We need your help to make this happen. The $3,000 goal is really just the beginning, and we hope to raise considerably more in order to get all of the 72 videos done in the best manner possible. 

We raised over four times our goal with the New Hermetics Tarot campaign last year and we would like to exceed that if possible this year!

Please support the campaign, but also get the word out and make some noise about this campaign. Use the Indiegogo share tools!

Descriptions of the Physical Perks are as follows:

When you contribute to this campaign you will be able to choose between a large number of possible rewards. 

GUERRILLA THEURGY CARDS

A deck of 72 2.5" by 3.5" cards which detail a set of inspiring and world transforming actions, a sort of action Tarot. The backs of the cards contain talismans of the Shemhamphoresh angels. The cards have a parchment texture.

GUERILLA THEURGY MOVIE DVD

This DVD set will contain all of the 72 actions as well as commentary, behind-the-scenes, and extras. See the above video for an example. It will be packaged in a DVD clamshell and will be in NTSC format (PAL may be available too depending on number of contributors).

This DVD will allow viewers to be inspired to take action!

The DVD will be a year in the making, so you will receive it separately!

SEVEN ARCHANGEL BOXED SETS

Each of these sets include, Incense, Candles, Oil, Meditation card, Talisman, Two meditation CDs and an instruction sheet for working with one of the seven planetary archangels for illumination and magical success. Thesewill eventually be commercially available, but you can be one of the first to have them!

DODEKAMERON BOOK

This approximately 200 page book offers detailed instructions and background in the invocation of many spiritual beings utilizing Jason ugustus Newcomb's techniques. Ritual scripts for over 100 entities are given in full.

BOXED TATTWA CARD DECK


The tattwa cards we produced last year were so popular that we decided to include a set of the final commercial versions that will be available this autumn for high level contributors right now.

25 meditative, color-scale cards, divided among the 5 elements, Tattwa Cards were traditionally employed by the Hermetic Order of the Golden Dawn to aid students in astral clairvoyance. An affordable commercial set of these cards have not been available on the market for many years, with used copies of John Mumford’s set selling for well over $100 on places like Amazon or eBay. 

This new version is slightly different because it has 2.5" by 3.5" cards, a box, as well as instructions!

Stretch Rewards:

If we raise $3000.00 or more:

All contributors will receive a brand-new never before released meditation recording called, "Rekindling the Spiritual Flame."

If we raise $3500.00 or more:

All contributors will receive a brand-new never before released meditation recording for invoking the Shem ha Mephoresch angels.

If we raise $4000.00 or more:

All who contribute $100 or more will receive whichever of the seven "intelligences" recordings of the level they purchased.

If we raise $5000.00 or more:

All who contribute $100 or more will receive whichever of the seven "spirits" recordings of the level they purchased.

If we raise $6000.00 or more:

All who contribute $100 or more will receive whichever of the seven "goetic" recordings of the level they purchased.

If we raise $7000.00 or more:

All who contribute $100 or more will receive a brass incense burner for easily using the incense included in the angelic box sets

If we raise $8000.00 or more:

All contributors of $250 or more will receive a special bonus tattwa card set with optically reversed colors to facilitate scrying and spirit vision exercises.

 


A NOTE FOR INTERNATIONAL CONTRIBUTORS

An additional shipping fee will be required for international contributors. Every effort will be made to keep this as low as possible!

A FINAL NOTE

I want to thank you in advance for your contributions at every level. Please remember to share this campaign with your friends and help get people excited about Guerrilla Theurgy!

story:
My name is Lance Hitchings, and I'm a freelance CG illustrator in Portland, Oregon. Due to major health issues which I contracted while serving in the US Navy in Vietnam, I've been undergoing chemo therapy and unable to work for most of the last year. I've finally exhausted all of my savings and I'm facing eviction from my home of the last 8 years.

Thankfully, I've fully recovered my health, but my illustration business has taken a major hit. I not only lost income, I lost clients. I'm rebuilding my client base and I'm back at work, but I'm still a couple of months away from receiving any payments.

I need to find a way to hang on 'til then and that's going to take about $8,750; which I don't have.

So I'm looking for a little help. In exchange for your generosity, I'm offering some of my best personal work as a reward for helping out.

How did I get here?

In 2000 I was diagnosed with Hepatitis C, which I contracted while serving in the US Navy.  Last summer the VA Hospital in Portland started me on a year-long round of chemo therapy, which I recently completed, and which was a total success. I'm completely recovered. And thanks to the VA, I don't really have any medical bills to pay.

The real cost of the therapy was dealing with the the laundry list of adverse side-effects caused by the chemo. One result was that for most of the last year, I've been unable to work. 

Not being able to work for a year had has repercussions of it's own, the major one being loss of income. But I also lost a couple of my most steady clients. Once I'd recovered enough to be able to work again, I found myself without any projects to work on.  

With lots of spare time on my hands, I focused on a renewed marketing effort. It's already producing results, and I've landed a large new client to replace one of those I lost.

With about 2 months to go until I reach the point at which I anticipate being able to completely put the last year behind me, I've completely exhausted all my financial resources.

And I could use a little help.

What I need.

$8,750.  This amount will allow me to pay some overdue bills, meet the operational overhead for 2 months for my business and have enough left over to pay my living expenses for the next 2 months.  By that time, payments for projects that are currently in my studio should start arriving.

Who am I?

Although I primarily illustrate industrial & consumer products, I also get to pursue personal work. I know I'm extremely lucky; not everyone gets to follow their passion. And make a living at it.

I build my illustrations, light and render them in 3D, then composite those renders in photoshop. I've been doing this for over a decade and I'm pretty knowledgeable about the technology. For 3 years I wrote articles and a monthly column in "3D Artist" magazine, which is published in Great Briton.  I wrote their very first tutorial in Issue #1 about one of my personal illustrations, the "Tot Rod". I also write a blog with articles and tutorials.

My clients are usually graphic designers or advertising agencies. I've done stereoscopic animations for BMW, cutaway illustrations of binoculars for Nikon; water bottle animations for Nike; truck illustrations for Freightliner and both illustrations & animations for Exide Batteries. All clients who demand the best.

I like to think that I'm pretty good at what I do, and I'd really like to be able to keep doing it.

You can help.

The Rewards.

In appreciation of those who contribute, I'll be sending out some of my best work. Downloads of digital images suitable for printing (with limited usage rights) as well as signed and numbered edition prints of the same pieces.

A couple of the pieces are currently "works-in-progress" and as such will ship as soon as they are completed. Since my clients' projects get first priority, personal work happens in my spare time. I'm guessing that "The Watcher" is about 2 months from completion and "Columbia" about 6 months.

THE TOT ROD

This first piece is finished and ready to ship. The Tot Rod is a piece I did a few years ago. 3D Artist Magazine chose this image as the first tutorial they ever published, in Issue # 1.

The image tells the story of a young motor head who has moved far beyond his original crude and unskilled attempts at building a ride.

The digital version is 3600 pixels X 2400 pixels. The limited edition print is 24" X 18" (18" X 12" image size with a 3" border).  Both versions will ship shortly after completion of the campaign.


THE TOWER STATION

This piece is also finished and ready to ship. The Tower Station was also featured in 3D Artist Magazine, and was a 2-part, 18 page tutorial.


The Tower Station and U-Drop Inn Cafe was built in 1936 and is located in Shamrock, Texas; along old Route 66, the Mother Road. It also served as the inspiration for the body shop of the character "Ramone" in the 2006 animated film "Cars"

The digital version is 3000 pixels X 1880 pixels. The limited edition print is 21" X 15.4" (15" X 9.4" image size with a 3" border).  Both versions will ship a few days after completion of the campaign.


THE WATCHER 

This is a work-in-progress, and I anticipate that it will be finished a couple of months after the close of the campaign. As part of the reward, you'll receive updates showing the progress of the piece.

The Watcher is a steam-punk themed image of a female observer keeping watch from a clock tower.

As I mentioned, this is an unfinished piece, and the image below represents it's current look. A lot will change between now and completion. The clock, telescope are finished (probably) as well as her face, body and pose. Hair and clothing will definitely become much more complex and composition and lighting may change slightly.

The print size is undecided, but will probably be about 18" X 24", with digital resolution to match.


COLUMBIA

Another work-in-progress, barely started. This is a concept that I've been working on in my head for the last 15 years.  Only recently did I feel skilled enough to do it justice.

The concept is that it shows the source of the mighty Columbia River. The image is of the Columbia Gorge, looking east towards the Vista House on Crown Point. Standing in the clouds above the mountains in the far distance is "Columbia", the feminine personification of the United States (until replaced by the Statue of Liberty) and the namesake of both the river and the gorge. She is seen in the guise of the "Water Bearer", a pose taken from classic Greek sculpture and the water flowing from her upturned vase is seen as the source of the Columbia River headwaters.

The image below, which shows the river, the cliffs and mountains of the gorge and the figure of Columbia, is simply a render for blocking out the composition and may bear little resemblance to the final image.

Since this project is barely started, I anticipate that it could take up to about 6 months to finish in my spare time. Like The Watcher, you'll receive regular updates showing the progress of the piece; a great opportunity to observe the artistic process from concept to completion.

The print size is undecided, but will probably be about 18" X 24", with digital resolution to match.
story_txt:
My name is Lance Hitchings, and I'm a freelance CG illustrator in Portland, Oregon. Due to major health issues which I contracted while serving in the US Navy in Vietnam, I've been undergoing chemo therapy and unable to work for most of the last year. I've finally exhausted all of my savings and I'm facing eviction from my home of the last 8 years.

Thankfully, I've fully recovered my health, but my illustration business has taken a major hit. I not only lost income, I lost clients. I'm rebuilding my client base and I'm back at work, but I'm still a couple of months away from receiving any payments.
I need to find a way to hang on 'til then and that's going to take about $8,750; which I don't have.
So I'm looking for a little help. In exchange for your generosity, I'm offering some of my best personal work as a reward for helping out.

How did I get here?
In 2000 I was diagnosed with Hepatitis C, which I contracted while serving in the US Navy.  Last summer the VA Hospital in Portland started me on a year-long round of chemo therapy, which I recently completed, and which was a total success. I'm completely recovered. And thanks to the VA, I don't really have any medical bills to pay.
The real cost of the therapy was dealing with the the laundry list of adverse side-effects caused by the chemo. One result was that for most of the last year, I've been unable to work. 
Not being able to work for a year had has repercussions of it's own, the major one being loss of income. But I also lost a couple of my most steady clients. Once I'd recovered enough to be able to work again, I found myself without any projects to work on.  
With lots of spare time on my hands, I focused on a renewed marketing effort. It's already producing results, and I've landed a large new client to replace one of those I lost.
With about 2 months to go until I reach the point at which I anticipate being able to completely put the last year behind me, I've completely exhausted all my financial resources.
And I could use a little help.

What I need.
$8,750.  This amount will allow me to pay some overdue bills, meet the operational overhead for 2 months for my business and have enough left over to pay my living expenses for the next 2 months.  By that time, payments for projects that are currently in my studio should start arriving.



Who am I?
