story:
Video direction & editing by Manuele Carlini

About this project - the short story

I am Francesco.
Always against the current, never politically correct, controversial, anarchic. I am an artist, not because of a certificate or diploma, but because I am compelled to be. Art, love and fantasy fuel me. For seven years I have lived and worked in Germany. After these long years of set-backs and hardships I am finally able to live just as an artist. I have built up my studio, founded a gallery and formed a network. 

However, it is now time for me to return to my homeland for one important exhibition. For the first time, I will take my controversial art to the old centre of the world - Rome. The exhibition is called RomArt and with it's astronomical stall fees it effectively prohibits the entrance of new, untested artists. It's time for a breath of fresh air in the Italian art scene - and this is where I need your help. 

Please watch the video and read the long version below. In return for your support you will receive and original piece of art. More details are below. 

It's time - please help take me back to Rome!


About this project - the long story

A very long time ago I realized that art was going to be my life. I am an Italian, through and through, in my blood, in my flesh.

Italy is the heart land of the arts. Where would the world be without the rebirth of culture that took place in the Renaissance? My homeland is unrivalled in terms of artistic and cultural heritage; however with it's current economic woes it is no longer a country that can foster ground breaking, innovative and new art.

Very fortunately my journey brought me to Germany, my new adopted homeland.
It took a lot of commitment and time but here in Germany I am finally able to live just as an artist.

Believe me, though, it took years to get here. In fact 7 years. I’ve done my time in shitty jobs in call centres and restaurants. I slowly build up my studio, gallery, and network. I have had many set-backs and hardships. I have worked committedly. And I have put down my roots in Nuremberg, a city I am very happy to live and work in. My art is controversial. I always try to spark conversation with my work, because I believe this to be the role of an artist in society. To hold up a mirror to the things we hold as taboo, topics unspeakable and the things we shy away from.

However it’s been seven years now in Germany, and living here in a land that so values the freedom of expression I have come to have some new thoughts about my homeland. In Italy, a land renowned for its loud and passionate speech, why is it that there so many topics that are still taboo? More taboo than in Germany? Why don’t the Italian people feel free to criticise their obviously corrupt leadership? Why does the Catholic Church there still have such a powerful hold over the people? These are questions that I want to ask.

So slowly an idea was born. As an artist I occupy the unique position of being able to be completely honest and blunt, regardless of social conventions, taboo, and what is politically sensitive or not. I can speak my truth loudly.It’s time for me to return to my homeland. To the heart of my homeland and the old centre of the world. I will go to Rome for one important exhibition.


There is an exhibition called RomArt Biennale of Art and Culture. Unlike in Germany where access to such exhibitions is generally available to all artists, Italy often requires prohibitive exhibit fees that stop all but the already successful, already accepted, already preapproved artists to participate. RomArt here is no exception. The stall fees alone are exorbitant - 1400€, effectively keeping out new, untested and unapproved voices. Only the established are admitted.

It is here that I want to take my provocative art. I want to go to the centre of Italy and use my art to incite a reaction. I want to start a new discussion. And this is where I need your help. Like I said, the admission fees to this exhibition are enough normally to keep me out. So I am asking you to help get me to Rome.

Below you  can see the breakdown of the costs associated with this exhibition, and I am asking for your support to cover these and get me to Rome. Please support me, my art and my journey as an artist in this important next step. As a thank you for your support you will receive an original piece of my art.


About RomArt - International Art & Culture Biennal

MAY 15TH-18TH:                                                                                                                               four full days dedicated to Art and all its various expressions - painting, sculpture, graphics, photography, video and digital. The city of Rome will be the cradle of the International Art and Culture from 15th to 18th of May through this first edition of ROMART, the event taking place at Nuova Fiera in Rome displaying modern and contemporary art. The 17.000 sqm exhibition center will welcome all the different languages of the artistic expression: the International Biennial of Art and Culture of Rome will be presenting to its visitors the artworks of artists and Academies or Art Schools' students coming from all over the world, as the result of a very attentive selection carried out by the designated scientific Committee. 

WORLD TARGET:
34 NATIONS from all over the world will be participating at Romart 2015                   1.000 artist and more as 5.000 art piece.                      

24 different Prizes and Awards:
• 6 prizes ROMART 2015
• 1 Award "I LIKE YOUR ART"
• 1 Award "VISITORS"
• 5 PRIZES "INTERNATIONAL EXHIBITION"
• 5 PRIZES "ART BUSINESS"
• 5 PRIZES "ART MAGAZINE"
• 1 Award "ART LABEL"
• 1 Award "ROCK 'N' ART"



Budget Breakdown

1.400€  Stand admission fee   

600€     Highway tolls & gasoline costs for 2200 km

200€     Estimated cost for advertising, press release and postcards

200€     Costs estimate for staying 4 nights in Rome

200€     Campaign related expenses. Indigogo/Credit Card, Fees estimate
                (9% of money raised + 3-5%  PayPal fees)
_____________________________________________________________________________

2.600€ total
_____________________________________________________________________________


You get what you give - the donations


All those who donate 11€ will receive as a thank an original drawing of mine.
This is not a copy! But a unique sketch of figures drawn in pen on aged paper.


With this donation you will receive in the mail as a thank a "heart" drawn on glass. Unique and original, designed by me personally and with dedication on the back.

 

With this donation you will receive in the mail as a thank a "big heart" drawn on glass. Unique and original, designed by me personally and with dedication on the back. And you will also receive an original sketch.


With this donation you will receive in the mail as a thank you a big picture.
Unique and original, designed by me personally and with dedication on the back. You will also receive a heart on glass and an original sketch.


With this donation you will receive in the mail as a thank you a big "SOUL"picture on glass! Unique and original, designed by me personally and with dedication on the back. You will also receive a heart on glass and an original sketch.

     

With this donation you will receive a genuine, original "neo super pop" portrait of you!!! We will arrange a time for you to come to my studio for a sitting, or I can also work from a photograph. It will be a creative expression of your physical and psychological character.

Neo Super Pop Art Examples:

PAPSTER - Papa Giovanni Paolo II


MUCH LOVE - Madre Teresa di Calcutta


CASANOVA - Thief of love

 

Christ -Pedophilia in the Catholic Church 


Hitler - Between past and present

Barak Obama - Love to Control you

Berlusconi - The Banana Republic


FEMEN - God is a Woman



Other ways to help me

Even if you are not able to contribute financially, you can still help: 

  • Please get your friends, family and colleagues involved! 
    Anyone who loves art can help.
  • Please use the Share function of this platform to help spread the word!

How to donate

1 )  Choose the amount to donate

2 )  You will be redirected to the PayPal site, from which, even without an account,  you can donate by credit card or debit card (or similar). You will see a donation to Ferrante Francesco.

3 )  Enter your details and those of your card, go without account, or PayPal, 
and end the payment.

4 )  You will see an image " Thank you", that's it, and I thank you!


Seven years in Germany



About my career - exhibitions & shows

·  "KUNST SCHIMMER 3" Kunst Messe Ulm, Germany              14.02.2015-22.02.2015

·  "Drink & Draw!" Germanisches Museum Nürnberg, Germany                      17.12.2014

·  "Schluss mit Lustig!" Kulturpavillon München, Germany        07.11.2014-09.11.2014

·  "CREATIVEMONDAY" Neues Museum Nürnberg, Germany                        20.10.2014

·  "zARTbitter" Kap-Hoorn ART  Bremen, Germany                     14.06.2014-15.06.2014

·  "SupermART" Quelle Areal  Nürnberg, Germany                     30.05.2014-01.06.2014

·  "IDENTITÄTSENTWÜRFE" Haus der  Künste  München        09.05.2014-16.05.2014

·  "Live Painting Show" Hotel Le Meriedien  München, Germany                     07.11.2013

·  "VENI, VIDI, VICI"  Galerie dellaLuce Nürnberg, Germany       11.10.2013-20.10.2013

·  "7. Kunstrasenfestival" Theodor-Heuss-Brücke Nürnberg    12.07.2013-14.07.2013

·  "Retrospettiva"  Gallery B15  Fürth, Germany                           28.06.2013-06.30.2013

·  "DRAWINGS"  Flamboyant  Nürnberg, Germany                     07.06.2013-29.06.2013

·  "SupermART" Quelle Areal  Nürnberg, Germany                     31.05.2013-02.06.2013

·  "Metropolitain Art Fair" Hotel Le Meridien,  München             19.04.2013-21.04.2013

·  "Biennale Hamburg" Galerie Kunststätte, Hamburg                  15.11.2012-11.02.2013

·  "das ist doch alles nur geklaut"Haus der Künste, München     10.11.2012-16.11.2012

·  "(H)EIS(S)KALT"Raum für zeitgenössische Kunst Nürnberg   19.10.201218.11.2012

·  "Gostenhofer Galerie Tage" Galerie dellaLuce Nürnberg        13.10.2012-14.10.2012

·  "NEO SUPER POP ART"  Weinerei  Nürnberg                           07.06:2012-30.06:2012

·  "SupermART" Ex Quelle  Nürnberg                                              01.06.2012-03.06.2012

·  "PechaKuchaNight Volume 6"  Neue Museum  Nürnberg                            22.05.2012 

·  "Stroke, Urban Art Fair"  Praterinsel  München, Germany     03.05.2012/6.05.2012

·  "FORM-A(R)T 20.Internationale Kunstausstellung" Hamburg,      20-21-21.04.2012

·  "GOHO 2012,Gefühlszone" Galerie dellaLuce  Nürnberg         14.10.2011-23.10.2011

·  "6. Kunstrasenfestival" Nürnberg                                                   08.06.2011-10.06.2011

·  "Arte, Amore & Fantasia" Atelier dellaLuce Nürnberg           20.05.2012-20.06.2011

·  "GoGaTa" Galerie Armer Teufel  Nürnberg Germany            25.09.2010-26.09.2010

·  "Ich heiße Norma und ich hasse Norma" Nordkurve              18.06.2010-30.07.2010

·  "Blaue Nacht" Nürnberg, Germany                                                                       15.05.2010 

·  "Kunstmarkt" Z-Bau  Nürnberg                                                     05.12.2009-06.12.2009


La mia storia

Molto tempo fa, mi sono reso conto che l'arte sarebbe stata la mia vita. Io sono un italiano, nel mio sangue, nella mia carne. Io sono Francesco. Sempre contro corrente, politicamente scorretto, sempre controverso, anarchico. Sono un artista, non grazie a un certificato o un diploma, ma perché sono obbligato ad esserlo.
Arte Amore e Fantasia sono il mio carburante.
Il mio viaggio mi ha portato in Germania, la mia nuova patria di adozione.
C´è voluto un sacco di impegno e di tempo, ben 7 anni, ma qui, sono finalmente in grado di vivere della mia arte. Ho lentamente costruito il mio studio, ho trovato le mie gallerie, ho tessuto la mia rete. Ho avuto molte battute d'arresto e difficoltà, ma nonostante tutto e tutti vado avanti.

"Neo Super Pop Art" è il nome che ho dato alla mia arte. Attraverso la lente della cultura Pop cerco di riesaminare e ridefinire simbologie del nostro tempo, trattare temi scottanti e ritrarre politici e uomini influenti della nostra epoca. Senza tabù, senza riguardo per le convenzioni sociali vado diretto con colori forti e rombanti a toccare religione, sesso e politica come nessuno prima d´ora. Ma adesso è giunto il momento per me di tornare nella mia Patria come Artista. Nel cuore della Arte e della cultura, un tempo centro del mondo. Andrò a Roma. Qui si terrà una Biennale di arte e cultura, Romart e qui mi serve il vostro aiuto. Per partecipare è richiesto un onerosa tassa di iscrizione ma solo con le mie finanze non riesco a permettermi le spese di ammissione e di viaggio. Con il vostro aiuto potrò portare per la prima volta la mia arte provocatoria ma piena di fantasia e amore nel mio paese, e fare un po’ di casino nel mondo marcio dell´arte moderna e forse della vita culturale del nostro paese.

www.francesco.us

The city of Rome will be the cradle of the International Art and Culture from 15th to 18th of May through this first edition of ROMART, the event taking place at Nuova Fiera in Rome displaying modern and contemporary art. The 17.000 sqm exhibition center will welcome all the different languages of the artistic expression: the International Biennial of Art and Culture of Rome will be presenting to its visitors the artworks of artists and Academies or Art Schools' students coming from all over the world, as the result of a very attentive selection carried out by the designated scientific Committee. WORLD TARGET:34 NATIONS from all over the world will be participating at Romart 2015                   1.000 artist and more as 5.000 art piece.                      24 different Prizes and Awards:•	6 prizes ROMART 2015•	1 Award "I LIKE YOUR ART"•	1 Award "VISITORS"•	5 PRIZES "INTERNATIONAL EXHIBITION"•	5 PRIZES "ART BUSINESS"•	5 PRIZES "ART MAGAZINE"•	1 Award "ART LABEL"•	1 Award "ROCK 'N' ART"Budget Breakdown

You get what you give - the donations



All those who donate 11€ will receive as a thank an original drawing of mine. This is not a copy! But a unique sketch of figures drawn in pen on aged paper.With this donation you will receive in the mail as a thank a "heart" drawn on glass. Unique and original, designed by me personally and with dedication on the back.
 




With this donation you will receive in the mail as a thank a "big
heart" drawn on glass. Unique and original, designed by me personally and
with dedication on the back. And you will also receive an original sketch.


With this
donation you will receive in the mail as a thank you a big picture. Unique and
original, designed by me personally and with dedication on the back. You will
also receive a heart on glass and an original sketch.
With this donation you will receive in the mail as a thank you a big "SOUL"picture on glass! Unique and original, designed by me personally and with dedication on the back. You will also receive a heart on glass and an original sketch.     
With this
donation you will receive a genuine, original "neo super pop"
portrait of you!!! We will arrange a time for you to come to my studio for a
sitting, or I can also work from a photograph. It will be a creative expression
of your physical and psychological character.


Neo Super Pop Art Examples:

PAPSTER - Papa Giovanni Paolo II



MUCH LOVE - Madre Teresa di Calcutta






CASANOVA - Thief of love

 
Christ -Pedophilia in the Catholic Church 



Hitler - Between past and present



Barak Obama - Love to Control you


Berlusconi - The Banana Republic






FEMEN - God is a Woman





Other ways to help me
Even if you are not able to contribute financially, you can still help: 

Please get your friends, family and colleagues involved! Anyone who loves art can help.
Please use the Share function of this platform to help spread the word!

How to donate
1 )  Choose the amount to donate
2 )  You will be redirected to the PayPal site, from which, even without an account,  you can donate by credit card or debit card (or similar). You will see a donation to Ferrante Francesco.
3 )  Enter your details and those of your card, go without account, or PayPal, and end the payment.
4 )  You will see an image " Thank you", that's it, and I thank you!

La mia storia

Molto tempo fa, mi sono reso
conto che l'arte sarebbe stata la mia vita. Io sono un italiano, nel mio
sangue, nella mia carne. Io sono Francesco. Sempre contro corrente,
politicamente scorretto, sempre controverso, anarchico. Sono un artista, non
grazie a un certificato o un diploma, ma perché sono obbligato ad esserlo. Arte
Amore e Fantasia sono il mio carburante. Il mio viaggio mi ha portato in
Germania, la mia nuova patria di adozione. C´è voluto un sacco di impegno e di
tempo, ben 7 anni, ma qui, sono finalmente in grado di vivere della mia arte.
Ho lentamente costruito il mio studio, ho trovato le mie gallerie, ho tessuto
la mia rete. Ho avuto molte battute d'arresto e difficoltà, ma nonostante tutto
e tutti vado avanti. "Neo Super Pop Art" è il nome che ho dato alla
mia arte. Attraverso la lente della cultura Pop cerco di riesaminare e
ridefinire simbologie del nostro tempo, trattare temi scottanti e ritrarre
politici e uomini influenti della nostra epoca. Senza tabù, senza riguardo per
le convenzioni sociali vado diretto con colori forti e rombanti a toccare
religione, sesso e politica come nessuno prima d´ora. Ma adesso è giunto il
momento per me di tornare nella mia Patria come Artista. Nel cuore della Arte e
della cultura, un tempo centro del mondo. Andrò a Roma. Qui si terrà una
Biennale di arte e cultura, Romart e qui mi serve il vostro aiuto. Per partecipare è richiesto un onerosa tassa di
iscrizione ma solo con le mie finanze non riesco a permettermi le spese di
ammissione e di viaggio. Con il vostro aiuto potrò portare per la prima volta
la mia arte provocatoria ma piena di fantasia e amore nel mio paese, e fare un
po’ di casino nel mondo marcio dell´arte moderna e forse della vita culturale
del nostro paese.





www.francesco.us

story:
Short Summary

Hey everybody! 

I'm your friend, relative, classmate, person you've been struggling to find a holiday gift for, or even that Facebook friend that you can't quite remember meeting in real life. 

I want to go to an art school for a semester. 

I've also conveniently already been accepted to an art school for a semester: the Glasgow School of Art in Glasgow, Scotland. 

REALLY COOL, RIGHT??

The only problem is that school, travel, and life are expensive. This dream of going to a foreign art school is really expensive. Pretty much everything about this endeavor is manageable except the cost. 

Part of the reason I took this past semester off from Midd is because I needed to make money to try to be able to go abroad to study at Glasgow. But even the jobs that I have gotten might not be enough to help cover the costs.


What I Need & What You Get

I'm hoping beyond hope that with this campaign I might be able to reach $500, but I know that's a LOT of money.

But even a part of that goal will chip away at the overall cost. 

But if you've got $5, you can still donate. I'll still appreciate it more than you know.

($15-$20 gets you a super-awesome drawing emailed to you from me. I make great dorm wall art.)

Anything helps. Your contribution will mostly be going towards tuition and a place to stay. This program specializes in something called "motion graphics" which is a kind of animation technique. When I grow up I want to be working in the field of animation, and this is one step along the path of reaching that goal. 

Anything cool I make while I'm abroad will be posted on a publicly view-able platform so you can see what I'm doing with the money you've given me! Promise.

story:
So what's it all about?

hcmf// is the UK’s foremost festival of contemporary music, presenting 50+ events over 10 days every November including concerts, exhibitions, installations, workshops, films and talks. Every year we present a wealth of UK, European and world premieres from some of the world’s leading composers and artists. Critically, we also provide commissions and opportunities for emerging new talents.

Our fundraising campaign epitomises this rich blend of experience and passion.

Supported by the renowned composer/saxophonist/improviser, Evan Parker, hcmf// is seeking to raise funds to enable a commission for a young composer/artist working in sound  - with the work to be performed at the 2015 Festival. Evan Parker will jointly select the composer/artist along with hcmf// Artistic Director, Graham McKenzie and the composer/artist will also receive valuable mentoring support from Evan. 

What we need and what you get

We’re aiming to raise £1,000 towards the cost of awarding the commission and staging the outcome concert at the 2015 Festival. Your donation will go directly towards this project.

Evan Parker’s ‘birthday gift’ to hcmf//

In his 70th birthday year and in recognition of his close relationship with hcmf//, Evan Parker has given hcmf// a wonderful gift of a specially created, limited edition CD-R of previously unreleased material by Trance Map – a group made up of Evan along with sound artist Matt Wright and percussionist Toma Gouband.

There are just 100 of the CD-Rs being made and if you donate £20 you will receive one  numbered and signed by Evan. If you can donate £30, you’ll receive the CD-R along with an acknowledgment of your support in the 2015 programme plus a ticket to the performance of the new commission at the 2015 Festival.


Impact

Now in its 37th year, hcmf// has a long and successful history of supporting young and emerging talents, through commissions and providing opportunities to perform – or have their work performed – in the company of the world’s leading contemporary music composers and artists. Through the years, hcmf// has given commissions to John Butcher, Naomi Pinnock, Bernhard Lang and Claudia Molitor among others. The composer in residence at this year’s Festival is James Dillon, who had his first work performed at hcmf// in 1978.

In helping us continue to commission new work from a young composer/artists, you will be playing a vital part in creating an opportunity that could prove to be a pivotal point in a fledgling career. The strong partnerships that hcmf// has throughout Europe and around the world, means that the commissioned composer/artist will also benefit from being part of a valuable network of other leading producers and presenters of new music.

Other ways you can help

If you aren’t able to make a donation, but you’d still like to support our campaign, then you can help us to reach our target of raising £1,000 by telling others about what we’re doing.

Join us on Facebook and Twitter or sign up to our mailing list for all the latest information.

story:
I’m Scott Cohen (skeeter on the playa), the artist behind the Life Cube Project. 
Inspired by a trip to Burning Man over a decade ago, the Life Cube Project was created as an interactive and experiential public art installation. The community of 'Cube-ists' who embrace its mission continues to grow every year.  For the Life Cube at Burning Man 2015, we’re going to create a giant collaborative piece connecting art and community in Black Rock City and beyond!

 

GROWING THE LIFE CUBE PROJECT

Our art has grown from a small, decorated 8x8 foot box to a sculptural building that measures 24x24 feet with pillars and posts and platforms and stairs and ladders. Totally redesigned with our team’s architects, the Life Cube at Burning Man 2015 will be painted by muralists in real time, with a huge wall featuring a mosaic combining artwork contributed from over a thousand Burners.  

The community is encouraged and invited to climb, paint, and draw on the Life Cube. We love the creative artists who come and paint fabulous murals.  We love the people who share their thoughts on the chalkboard walls, creating a colorful, ever-changing and evolving installation. 
 

FOUNDING PRINCIPLES

The Life Cube Project was founded based on the belief that if you write down your goals, dreams, wishes, and aspirations, the probability of it happening is much, much higher!

We have seen the magic work!  At Burning Man, in Las Vegas, at Reno, across the country and around the world, people have thought about what they want for the future, written it down, and began to see those dreams become reality.  Couples have met – and even married – at the Cube!  

CONNECTING ART + COMMUNITY

Connecting art and community means that we’ve grown our Life Cube Project team as well.  This year’s crew includes the Artist, a Project Manager, Master Carpenters and Builders, Lighting Designers, Artists and Painters, Electricians, Architects, Care-and-Feeding and Clean-Up Crews, Master Burn and Pyro Leads, Fire Safety Perimeter Crew, Digital and Social Media Wizards, and many more.  

Our team has over a hundred volunteers who believe in the Life Cube Project, contributing their time and talent to bring our art to Black Rock City this year. We hope that you'll join us with your support to bring the Life Cube back to the Playa this year!

Inscribed on many 1000s of Wish-Stick postcards, the community’s wishes along with the entire Life Cube structure and the art will be burned in a spectacular and spiritual ceremony at the end of the festival.  When you support the Life Cube Project, your goals, dreams and wishes will be deposited into the Cube and join with others in a flaming tower of ash and cinders going up into the Universe. 

FUNDING – WE NEED YOUR HELP TO MAKE IT HAPPEN!

We are thrilled to have been selected as an Honorarium installation by Burning Man this year. As a result, the Life Cube is supported in part by a grant from Burning Man, but that funding is only a fraction of what we need to bring this huge installation to Black Rock City in 2015. 

Our costs include purchasing over 10,000 pounds of lumber and hardware, electrical and electronic equipment for dazzling lighting displays, trucks and transportation for tools and materials, generators, light towers, safety gear, painting supplies, FREE canvas for collaborative artwork contributed by 1000 members of the community, scissor lifts, ladders, scaffolding, leave-no-trace clean up equipment and disposal, and especially new this year, pyrotechnic effects and fuel for our expert burn specialists to present a spectacular finish to the Life Cube at Burning Man 2015. 

PLEASE JOIN US!

As something created by and for the community, the Life Cube at Burning Man is defined by radical inclusion and collaboration.  Interested in helping?  Want a tapestry panel?  Want to paint a mural?  Email us and let us know.  Like us on Facebook, and share your enthusiasm for this project!

We hope you’ll consider making a contribution to our fundraising campaign today. Donations in any amount are welcome.  

NOTE: If you're making a sizable gift and would like it to be tax-deductible, please contact us and we'll send you a separate link.

Your gift will join with others to bring the Life Cube to the Playa this year, bigger and better than ever. It’s all about participation, baby!

Thank you so much for your love and support!

scotte (skeeter on the playa), 

Professional Dreamer.

story:
GuatePhoto Festival was created to educate, promote, document and celebrate contemporary photography. In its first two editions GuatePhoto has witnessed a transformation of the Guatemalan and Latinamerican photography scene creating a new space for dialogue, an exchange of multicultural ideas, in addition to an being an interface with a wider public for participants.

The next edition of the Festival will take place in the cities of Guatemala and Antigua Guatemala in September 2015. We are working on an incredible list of artists, activities, venues, events, portfolio reviews and much more.

Invited artists and exhibitions include: Martin Parr, Luis González Palma & Graciela de Oliveira, Eadward Muybridge, Andy Warhol, 2015 Critical Mass Top 50, FotoVisura, New Latin American Photobooks and more!

“I was impressed about how the city turned itself over with the festival, a thing that is not easy to accomplish in other places, and you could live the sensation that almost everything that was going on in Guatemala during those days had something to do with photography.”

Curator and Artist - Marta Soul

“The reaction to the Open Call was very strong. We received hundreds of entries, including very convincing projects from the best international photographers. I had the honor to be part of the jury, and valued the opportunity to be exposed to this type of high quality work.”

Artist - Jaime Permuth

In the history of photography in Guatemala this edition of the festival surprised us and permanently immersed us in the abilities of dialogue, communication and new models of work that the digital era allows. After 2013 we were no longer the same. The Photographic production in Guatemala began to play in major leagues. The intertwine of looks that causes to see photographs from Gutamala. China, Mexico and South Africa, Costa Rica, Brazil and Europe in simultaneously ways, put us in front of that infinite ability to travel in space without borders that draws the digital age. 

However, beyond what was that celebration of photography, it is worth asking: that day we stopped being just Guatemalans? Were we sufficiently sensitive to these other realities? Could we understand that we are so similar, different, fragile and complex such as Chinese, Mexican or South Africans? This is what causes a great festival: reflect, reflect, and reflect on the paradoxes of our existence.

Independent curator - Rosina Cazali  


Getting the funds for the Festival is always the greatest challenge. The total costs to produce the 3rd edition of the Festival can go over $250,000. For our Indie Go-Go campaign we are aiming at coming up with +$50,000 to get our project jumpstarted and get the Festival rolling!

Thanks to the incredible sponsors like NatGeo and other local supporters, we are working on getting the rest of the funds in order to make the Festival possible. 

Help us make an EPIC ENCOUNTER IN THE AGE OF PHOTOGRAPHY, by collecting amazing art or getting your Open Call Discount to have the opportunity to be part of the Festival happening September 2015! 

La Fototeca is a School and Contemporary Photography Center based in Guatemala City co-founded by Guatemalan photographers Clara de Tezanos and JJ Estrada.

Through its educational programs, Fototropía Gallery and the GuatePhoto Festival (co-produced in its first two editions in collaborations with FotoVisura  and Rara Magazine), along with an incredibly talented group of young individuals aim at educating a new generation of photographers and creating a platform for emerging and established photographers. 

All the money we raise will go directly to cover the production costs of the Festival. The funds received by all our backers will be used for the production of +15 exhibitions and +20 events which include printing, mounting, framing, hosting, installation, site management, administration, logistics, catalog publication, rentals, participant fees, and marketing costs.

Every pledge contributes to making this epic encounter possible! Thank you!

Luis González Palma is a guatemalan photographer who lives and works in Córdoba, Argentina. His work has been widely exhibited internationally (United States, Australia, Mexico, England, Slovakia, France, Spain) both in solo exhibitions and in photography festivals. His work is included in major public and private collections such as The Art Institute of Chicago, The Daros Foundation in Zurich, Switzerland, La Maison European de la Photographie in Paris, France, The Houston Museum of Fine Arts in the U.S. and La Fondation pour l’Art Contemporain in Paris, France.

Alejandro Cartagena was born in Dominican Republic in 1977. He lives and works in Monterrey, Mexico since 1990. Cartagena earned his master's degree in visual arts at UANL. His work is focused on the exploration of landscape and portrait viewing as tools of cultural constructions, social and political that make up the Latin American societies. He has exhibited individually in Mexico, China, Italy, England, Canada and Guatemala and has participated in over 50 group exhibitions in countries of America, Asia and Europe.

Clara de Tezanos and JJ Estrada T. are the Co-Founders and Directors of La Fototeca, the GuatePhoto Festival and Fototropía Gallery. They have played an important role in the promotion of contemporary photography in Guatemala and Latinamerica . Their artistic participations include various local and international exhibits including, New York Photo Festival, Foto 30 (Guatemala), ESFOTO (El Salvador), Museo of Modern Art Carlos Merida (Guatemala), Galeria Ana Lucia Gomez (Guatemala), and Fototropia Gallery, alongside several curatorial participations.

Read All Bios

Made possible by National Geographic Channel

Special Thanks to:

Porta Hotels, Copa Airlines, Fundación Paiz, Fundación Rozas Botrán, Alessa, the incredibly talented Jesse Alan, students and team of La Fototeca.

In Collaboration with:

FotoVisura, Photolucida, Estudio Madalena, Lehigh University Art Galleries, Embassy of Mexico in Guatemala, Museum of Modern Art Carlos Mérida, Centro Cultural de España en Guatemala, the 9.99 Gallery, Casa Santo Domingo Museum, CIRMA, Sol del Rio Gallery, Feria del Libro, 500 Photographers, and many more to come...

For more information or question please feel free to contact us at:

  • Clara de Tezanos (Festival Director) / clara@guatephoto.org
  • Or Karen Fuhlrott (Festival Affairs) / hola@guatephoto.org
story_txt:
GuatePhoto Festival was created to educate, promote, document and celebrate contemporary photography. In its first two editions GuatePhoto has witnessed a transformation of the Guatemalan and Latinamerican photography scene creating a new space for dialogue, an exchange of multicultural ideas, in addition to an being an interface with a wider public for participants.


The next edition of the Festival will take place in the cities of Guatemala and Antigua Guatemala in September 2015. We are working on an incredible list of artists, activities, venues, events, portfolio reviews and much more. 
Invited artists and exhibitions include: Martin Parr, Luis González Palma & Graciela de Oliveira, Eadward Muybridge, Andy Warhol, 2015 Critical Mass Top 50, FotoVisura, New Latin American Photobooks and more!








“I was impressed about how the city turned itself over with the festival, a thing that is not easy to accomplish in other places, and you could live the sensation that almost everything that was going on in Guatemala during those days had something to do with photography.”
Curator and Artist - Marta Soul







“The reaction to the Open Call was very strong. We received hundreds of entries, including very convincing projects from the best international photographers. I had the honor to be part of the jury, and valued the opportunity to be exposed to this type of high quality work.”
Artist - Jaime Permuth






In the history of photography in Guatemala this edition
of the festival surprised us and permanently immersed us in the abilities of
dialogue, communication and new models of work that the digital era allows.
After 2013 we were no longer the same. The Photographic production in Guatemala
began to play in major leagues. The intertwine of looks that causes to see
photographs from Gutamala. China, Mexico and South Africa, Costa Rica, Brazil
and Europe in simultaneously ways, put us in front of that infinite ability to
travel in space without borders that draws the digital age. 


However, beyond what was that celebration of photography,
it is worth asking: that day we stopped being just Guatemalans? Were we
sufficiently sensitive to these other realities? Could we understand that we
are so similar, different, fragile and complex such as Chinese, Mexican or
South Africans? This is what causes a great festival: reflect, reflect, and
reflect on the paradoxes of our existence.
Independent
curator - Rosina Cazali  

Getting the funds for the Festival is always the greatest challenge. The total costs to produce the 3rd edition of the Festival can go over $250,000. For our Indie Go-Go campaign we are aiming at coming up with +$50,000 to get our project jumpstarted and get the Festival rolling!Thanks to the incredible sponsors like NatGeo and other local supporters, we are working on getting the rest of the funds in order to make the Festival possible. Help us make an EPIC ENCOUNTER IN THE AGE OF PHOTOGRAPHY, by collecting amazing art or getting your Open Call Discount to have the opportunity to be part of the Festival happening September 2015!

story:
Summary

I am Naomi Husher, a 16 year old sophomore with a passion for the arts and marine biology. 

My high school offers us an opportunity to study marine biology on Andros Island, the largest and least inhabited island on the Bahamas preserved to give students an opportunity to study tropical ecosystems. With an A in a rigorous college preparatory biology course, I have demonstrated scientific aptitude and been accepted into this exclusive program. 

As an artist, I am interested in working with the colors and shapes that I don't see in Vermont. I have studied color and drawing in high school for one and a half semesters and have been drawing nonstop since elementary school. Please see presented images for examples of my work. 

This is my first field study and marketing debut. 

What We Need

My parents have generously agreed to pay for part of this trip. 
  • I need $600 to take advantage of a match my parents are offering to cover the remaining trip costs.
  • I need $250 for my artistic materials and production costs. 
  • A small percentage of this will go towards IndieGoGo. 
  • So the grand fundraising total needs to be $850.

What You Get 

I'm offering you a chance to enjoy the artistic products of this trip. All donors will receive a .jpeg to enjoy. Other gifts you can enjoy based on your contribution are:
  • An original watercolor named after you.
  • An original watercolor painting.
  • A print of one of the original watercolor paintings of your choice.
  • A set of greeting cards.
  • A set of post cards.

Timeline

  • Travel and field study in May 2015
  • The creation, completion, and perfection of the four watercolors in June 2015
  • Production and delivery to you in July 2015

story:
What is Cloud 9? 

Cloud 9 is a beautiful, functional interactive art experience for EVERYONE on the playa to enjoy. She is a mobile sanctuary for anyone she encounters, who might wish or need a plush, fun filled, luxurious ride on the playa. With a well appointed sound system, blankets and pillows for cold deep playa nights and whimsically gracious hosts, we hope to offer an experience that is nothing short of heavenly!

Who are the Geishas?

Geisha House has been providing a fur & velvet lined air-conditioned sanctuary with free flowing sake and a friendly welcoming vibe on the Playa, for over a decade. In 2012, we successfully brought our first Art Car, Cloud 9. We are a small camp of hard working burners who pride ourselves in building cool shit for all to enjoy.

Why we need your help

We would love to bring Cloud 9 back to the Playa  To make that happen, we need your generous support for the following:

1. Repair of various leaks and mechanical problems on Cloud 9.  Hard to believe, but Cloud 9's innards are an aging Dodge Van (she has a very groovy soul, you know).  Much to our chagrin she suffered a number of breakdowns on Playa last year. She is in need of mechanical repairs before we can bring her back. 

2. Cleaning/Maintenance of Cloud 9. Yes, much fun was had.. and she certainly smells like it. So, we'll clean her and re-fur her where needed, replace any lights as needed

3. Transport to/from the Playa, as well as fuel for transporting Happy Burners all over the Playa for the weeklong event. 

The costs for the car, much of the materials to build it/pimp it out, the workshop/tools, the time, effort and love invested in building Cloud 9 was largely donated by the Geisha's in 2012. The cost to store Cloud 9 is also being absorbed by the Geisha's.


Why, why, and why? 

We believe Black Rock City needs fantastic art and fabulous Art Cars. So, we built one and we'd love to bring her back and share it with you all. 

Cloud 9 provides the opportunity to:

  • Be creative and whimsical.
  • Share and participate in community
  • Make and share Art, at one of the most unique events in the world

Thanks for your support. See you at Black Rock! 

And that’s all there is to it.

story:
Just who is Wham Bam Thank You Slam?

Gina Grissom, Whitney Shurtleff, Darren Edwards, Erika Larsen, and Ron Coulson have been graciously chosen by the creative community of St. George, Utah to represent them in a battle of words that will take place in Oakland, CA come August.

We are a hodge-podge group of poets who have come together, united under the flag of poetry and performance.

Each member of Wham Bam Thank You Slam has had a helping hand in nurturing and growing our local creative community, from hosting our weekly open mic nights to organizing and participating in our monthly successful Poetry Slam events.

Now that we've made it this far, we need your help to take it to the next level.

What your donations go to & How it can benefit you!

In order to attend Nationals, we need to cover a few things:

Registration - $500
Room & Board for 6 (5 team members and 1 Coach)
Gas money for 6 (5 team members and 1 Coach)

Your generosity is greatly appreciated, and we want to give you something in return, so we've set up a few perks.*

*If you do not live in St. George Utah, please include $5 or so for shipping.

The Big Picture!

While going to Nationals to compete is in of itself an exciting adventure, there is so much more that will be happening while we are there. Various workshops and side events will be taking place which will help us to hone and strengthen our craft. In turn, and upon our arrival home, this will allow us to help others who are looking to do the same!

Additional ways you can help:

Be sure to use Indiegogo share tools, and don't be shy, spread the word in whatever positive way you can!

We would also love to see you at our open mic nights, as well as our Poetry Slams. "Like" us on Facebook in order to keep informed of events and features!

story:
Imagine every dollar being important, now imagine if every Puerto Rican and there friends here on the island and across the States gave $1 to our proposed “David Hernandez Memorial Mural” we would end up with more than $8 million, more than enough for our project and for many community cultural arts projects on the island and across the United States for several years. So what do you say do you have a dollar?

Imagina cada dólar es importante, ahora imagínese si cada puertorriqueño y su á amigos aquí en la isla y en todos los Estados dieron $ 1 a nuestra propuesta de "David Hernández conmemorativo Mural" acabaríamos con más de 8 millones de dólares, más que suficiente para nuestro proyecto y para muchos proyectos artísticos culturales de la comunidad de la isla y en los Estados Unidos durante varios años. Entonces, ¿qué puedes decir qué tienes un dólar?

Una traducción española por Google de narrativa Inglés de nuestra propuesta.

A Spanish translation by Google follows the English narrative of our proposal.

I was born in the Bronx, of NY City, a cancer survivor, and a farther of two daughters and a proud grandfather of two grandchildren, a Nuyorican who has worked in Chicago as an artist/teaching artists for over 40 years and now living and working in San Juan, Puerto Rico. In facebook at: https://www.facebook.com/gamaliel.ramirez.58 and on my web site at: http://gamalielramirez.weebly.com I have posted albums of my paintings of the 60's, 70's, 80's, 90's and more recent works, other posting include my murals, poetry, photography, videos, resume, exhibition record, artist statement and more.

Our mission is a multi-discipline, multi-cultural and a cultural exchange project, a memorial mural to be designed, created and presented by a multicultural group of artists. Our goals are to create a memorial mural in the poet's hometown of Cidra, Puerto Rico to honor the literary works of the late David Hernandez the unofficial poet laureate of Chicago, IL, AKA "Famous Poet" and "Chi-town Brown".

This approximately 12 x 105 ft. memorial mural to be painted on a prominent wall visible to everybody who visits the town, the mural will be designed and painted by two of Chicago's renowned muralist artists Gamaliel Ramirez from Humboldt Park's Puerto Rican Community, and Robert Valade http://www.robertvaladez.com from Pilsen's Mexican Community, with the assistance of local area art students and all who wish to participate from Cidra, Puerto Rico, this town Cidra and the city of Chicago played a major role in influencing many of David's works and finally the mural will be dedicated as a free public event at a Chicago style dedication, with a live performances by invited spoken word poets and the musical group, "Street Sounds",featuring original members Dean Karabatsos on lead 6 and 12 string guitars, Francisco Gonzalez on second guitar, Gustavo Pena and Isabelino "Silo" Landor on percussion, Todd Hill on bass and new members; lead vocalist, Ana Santos Sanchez, who is also from the town of Cidra and Ethan Adelsman on violin.

Street Sounds https://www.facebook.com/StreetSoundsSonidosdelaCalle is an award-winning performance ensemble of music, songs, spoken word and lyrics that was founded in 1971 by poet David Hernandez and guitarist Dean Karabatsos. Joined by guitarist Francisco Gonzalez and percussionist Gustavo Pena. The group began creating music that uses elements of spoken word, Latin and contemporary jazz, blues, classical and afro-Caribbean and tipico music. The group is now a seven piece ensemble composed of a female vocalist, upright bass, 2 percussionists, violin and acoustic guitars.

This project is of the utmost importance to my community and very personal to me because David was my best friend since the 70's, my partner as an art activist and my mentor throughout my career, in the early 70's David and I organized and headed one of Chicago's first Latino not-for-profit artists run collective, El Taller/The Workshop that was credited for many cultural arts events free to all of the community, with money from the  Department of Human Resources of Chicago and the Lutheran foundation we offer art workshops in all of the mediums, publications, with financial support from the Illinois Arts Council we sponsors the first anthology of Midwest Latino artists, and for ten years we organized workshops, presentation and exhibitions throughout the Midwest and the US, As a matter-of-fact just before his passing, ironically we were on the phone talking about some ideas of doing some cultural arts exchange programs between Puerto Ricans on the island and the ones in the United States. Typically when we speak of cross-cultural you would think of two different countries, but in our case it will be a cultural exchange program within our own community, In our conversation David told me about this on line fund-raising phenomena, David and I both agreed that we needed to get connected with some alternatives online fund-raising sources, to make up for the extreme city, state and federal cuts on the arts, funds that David would refer to as "chump change" that most of the time never was intended for us or never reached us.

A Cross-cultural exchange program with a mission of connecting and creating an artistic dialogue between the two groups of our society. With half of our community of about 4 million living in the United States and the other half living here on the island, both groups are citizens but the island is a colony and because of it's political status one group knows nothing about the other group experiences, accomplishments or of the day to day on goings of there society, David and I wanted to change this reality. So now here I am, on line asking for your support in this awesome task of bringing our 8 million people together through art and culture. Our mural represents the beginning and promotes what David and I were talking about, this project will work towards this end, creating a dialogue between the community of the town of Cidra, Puerto Rico and the city of Chicago, IL, and it will serve as an example on how artists working with the community could share there experiences on the island and in Chicago and with the rest of the world.

Educational Aspects: The David Hernandez Memorial Mural (DHMM) during its production (March to April 2014) offers education outreach for the surrounding area of Cidra and Caguas, Puerto Rico. This unique artistic joint effort by two Chicago Latino veteran muralists (Gamaliel Ramirez and Roberto Valadez) share in their homage to the late poet, David Hernandez (1946-2013) and their artistic heritage with local children, professionals, and young artists. Inspired by Caribbean and Latin American artistic knowledge, Ramirez and Valadez bring to this project a community-driven vision, a Chicago artistic tradition of getting its audience partake in:

Cultural Knowledge: The mural's basic theme is to honor an important "Chirican" (Chicago-Puerto Rican) community poet, David Hernandez but will represent Caribbean, Latin American and local history relating other themes such as the Latino/a cultural migration to U.S. and elsewhere. Local participants and community partnerships can get cultural enrichment!

Mural Preparation: Professional understanding of technical skills with various paints out-doors mural production, and "Eco-friendly" approaches (recycled material and no usage of spray aerosol). This knowledge can be useful for basic job skill training and protects island culture!

Professional Development: The project's aim is to pay homage to Hernandez benefits nearby cultural institutions and schools. This mural, through internship and partnerships, can provide job training for local educators and artists by participating in a bilingual (English/Spanish) format!

Young People Mentoring: The project could serve as a tool for "capacity building" - in other words the passing one's knowledge to another person. In this case, local young people (regardless of color, gender or social class) get both artistic and cultural knowledge. Cultivating people is an investment; DHMM is built on the idea of art building community!

Ramirez and Valadez are leading community muralists who have worked with internationally known cultural and educational organizations including the Chicago Public School system, the National Museum of Mexican Art, Urban Gateways, and Gallery 37. They have conducted community and professional education workshops for thousands of people, serving a diversity of Chicago land and its surrounding communities. Their community-driven and public mural works can be found in many Chicago ethnic neighborhoods. Ramirez's local Chicago mural (favored by U.S. Midwest's Boricua populations) "Sea of Flags" was featured in the Hollywood movie, "Nothing Like the Holidays" with Latino actor, John Leguizamo!

The money raised in this campaign will pay: 

Two Muralist …………………………...   8,000.00 

Muralist Housing B & B ……………....    2,100.00

Mural Materials, Supplies …..………..    2,500.00

Musicians ……………………………..    1,500.00

Musicians Housing ……………………   2,700.00

Musical Instrument and P A rental …..   2,000.00 

Airline Transportation ………………..    4,000.00 

Publicist ………………………………    1,000.00 

Miscellaneous, Muralist local transportation, 

Documentation ………………………    1,500.00

                                                   Total $25,300.00

If we don't reached the entire goal requested, we will do with what we get, we probably would not be able to bring all of the musicians, but I'm confident that the folks here on the island and all of David's fans and friends in Chicago and throughout the world will not let us down.

Actually the budget should be much greater but I'm looking toward offsetting some of the cost with in-kind contribution from the mayor of the town and from the local business to provide publicity, other resources such as food and drinks for the dedication and possibly a night out a round the town for all of the participating artists. 

Traducción española Google de nuestra propuesta.

Nací en el Bronx, NY, un sobreviviente del cáncer, y una más de las dos hijas y un abuelo orgulloso de dos nietos, un Nuyorican que ha trabajado en Chicago como artista artista/enseñanza para más de 40 años y que ahora vive y que trabaja en San Juan , Puerto Rico. En facebook en: https://www.facebook.com/gamaliel.ramirez.58 y en mi sitio web en: http://gamalielramirez.weebly.com He publicado álbumes de mis pinturas de los años 60, los años 70, los años 80, 90 y obras más recientes, otra publicación incluyen mis murales, poesía, fotografía, vídeos, currículum, ficha de exposiciones, declaración del artista y mucho más.

Nuestra misión es un multi-disciplina, multi-cultural y un proyecto de intercambio cultural, un mural conmemorativo que ser diseñado, creado y presentado por un grupo multicultural de artistas. Nuestros objetivos son la creación de un mural conmemorativo en la ciudad natal del poeta de Cidra, Puerto Rico para honrar a las obras literarias de la tarde David Hernández el poeta laureado no oficial de Chicago, IL, AKA "Famoso Poeta" y "Chi -town Brown".

Esta aproximadamente 12 x 105 pies mural conmemorativo a ser pintado en una pared prominente visible a todos los que visitan la ciudad, el mural será diseñado y pintado por dos reconocidos artistas muralistas de Chicago, Gamaliel Ramírez de Humboldt Park comunidad Puertorriqueño, y Robert Valade http://www.robertvaladez.com partir de Pilsen comunidad Mexicana, con la asistencia de los estudiantes de arte de área local y todos los que deseen participar de Cidra, Puerto Rico, este Cidra ciudad y de la ciudad de Chicago jugaron un papel importante para influir en muchos de obras de David y, finalmente, el mural estará dedicada como un evento público gratuito en la dedicación al estilo de Chicago, con actuaciones en directo de invitados poetas de spoken word y el grupo musical "Street Sounds", con los miembros originales Dean Karabatsos sobre el plomo 6 y 12 cuerdas guitarras, Francisco González en la segunda guitarra, Gustavo Peña y Isabelino "Silo" Landor en la percusión, Todd Hill, en el bajo y los nuevos miembros; vocalista, Ana Santos Sánchez, quien también es de la ciudad de Cidra y Ethan Adelsman en el violín.


Sonidos De La Calle" https://www.facebook.com/StreetSoundsSonidosdelaCalle es un conjunto premiada interpretación de la música, las canciones, la palabra hablada y letra, que fue fundada en 1971 por el poeta David Hernández y el guitarrista Dean Karabatsos. Acompañado por el guitarrista Francisco González y el percusionista Gustavo Pena. El grupo comenzó a crear música que utiliza elementos de la palabra hablada, el latín y el jazz contemporáneo, blues, clásica y la música afro- caribeña y tipico. El grupo es ahora un conjunto de siete piezas compuesto por una vocalista femenina, bajo vertical, 2 percusionistas, violín y guitarras acústicas.

Este proyecto es de suma importancia para mi comunidad y muy personal para mí, porque David era mi mejor amigo desde los años 70, mi pareja como activista arte y mi mentor durante toda mi carrera, a principios de los 70, David y yo organizó y dirigió una de primera latinos artistas sin fines de lucro de Chicago corren colectiva, El Taller/The Workshop que fue acreditado por muchos eventos artísticos culturales gratuitas para toda la comunidad, con el dinero del Departamento de Recursos Humanos de Chicago y la fundación luterana ofrecemos talleres de arte en todos los medios, publicaciones, con el apoyo financiero del Consejo de Artes de Illinois que patrocina la primera antología de los artistas latinos Medio Oeste, y durante diez años organizamos talleres, presentaciones y exposiciones en todo el Medio Oeste y en los E.U., con carácter de - hecho justo antes de su muerte, irónicamente estábamos en el teléfono hablando de algunas ideas de hacer algunos programas de intercambio de artes culturales entre los puertorriqueños en la isla y los que están en los Estados Unidos. Normalmente cuando hablamos de intercultural se podría pensar de dos diferentes países, pero en nuestro caso, será un programa de intercambio cultural dentro de nuestra propia comunidad, en nuestra conversación David me habló de este fenómeno en la línea de recaudación de fondos, David y yo de acuerdo en que necesitábamos para conectarse con algunas alternativas de recaudación de línea aumentar las fuentes, para compensar los recortes al extremo de la ciudad, estatales y federales sobre las artes, los fondos de que David se refieren como  "calderilla" que la mayoría de las veces nunca fue pensado para nosotros o no nos llegó nunca.

Un programa de intercambio intercultural con la misión de conectar y crear un diálogo artístico entre los dos grupos de nuestra sociedad. Con la mitad de nuestra comunidad de cerca de 4 millones que viven en los Estados Unidos y la otra mitad viven aquí en la isla, ambos grupos son ciudadanos pero la isla es una colonia y debido a su estatus político a un grupo no sabe nada de las otras experiencias de grupo, logros o del día a día de venir de allí la sociedad, David y yo queríamos para cambiar esta realidad. Así que ahora estoy aquí, en línea pidiendo su apoyo en este impresionante tarea de llevar nuestros 8 millones de personas en conjunto a través del arte y la cultura. Nuestro mural representa el principio y promueve lo que David y yo estábamos hablando, este proyecto trabajará en pro de este objetivo, la creación de un diálogo entre la comunidad del pueblo de Cidra, Puerto Rico y la ciudad de Chicago, IL, y que servirá como un ejemplo de cómo los artistas que trabajan con la comunidad puedan compartir allí las experiencias en la isla y en Chicago y con el resto del mundo.

Aspectos educativos: El Mural Conmemorativo David Hernández (DHMM) durante su producción (03-04, 2014) ofrece educación y divulgación para los alrededores de Cidra y Caguas, Puerto Rico. Este esfuerzo conjunto artístico único por dos muralistas veteranos latinos de Chicago (Gamaliel Ramírez y Roberto Valadez) participación en el homenaje al fallecido poeta, David Hernández (1946-2013) y de su patrimonio artístico con los niños locales, profesionales y artistas jóvenes. Inspirado por el conocimiento artístico del Caribe y de América Latina, Ramírez y Valadez aportar a este proyecto una visión impulsado por la comunidad, una tradición artística de Chicago de conseguir su público participan en: Conocimiento cultural: el tema básico de El mural es honrar a un importante" Chirican" (Chicago- Puerto Rico) Poeta comunidad, David Hernández, pero representará Caribe, la historia latinoamericana y locales en relación a otros temas como la/a la migración cultural latina de E.U. y en otro lugar. Los participantes locales y las asociaciones de la comunidad pueden obtener el enriquecimiento cultural!

Preparación Mural: la comprensión profesional de las competencias técnicas con varias pinturas fuera de las puertas de la producción mural y enfoques "Eco-friendly" (material reciclado y sin uso de aerosol spray). Este conocimiento puede ser útil para la formación de habilidades básicas de trabajo y protege la cultura de la isla!

Desarrollo Profesional: El objetivo del proyecto es para rendir homenaje a Hernández beneficia a instituciones culturales y escuelas cercanas. Este mural,a través de prácticas y las asociaciones, puede proporcionar la capacitación laboral de los educadores y artistas locales, al participar en un formato bilingüe (Inglés / Español)!

Jóvenes Mentores: El proyecto podría servir como una herramienta para la "creación de capacidad"-en otras palabras, el que pasa a su conocimiento a otra persona. En este caso, los jóvenes locales (independientemente del color, género o clase social) reciben tanto el conocimiento artístico y cultural. El cultivo de poblaciones es una inversión; DHMM se basa en la idea de la construcción de la comunidad de arte.

Ramírez y Valadez lideran muralistas comunitarios que han trabajado con organizaciones culturales y educativas de renombre internacional, incluido el sistema de las Escuelas Públicas de Chicago, el Museo Nacional de Arte Mexicano, Urban Gateways y Galería 37. Se han llevado a cabo la comunidad y talleres de formación profesional para miles de personas, que sirve una variedad de tierra de Chicago y sus comunidades aledañas. Impulsado por la comunidad y su obra mural público se puede encontrar en muchos barrios étnicos de Chicago. Mural Chicago locales de Ramírez (favorecido por las poblaciones Boricua de E.U. del Medio Oeste) "Mar de Banderas" fue incluida en la película de Hollywood, "Nothing Like the Holidays." con el actor latino, John Leguizamo!

El dinero recaudado en esta campaña va a pagar:

Dos Muralista .................................................. 8,000.00

Muralista B & B Vivienda ................................ 2,100.00

Materiales Mural , Suministros ....................... 2.500,00

Músicos ........................................................... 1,500.00

Músicos Vivienda ........................................... 2,700.00

Instrumentos musicales y P Un alquiler ....... 2,000.00

Aerolínea de Transporte ............................... 4,000.00

Publicista ........................................................ 1,000.00

Varios, transporte local Muralista ,

Documentación ............................................. 1,500.00

                                                           Total $ 25,300.00

Si no llegamos a la meta entera solicitado, lo haremos con lo que conseguimos, que probablemente no será capaz de llevar a todos los músicos, pero estoy seguro de que la gente aquí en la isla y todos los fans de David y amigos en Chicago y en todo el mundo no nos defraudó.

En realidad, el presupuesto debe ser mucho mayor, pero estoy mirando hacia compensar algunos de los costos con la contribución en especie por parte del alcalde de la ciudad y de las empresas locales para ofrecer publicidad, otros recursos, como alimentos y bebidas por la dedicación y posiblemente una noche de una ronda de la ciudad para todos los artistas participantes.
story_txt:
Imagine every dollar being important, now imagine if every Puerto Rican and there friends here on the island and across the States gave $1 to our proposed “David Hernandez Memorial Mural” we would end up with more than $8 million, more than enough for our project and for many community cultural arts projects on the island and across the United States for several years. So what do you say do you have a dollar?Imagina cada dólar es importante, ahora imagínese si cada puertorriqueño y su á amigos aquí en la isla y en todos los Estados dieron $ 1 a nuestra propuesta de "David Hernández conmemorativo Mural" acabaríamos con más de 8 millones de dólares, más que suficiente para nuestro proyecto y para muchos proyectos artísticos culturales de la comunidad de la isla y en los Estados Unidos durante varios años. Entonces, ¿qué puedes decir qué tienes un dólar?Una traducción española por Google de narrativa Inglés de nuestra propuesta.A Spanish translation by Google follows the English narrative of our proposal.I was born in the Bronx, of NY City, a cancer survivor, and a farther
of two daughters and a proud grandfather of two grandchildren, a Nuyorican who
has worked in Chicago as an artist/teaching
artists for over 40 years and now living and working in San
 Juan, Puerto Rico. In facebook at:
https://www.facebook.com/gamaliel.ramirez.58 and on my web site at:
http://gamalielramirez.weebly.com I have posted albums of my paintings of the
60's, 70's, 80's, 90's and more recent works, other posting include my murals,
poetry, photography, videos, resume, exhibition record, artist statement and
more.
Our mission is a multi-discipline, multi-cultural and a cultural
exchange project, a memorial mural to be designed, created and presented by a
multicultural group of artists. Our goals are to create a memorial mural in the
poet's hometown of Cidra, Puerto Rico to honor the literary works of the late
David Hernandez the unofficial poet laureate of Chicago, IL, AKA "Famous
Poet" and "Chi-town Brown". 
This approximately 12 x 105 ft. memorial mural to be painted
on a prominent wall visible to everybody who visits the town, the mural will be
designed and painted by two of Chicago's renowned muralist artists Gamaliel
Ramirez from Humboldt Park's Puerto Rican Community, and Robert Valade http://www.robertvaladez.com from
Pilsen's Mexican Community, with the assistance of local area art students and
all who wish to participate from Cidra, Puerto Rico, this town Cidra and the
city of Chicago played a major role in influencing many of David's works and finally the mural will be dedicated as a free public event at a Chicago style dedication, with a live performances by invited spoken word poets and the musical group, "Street Sounds",featuring original members Dean Karabatsos on lead 6 and 12 string guitars, Francisco Gonzalez on second guitar, Gustavo Pena and Isabelino "Silo" Landor on percussion, Todd Hill on bass and new members; lead vocalist, Ana Santos Sanchez, who is also from the town of Cidra and Ethan Adelsman on violin.
Street Sounds https://www.facebook.com/StreetSoundsSonidosdelaCalle is an award-winning performance ensemble of music, songs, spoken word and lyrics that was founded in 1971 by poet David Hernandez and guitarist Dean Karabatsos. Joined by guitarist Francisco Gonzalez and percussionist Gustavo Pena. The group began creating music that uses elements of spoken word, Latin and contemporary jazz, blues, classical and afro-Caribbean and tipico music. The group is now a seven piece ensemble composed of a female vocalist, upright bass, 2 percussionists, violin and acoustic guitars.
This project is of the utmost importance to my community and very
personal to me because David was my best friend since the 70's, my partner as
an art activist and my mentor throughout my career, in the early 70's David and
I organized and headed one of Chicago's first Latino not-for-profit artists run collective, El Taller/The Workshop that was credited for many cultural arts events
free to all of the community, with money from the  Department of Human
Resources of Chicago and the Lutheran foundation we offer art workshops in
all of the mediums, publications, with financial support from the Illinois Arts
Council we sponsors the first anthology of Midwest Latino artists, and for ten years we organized workshops, presentation and
exhibitions throughout the Midwest and the US, As a matter-of-fact just before
his passing, ironically we were on the phone talking about some ideas of doing
some cultural arts exchange programs between Puerto Ricans on the island and
the ones in the United States. Typically when we speak of cross-cultural you
would think of two different countries, but in our case it will be a cultural
exchange program within our own community, In our conversation David told me
about this on line fund-raising phenomena, David and I both agreed that we
needed to get connected with some alternatives online fund-raising sources, to
make up for the extreme city, state and federal cuts on the arts, funds that
David would refer to as "chump change" that most of the time never
was intended for us or never reached us.
A Cross-cultural exchange program with a mission of connecting and
creating an artistic dialogue between the two groups of our society. With half
of our community of about 4 million living in the United States and the other
half living here on the island, both groups are citizens but the island is a
colony and because of it's political status one group knows nothing about the
other group experiences, accomplishments or of the day to day on goings of
there society, David and I wanted to change this reality. So now here I am, on
line asking for your support in this awesome task of bringing our 8 million
people together through art and culture. Our mural represents the beginning and
promotes what David and I were talking about, this project will work towards
this end, creating a dialogue between the community of the town of Cidra,
Puerto Rico and the city of Chicago, IL, and it will serve as an example on how
artists working with the community could share there experiences on the island
and in Chicago and with the rest of the world.
Educational Aspects: The David Hernandez Memorial Mural (DHMM) during
its production (March to April 2014) offers education outreach for the
surrounding area of Cidra and Caguas, Puerto Rico. This unique artistic joint effort by two
Chicago Latino veteran muralists (Gamaliel Ramirez and Roberto Valadez)
share in their
homage to the late poet, David Hernandez (1946-2013) and their artistic
heritage with local children, professionals, and young artists. Inspired by
Caribbean and Latin American artistic knowledge, Ramirez and Valadez bring to
this project a community-driven vision, a Chicago artistic tradition of
getting its audience partake in:
Cultural Knowledge: The mural's
basic theme is to
honor an important "Chirican" (Chicago-Puerto Rican) community poet,
David Hernandez but will represent Caribbean, Latin American and local history
relating other themes such as the Latino/a cultural migration to U.S.
and elsewhere. Local participants and community partnerships can get cultural
enrichment!
Mural Preparation: Professional understanding of technical skills with
various paints out-doors mural production, and "Eco-friendly"
approaches (recycled material and no usage of spray aerosol). This knowledge
can be useful for basic job skill training and protects island culture!
Professional Development: The project's aim is to pay homage to Hernandez
benefits nearby cultural institutions and schools. This mural, through
internship and partnerships,
can provide job training for local educators and artists by participating in a
bilingual (English/Spanish) format!
Young People Mentoring: The project could serve as a tool for
"capacity building" - in other words the passing one's knowledge to
another person. In this case, local young people (regardless of color, gender
or social class) get both artistic and cultural knowledge. Cultivating people
is an investment; DHMM is built on the idea of art building community!
Ramirez and Valadez are leading community muralists who have worked with internationally known cultural and
educational organizations including the Chicago Public School
system, the National Museum of Mexican Art, Urban Gateways, and Gallery 37. They have
conducted community and professional education workshops for thousands of
people, serving a diversity of Chicago
land and its surrounding communities.
Their community-driven and public mural works can be found in many Chicago ethnic
neighborhoods. Ramirez's local Chicago mural (favored by U.S. Midwest's
Boricua populations) "Sea of Flags" was featured in the Hollywood
movie, "Nothing Like the Holidays" with Latino actor, John Leguizamo!
The money raised in this campaign will pay: Two Muralist …………………………...   8,000.00 Muralist Housing B & B ……………....    2,100.00Mural Materials, Supplies …..………..    2,500.00Musicians ……………………………..    1,500.00Musicians Housing ……………………   2,700.00Musical Instrument and P A rental …..   2,000.00 Airline Transportation ………………..    4,000.00 Publicist ………………………………    1,000.00 Miscellaneous, Muralist local transportation, Documentation ………………………    1,500.00                                                   Total $25,300.00If we don't reached the entire goal requested, we will do with what we
get, we probably would not be able to bring all of the musicians, but I'm
confident that the folks here on the island and all of David's fans and friends
in Chicago and
throughout the world will not let us down.
Actually the budget should be much greater but I'm looking toward
offsetting some of the cost with in-kind contribution from the mayor of the town
and from the local business to provide publicity, other resources such as food and drinks for the dedication
and possibly a night out a round the town for all of the participating artists. Traducción española Google de nuestra propuesta.Nací en el Bronx, NY, un sobreviviente del cáncer, y una más de las dos hijas y un abuelo orgulloso de dos nietos, un Nuyorican que ha trabajado en Chicago como artista artista/enseñanza para más de 40 años y que ahora vive y que trabaja en San Juan , Puerto Rico. En facebook en: https://www.facebook.com/gamaliel.ramirez.58 y en mi sitio web en: http://gamalielramirez.weebly.com He publicado álbumes de mis pinturas de los años 60, los años 70, los años 80, 90 y obras más recientes, otra publicación incluyen mis murales, poesía, fotografía, vídeos, currículum, ficha de exposiciones, declaración del artista y mucho más.Nuestra misión es un multi-disciplina, multi-cultural y un proyecto de intercambio cultural, un mural conmemorativo que ser diseñado, creado y presentado por un grupo multicultural de artistas. Mural Chicago locales de Ramírez (favorecido por las poblaciones Boricua de E.U. del Medio Oeste) "Mar de Banderas" fue incluida en la película de Hollywood, "Nothing Like the Holidays." con el actor latino, John Leguizamo!El dinero recaudado en esta campaña va a pagar:Dos Muralista .................................................. 8,000.00Muralista B & B Vivienda ................................ 2,100.00Materiales Mural , Suministros ....................... 2.500,00Músicos ........................................................... 1,500.00Músicos Vivienda ........................................... 2,700.00Instrumentos musicales y P Un alquiler ....... 2,000.00Aerolínea de Transporte ............................... 4,000.00Publicista ........................................................ 1,000.00Varios, transporte local Muralista ,Documentación ............................................. 1,500.00                                                           Total $ 25,300.00Si no llegamos a la meta entera solicitado, lo haremos con lo que conseguimos, que probablemente no será capaz de llevar a todos los músicos, pero estoy seguro de que la gente aquí en la isla y todos los fans de David y amigos en Chicago y en todo el mundo no nos defraudó.En realidad, el presupuesto debe ser mucho mayor, pero estoy mirando hacia compensar algunos de los costos con la contribución en especie por parte del alcalde de la ciudad y de las empresas locales para ofrecer publicidad, otros recursos, como alimentos y bebidas por la dedicación y posiblemente una noche de una ronda de la ciudad para todos los artistas participantes.

story:
Dragons need hugs too. 

As a child, I adored plushies and now as an adult, I adore having one as a pillow for naps or just to have on the back of the couch. Why a dragon? Dragons are the love of children and adults alike for their mythic power and have been a part of human history for hundreds of years. But not all dragons need to be the scary spiny demons of stories, this guy is soft and cuddly! 

What We Need & What You Get

In order to get a proper quote and a good quality plush, I need to get a good prototype done. This will involve the researching of materials, companies and manufacturing processes and of course, cost money. The money that is put into this fund will go directly towards the final manufacturing after the prototype is completed.  Each dollar you donate goes directly toward your future plush!


The final estimated cost for these is about 80$ each. International shipping will be available!

story:
Short Summary

The Runaway Princess is a storybook written by six year old Kellen Calloway (with some help from her Dad, Noel Calloway) about an imaginative little seven year old named Maya Bell. Maya dreams of being a princess, living in a grand castle. Her dreams are so vivid, she's convinced she actually is a real life Princess. When her two cousins tell her she is in fact just a regular little girl like everyone else, Maya sets out to prove that she is royalty by running away from home to find the castle of her dreams, in New York City

The storybook, illustrated by Keturah Bobo (www.KeturahAriel.com), is complete.  Your contributions will help with the costs of printing and promoting the book as well as the completion of the accompanying web series starring Kellen Calloway, directed by Noel Calloway (www.NoelCallowayFilms.com).  Our goal is to secure publishing and distribution for the book so it may reach children all around the world, also for the development of a mobile app based on the book.


What We Need & What You Get

We need $5,168, to be exact,to cover the costs of:  

Printing & Shipping

App Design

Web Series Post Production


The Impact

As a Father it has been incredible to develop this project with my daughter Kellen.  She has spent time with me on many movie sets and began asking when she could make her own movie.  I challenged her to write a story and we'd see.  "The Runaway Princess" is her story.  Living up to my end of the bargain, we adapted the story to a screenplay and produced the film.  We feel the book, the story and the accompanying film are important not only for the content within the pages but also because it shows young girls and boys that anything is possible.  


Other Ways You Can Help

You can help by contributing in any way.  Not everyone can give money but anyone can spread the word!
