story:
Hello Friends,

I've been invited to travel to Shanghai, China January 3-13, 2016 to participate in the ArtShape Mammoth Art exhibition and symposium along with 4 other artists from around the United States. I was selected by ArtShape Mammoth and Shanghai curator, LuFei Sun, who will be guiding us around the city.

The other artists who will be traveling and exhibiting with me are Aubrey Roemer, David Alban, Kristen Tordella-Williams and Amy Joy Hosterman.

We plan to install our artwork (in my case, paintings) at United Art Space on 50 Moganshan Road, which is a contemporary art district that has been compared to New York's Soho. The exhibition will be on display for the month of January. We will give artist talks, and visit Shanghai galleries and artist's studios to network. This would be my first International exhibition, and traveling to China has been a dream of mine for some time. I became interested in Chinese art when my aunt gave me a brush painting book as a teenager. That early experience shaped my development as a painter. This is an except from my graduate thesis:

 "I especially identify with the organization of space in traditional Chinese landscape painting. The space is often organized vertically, rather than horizontally or through linear perspective.

The treatment of space and light inside of a painting is something that I have been working to achieve in my work. Using washes of transparent ink to create layers is a technique that I have developed through my process of experimentation and by studying Chinese painting methods."

Check out my blog and website for my artist statement and more images of my work.

Here's some information about myself and ArtShape Mammoth:

  • I'm from Rolette, North Dakota, attended the University of North Dakota and earned a BFA in Painting and a BA in Communications and Honors. Then I attended graduate school at Montana State University in Bozeman for my MFA. Now I live in Rice Lake, Wisconsin, where I work as a professional artist and Lecturer of Art at the University of Wisconsin - Barron County. Artist residencies include Vermont Studio Center, The Anderson Center at Tower View, and the Golden Foundation Artist Residency.

  • Artshape Mammoth (ASM) is a nationwide organization with the mission to enhance contemporary arts dialog by supporting the development of artists and connecting them with new communities. I'm one of the 30 artists that are represented in this group. Since 2013, I participated in a group exhibition in Bushwick at Loft 594, exhibited my work in a two person show in Fort Bragg California, spent at week making artwork at the Visitor Center Sustainable Practices Symposium in Michigan's U.P., and most recently I was selected by 4Heads to be part of the ASM group show at the Governor's Island Art Fair along with 9 other Artshape mammoth members for the month of September.

  • Share my journey- This is an incredible opportunity to bring my paintings to a completely new audience, but I need your help to get there! I will be posting updates about the adventure on my Wordpress blog regularly in January.

  • Artist Statement- I explore geographic formations, organisms and natural phenomena, through the medium of acrylic paint. My painting process allows for spontaneity and chaos to play a role, as a way to connect to disorder and entropy. This involves spraying, dripping, and applying color with wide hake brushes onto an absorbent panel. An otherworldly element is added as I contort and manipulate the illusion of space on the painted surface, intuitively working in layers. Pours, drips and blooms of pigment speak to gravity and help to create an illusion of deep space or surface tension.

Budget

My expenses:

Flight - MSP to Shanghai - approx $1500 round-trip

Lodging - (10 days) $500- $700

Artwork Shipping - $250

Visa Application - $72

Food/Misc Expenses - $200-$300

Total: $2,522 - $2,822


What You Get

This will be a great chance to acquire some of my original artwork.

The $10 perk is a postcard featuring one of my paintings.

For $25 you will receive a handwritten thank you card with a print of one of my sketches from the trip.

Another $25 option is this new perk: An original drawing-a-day colored pencil or pen drawing from 2014. Yes I did one a drawing a day for a year, and you can own one! You can also request a season or day!

Examples:


The $75 perk is an 8 x 10 in. inkjet print/acrylic painting. (Outside dimensions with border 8  1/2 x 11 in.)  I start by printing a digital photo, then I paint on top of it with High Flow Golden Acrylic; so each one is an original! They are based on photos that I took in the Blue Hills in Wisconsin. They come with a 11 x 14 in. white mat with an 8 x 10 in. opening, ready to frame. Here are some examples:



For $150 you will receive an original 11 x 14 in. photo transfer and acrylic painting on watercolor paper.

For $250 I will send you the $25 perk (thank you card), the $75 perk (Print/Painting) and the $150 perk (11 x 14 in. original).

For $500 I will paint you a custom 12 x 12 in. acrylic painting with photo transfer on wood panel. You will have the option to choose the color scheme.

For $1000 in addition to my eternal gratitude, you will get a custom 24 x 30 in. acrylic painting on wood panel with custom colors, or two 12 x 12 in. paintings.


What if I don't meet my goal?

If I don't make enough from this campaign to pay for my flight, I may not be able to go to China. In that case, I will use the funds to purchase art supplies to create new paintings, and you will still get your perks!

If I exceed my goal, I will use the additional funds for art supplies to create paintings inspired by my journey.

    Risks & Challenges

    • One challenge is that I don't know how to speak Mandarin.
    • We will have a guide for the trip, curator LuFei Sun, who will be able to translate for us. And many people who live in Shanghai speak fluent English.
    • I will also study basic Mandarin phrases in the months leading up to the trip.
    • A new city has it's risks, but traveling with a group of artists that I already know will help, as well as having a local guide.

    Other Ways You Can Help

    • Please share this campaign with your friends, I would greatly appreciate it!
    • You can use the Indiegogo share tools on the left sidebar.

story:
Gloryfibers& Designer Co.

My name is Jennifer Cauffman and I would like to share with you the moving truths regarding the decline and fight for survival of the “endangered” artist. 


Designing & Art were a constant for me as a Child.

I loved to draw at an early age, sharing the joy of the arts to as many people as possible. 

I attended many art schools  to enhance this gift.

 I have a Ad Art degree and a Fiber Degree with a minor in Painting , from CCA in Cal. and Suny @ Farmingdale . And studied Religion, Etching , pottery @Covenant College .


  • Painting a 8 foot mural

    on the wall at 15 yrs old.

  • Designing clothes for my dolls and friends .

  • Painting many Victorian costumes for hours

  • Making my own clothes.

  • Designing wrapping paper, regularly.

  • Starting Mural painting on my campus, a 14'wall.

  • Designing shoes painting, feathered earrings

  • Working for the leather , and glass artist ,

    Donating to Others to share the love of the arts became a Vital Part of My Life

  • Loving the arts and starting the art shows at my Ga. Campus

  • Donating my time for a full year to support the arts on campus.

  • For over 8 years have I have tremendously enjoyed donating my time, organizing a youth art of about 300 pieces during the State run Fair here in Pa.

  • I also donate my time in a class for parents.

Silk Painting gave me and others so much life.

After college I started a large family ( I have 5 children), which didn't really allow me to devote as much time as I needed towards my fiber and art creations . Although life was very demanding, I was inspired to paint, the desire to bring happy energy and thoughts to myself and all of us.
In 1988 I took an additional class, and there I fell in Love with the flow and intensity of brilliant colors, which brought even more life and joy to myself and others. I slowly showed in craft shows, have much success, eventually building up to 15 shows a year for 25 years.

The Joys and Difficulty of the Craft show scene

  • It’s wonderful to meet people, sharing the life and joyful expression of the arts

  • Having the opportunity to create is truly an amazing Gift from God!

  • Sadly, many more people used to attend our shows and support us (the artists) by purchasing our unique designs and creations,
    Due to the economy and the lack of “boost” for promoting love of the arts, it’s extremely hard for us to now make a living

  • Physically, the work is very demanding, loading and unloading and as we get older, it becomes more and more exhausting.

  • The overhead for entering and performing in art shows is financially draining: fees from the promoters, gas, hotels, city parking ,the cost of silk, hiring American workers to aid in production, etc…
    Ultimately, the profit required in order to survive is dwindling.


As you can see, the risk is far exceeding the rewards and thus I have reinvented my product, which is where I now need help from others. This is a different situation and somewhat uncomfortable for me, as I was the one in the past who was “helping”....



HOPE for the artist

  • Reinventing ourselves and our product is a risky constant and a vital need for existence.
    When we are brave enough to make necessary changes however, the benefits are great for all of us, the artist and the consumer who love and appreciate true art.

  • Reinvention; I now have an opportunity to print my art expressions in America, reducing costs, without compromising the beauty and quality of my design and expression. The designs would be much more affordable for me to create and for the consumer. It would allow me to maintain my love of creating my one of a kind designs and to once again create an appreciation of original design to the consume

BUT I SO BADLY NEED YOUR HELP!

As a designer an artist, the costs to make this transition are great. I have an opportunity which would be a dream to me, creating one of kind designs for a store and sharing that with others. It would mean no longer (at almost 60 years) traveling from show to show, but rather being able to share a “print” of my designs.

Where will your money go?

With the money raised from this campaign, I will be able to enter the NY Gift Show and share my designs and creations with others who I know will appreciate them and will desire to carry them. It is this opportunity that I am so greatly seeking your help. TO keep the heart and passion of a forgotten artist alive.
It truly is an opportunity to not just survive, but to continue my passion of so many years: to create and to share the love of my designs in a way that is now feasible in this new day and age.

WHAT ARE THE PERKS?

I offered 5 designs for you to pick from, especially made for this campaign.
These are unique designs and creations, representing my soul and vision.

Please feel free to look at my website also, http://www.GloryFibers.com
I also can have your pet or child drawn for you, as we do portraits as well.
Designs are washable and copyrighted!

Helping me would be so amazing, Its a humbling moment to do this, but all of us need to reach out sometime in our lives, And its getting me to this next level, of a new exspensive adventure of printing my work , and then the big shows that are so exspensive. 

I think My love, my character, my drive, my persistence, and The God I serve, helps me to keep on keeping on.

 And I


believe this is the gift I was given to share; to put smiles on peoples faces and bring aesthetic harmony to a home, and a gift of friendship to a friend .

I paint from The brilliance of nature and have been taught how to balance and make it clear and add some Charm, chutzpah, and a little Whimsy, which fills the bill for a continual conscientious as Unique, one of a kind.

Thank you for helping the Arts live on and keeping our $ in America ,

and Helping me be all I can be , and my work to live on while I’m alive.

Sincerely, With Much Gratitude ,

Jennifer Cauffman

Gloryfibers & Designer Co.


You get : 

The Pillow pictures above are the choices 

for the 15-30$ price it will be a small printed painting of these , size is about 9x5" pieces of silk/cotton print ,

pillow or flat printed picture piece.

Which you make it into something you chooses.

Which there is about 6 printed choices.

60$ donation get you a printed pillow ,

Check out my site www.gloryfibers.com  click pillows 

100$ donation , gets you a hand painted pillow , you choose from my site , no bigger than 18" unless we talk and you want a special idea.

 200$ gives you a lighter style jacket or a couple of pillows 

300$ gets you a silk painted jacket or a style of your choosing .

Anything above gets you a painting on a wall  and a design you prefer , we might be able to quilt it and make it 3-D as we often do . Please call for any of those ideas .

If you cant donate , we appreciate Prayers and referring people to out site if they give and reference you (depending how much they give ) We will give you a printed pillow as well.

 If I don't reach my goal , I will use this for the up coming shows and am still going to do this show , and hope some of my shows will fund it . I will save any $ towards another wholesale show. There is many , this is one of the best .

many stores come to this , and I am writing to  the past interested parties that took an interest before. Like Orvis , Boston Museum .

I was pictured in Cosmopolitan magazine years ago, NBC studios has my peacock pillow ,LGB mag  for the trade. Some of my customers are Gore  Industries, Dansko shoes , Hawaiian Punch

 PLEASE come on Board and support this cause ! 

Now is the Time to help the Artist community And keep  jobs in America and our $ in America. 

We will be putting a blog up to post our progress and outcomes of this show and further  creations . We are on FB, were working on Instagram and Pinterest, and my site that everything is hand painted www.gloryfibers.com.

the next shows are :Annapolis  june 7,8 

                                   Chicago: The Highlands Area june 28,29, the botanical Gardens in Chicago  July 5,6 , 

Then the NYGift Show  which is the funds I need you to help me with.Aug 16-20.

We start all over again the shows in Sept which will be posted on my website .

Thankyou  and God Bless . I once heard a potter say" Do it and Ill show up. "

We all have to take a step of faith in something we believe in. And hopefully I have shared enough , that you can believe in this step for me . 

If there is any questions please email me Gloryfibers@yahoo.com.

May the sun be on your side and Gods loving  care  carry you through.

	my art expressions in America, reducing costs, without compromising
	the beauty and quality of my design and expression. The designs
	would be much more affordable for me to create and for the consumer.
	It would allow me to maintain my love of creating my one of a kind
	designs and to once again create an appreciation of original design
	to the consume


BUT
I SO BADLY NEED YOUR HELP!

As
a designer an artist, the costs to make this transition are great.  I
have an opportunity which would be a dream to me, creating one of
kind designs for a store and sharing that with others.  It would mean
no longer (at almost 60 years) traveling from show to show, but
rather being able to share a “print” of my designs. Where
will your money go?With the money raised from this campaign,
I will be able to enter the NY Gift Show and share my designs and
creations with others who I know will appreciate them and will desire
to carry them.  It is this opportunity that I am so greatly seeking
your help.  TO keep the heart and passion of a forgotten artist
alive. It truly is an opportunity to not just survive, but to
continue my passion of so many years: to create and to share the love
of my designs in a way that is now feasible in this new day and
age.WHAT ARE THE PERKS? I
offered 5 designs for you to pick from, especially made for this
campaign.These are unique designs and creations, representing my
soul and vision.Please feel free to look at my website also, 
http://www.GloryFibers.com
I also can have your pet or child drawn for you, as we do
portraits as well.  Designs are washable and copyrighted!
 Helping
me would be so amazing, Its a humbling moment to do this, but all of
us need to reach out sometime in our lives, And its getting me to this next level, of a new exspensive adventure of printing my work , and then the big shows that are so exspensive. 

I
think My love, my character, my drive, my persistence, and The God I
serve, helps me to keep on keeping on. And I believe
this is the gift I was given to share; to put smiles on peoples faces
and bring aesthetic harmony to a home, and a gift of friendship  to a
friend .I
paint from The brilliance of nature and have been taught how to
balance and make it clear and add some Charm, chutzpah, and a little
Whimsy, which fills the bill for a continual conscientious as Unique,
one of a kind.
Thank
you for helping the Arts live on and keeping our $ in America ,
and
Helping me be all I can be , and my work to live on while I’m
alive.
Sincerely,
With Much Gratitude ,
Jennifer
Cauffman
Gloryfibers
& Designer Co.You get : The Pillow pictures above are the choices for the 15-30$ price it will be a small printed painting of these , size is about 9x5" pieces of silk/cotton print ,pillow or flat printed picture piece.Which you make it into something you chooses.Which there is about 6 printed choices.60$ donation get you a printed pillow ,Check out my site www.gloryfibers.com  click pillows 100$ donation , gets you a hand painted pillow , you choose from my site , no bigger than 18" unless we talk and you want a special idea. 200$ gives you a lighter style jacket or a couple of pillows 300$ gets you a silk painted jacket or a style of your choosing .Anything above gets you a painting on a wall  and a design you prefer , we might be able to quilt it and make it 3-D as we often do . Please call for any of those ideas .If you cant donate , we appreciate Prayers and referring people to out site if they give and reference you (depending how much they give ) We will give you a printed pillow as well. If I don't reach my goal , I will use this for the up coming shows and am still going to do this show , and hope some of my shows will fund it . I will save any $ towards another wholesale show. There is many , this is one of the best .many stores come to this , and I am writing to  the past interested parties that took an interest before. Like Orvis , Boston Museum .I was pictured in Cosmopolitan magazine years ago, NBC studios has my peacock pillow ,LGB mag  for the trade. Some of my customers are Gore  Industries, Dansko shoes , Hawaiian Punch PLEASE come on Board and support this cause ! Now is the Time to help the Artist community And keep  jobs in America and our $ in America. We will be putting a blog up to post our progress and outcomes of this show and further  creations . We are on FB, were working on Instagram and Pinterest, and my site that everything is hand painted www.gloryfibers.com.the next shows are :Annapolis  june 7,8                                    Chicago: The Highlands Area june 28,29, the botanical Gardens in Chicago  July 5,6 , Then the NYGift Show  which is the funds I need you to help me with.Aug 16-20.We start all over again the shows in Sept which will be posted on my website .Thankyou  and God Bless . I once heard a potter say" Do it and Ill show up. "We all have to take a step of faith in something we believe in. And hopefully I have shared enough , that you can believe in this step for me . If there is any questions please email me Gloryfibers@yahoo.com.May the sun be on your side and Gods loving  care  carry you through.

story:
Overview

All tickets include one free drink ticket and one raffle ticket . Tickets are $20 at the door. Even though the campaign has ended, pre-sale tickets are still available for $15 each at www.denverartsociety.org

  • What: Ian Cooke, Atomga, Sawmill Joe, Patrick Dethlefs, Lucida Tela, and Vine Street Vibes performing Denver Art Society's 5th Annual Art Out Loud
  • Date: 14 September 2014
  • Time: 2pm - 10pm
  • Where: Denver Art Society 734 Santa Fe Dr
  • Who: All our artists, members, patrons, supporters, and all art lovers :)

About the Music



Ian Cooke is the quintessential Colorado Musician to headline our main event September 14th at Denver Art Society. If you would like to here more from Ian Cooke check out his website. He'll be performing at 4:30pm.

Atomga will be making their 2nd appearance at Art Out Loud this year. They'll be getting the dance floor started at 7. Listen to their music here.

 

"If you are looking for an honest singer with the blood of a blues man, you can't do much better."- Wyomingnews.com. Sawmill Joe will be performing at 2:45.

A review by 5280.com had this to say about Patrick Dethlefs- "His soothing voice evokes an American, countrified version of Belle and Sebastian, supported by graceful layers of acoustic instrumentation, and expertly played". His set is at 5:45.

Progressive, experimental and ambient, Lucida Tela will be rocking out at 8:15. Check out their sound here.

To close out the night at 9:15, will be the electro funk dance tunes of Vine Street Vibes. Listen to their music here.

About Our Nonprofit

The Denver Art Society is a Art Coop, Visual and Performing Arts Gallery, Music Venue, and Art School. Our building is over 100 years old, and was abandoned for some 30 or 40 years before we took residence. Now almost 5 years later, we have gotten most of the major repairs to the building done. But we still have leaks in the roof, floors, and no heat on main floor and in basement studios. 

We've come a long way, but we are only just getting started. This building in the Santa Fe Arts District has become the beacon of acceptance and artistic freedom in the Santa Fe Arts District. We have over 85 active members in our  Art Coop (doubled in past 6 months). And around 50 different artists of all mediums and styles exhibiting their art in our 4000 sqft gallery. We don't ask for commission, and we DO NOT censor. DAS is open 7 days a week from 10 am to 7 pm (no other gallery on the ArtWalk is open this much).

The Art Coop was created to be the backbone of DPAU (Denver Public Arts University). The success of the Art Coop ensures the future of free and universal access to the arts. 

Currently the Coop is operating on a streamlined budget. Funds collected from this campaign will go towards the Coop and its projects, including the production of the showcase itself.

How we serve

Our non profit organization is volunteer-powered from the ground up. 

  • The Art Coop supports artists and students who are often under served in the community.
  • We offer opportunity to new and young artists
  • Give support to struggling students and artists

The road ahead

We've come a long way, and were not about to give up now! To ensure the continued success of our Art Coop we need to...

  • continue building repairs (floors, plumbing, leaks, no heat, lights)
  • maintain a budget that pays for Exhibitions and Advertising costs, as well as cleaning and office supplies.
  • pay bills (rent, water/sewer, internet, utilities)

Other Ways You Can Help

We understand that not everyone can donate fiscally. Here are some other ways you can help us.

  • Volunteer. We always need more volunteers at our events and working in our gallery.
  • Promote Denver Art Society through social media (Facebook, Twitter, Youtube, instagram)
  • Tell your friends and family about this campaign.
  • Stay creative!!!!!

pay bills (rent, water/sewer, internet, utilities)

Tell your friends and family about this campaign.
Stay creative!!!!!

story:
About My Project

“Map of China” is the the title of my new project in which I will travel with your help  from the Mediterranean Sea to the Yellow Sea.

I have been invited to participate in the first Qingdao Art Biennale at the end of September 2014.

http://www.qingdaobiennale.com/en/

To help promote this project, I have chosen to use crowdfunding. This will give backers the opportunity to support an creative project in exchange for a unique piece of original artwork from me, the artist.

The nature of the project means that as well as all of the work on offer being original, it will be available within a considerably lower price bracket than if you were to commission a piece or purchase from a gallery exhibition.

Any donation you make will be very helpfull, just know you are makeing it possible for an artist to have it`s  five minuite of fame witch can change everything.

Be my Andy Worhol ... he give a chance to  Basquiat,

My story

1995 was the first time I have visited China. I went there just after High School, I wanted to do something different before University.

It was very different...  but  I loved every bit of it. 

China is a  especial one  to me.

Time has passed since, life happend, and on the way I sharpen my  art, I know what I want to do, where I want to go, and this is were I am now.

I would like to be able to go to China, to follow my painting. I need to take this opportunity, me and my work, needs to continue its path with your help.


My Art

 I start from a blank canvas with no preconceived specific image in mind. I develop the image slowly by making small conscious decisions and then by also allowing my work to act on my intuition as much as I allow my intuition to act on my work a freedom of action is arrived at. In an endless pursuit of colour and geometrical strokes I search through unknown possibilities, finding my way, mapping a path to a final destination.

The play of colour, texture and geometrical forms combine and work together to create a mapped environment, and the shades and metallic inlays represent an esoteric human, biological presence in my work. With the colour and texture I reflect the mood of everyday life and how it varies, from white to black and the greys in the middle, giving the possibility to create layers of all kinds. I am aware that we all leave marks behind as traverse the paths of life, and map out our place in the universe.




About Me

Im a Fine Artist with a BA from the University of Granada, and for the moment Im living in Spain. I work primarily with oil paint and my work is abstract. I play with form, texture, color and light and slowly build my paintings. I have exhibited both nationally and internationally


www.kpantelic.com

THANK YOU!

Kristina Pantelic

story:
[Na dole strony: wersja polska]

ENGLISH VERSION:

I am a sculptor and woodworker with an MFA in Sculpture from Academy of Fine Arts in Warsaw [2012]. I create abstract forms, combining various materials, textures and colors. Applying great care to proportions and composition, I make objects that encourage sensual exploration. You can see some of my pieces here: www.olgamicinska.com or simply open the Gallery tab on top of this site.

Having traveled a lot and learned from many excellent artists and craftspeople in different parts of the world, I gathered experience in handwork and grew interest in symbolic content of crafted objects. I am currently working on small and medium scale pieces, expressing my recent observations on the tangible matter and the act of making. When exploring cultures of various places, I have become attracted to the indigenous, the folk, and the vernacular. In theTools of Abstraction project I want to investigate how natural circumstances affect the identity of a maker, and how objects are formed in relation to encountered environment. I am currently engaged with research and writing on material culture, focusing on a purely practical application of implements in relation to more metaphoric contexts and genuine need of contact with physical matter.

I am currently investing my own time, energy and material resources into making this project come true, but I still need some support to complete it and present the results to the public. The project has been selected by La Fragua/The Forge international artist residency in Belalcázar (Spain) to be developed this spring/summer. I have been accepted for a two-month production residency in this well-established art center located in a fifteenth-century Convent of Santa Clara. A beautiful site and a vibrant environment! La Fragua community assists artists with the process and connects with local arts- and craftspeople. This is a grand opportunity to advance theTools of Abstraction project. During my previous stays in Spain I learned how stimulating and creative an environment it can offer. A change of location and a quiet surrounding will certainly help me focus on my newest artworks. My goal is to craft a series of sculptures, collaborating with makers from around Belalcázar, and using local materials (olive tree wood, clay, metals, fibers).

The funds I aim to collect will cover residency fees (accommodation and institutional services) and transportation to Belalcázar. I will be very grateful for your support for my project. By contributing to theTools of Abstraction you will become an art patron and collector! All the perks in the offer are artworks I have recently made or will produce during my stay at La Fragua. During the residency I will prepare materials for a limited edition of a printed zine-catalogue: texts and images documenting my investigation into the metaphorical aspects of material culture. Elegantly designed, the catalogue will include sketches, photographs and essays. After the residency, I will work towards a show with the produced sculptures. You can be sure you'll get an invitation!

Please pledge or spread the word! It can be a milestone for my art practice.

You can easily use IndieGoGo sharing tools or any other media!

[fot: La Fragua] Visit: www.lafragua.eu or www.facebook.com/lafraguatheforge

I'll be happy to answer any questions: olga.micinska@gmail.com

**************************

WERSJA POLSKA:

Zajmuję się rzeźbą, pracuję przede wszystkim z drewnem. Dyplom na Wydziale Rzeźby Akademii Sztuk Pięknych w Warszawie obroniłam w 2012 roku. Tworzę formy abstrakcyjne, w których łączę ze sobą różne materiały, faktury i barwy. Z dbałości o proporcje i kompozycję powstają obiekty, które zapraszać mają do zmysłowych eksploracji. Niektóre z moich rzeźb i projektów możesz zobaczyć tu: www.olgamicinska.com lub w zakładce Gallery, na górze tej strony.

W ostatnich latach wiele podróżowałam, odwiedzając warsztaty w różnych częściach świata oraz ucząc się od wielu doskonałych artystów i rzemieślników. Tym samym zyskałam doświadczenie w pracy manualnej, a także pogłębiłam  zainteresowanie symbolicznego ładunku w ręcznie wykonanych obiektach. Odkrywając kultury związanych z różnymi miejscami, zaczęły pociągać mnie wątki sztuki rdzennej, ludowej, wernakularnej. W projekcie Narzędzia abstrakcji, chcę zająć się sytuacjami, w których warunki naturalne wpływają na tożsamość twórcy, oraz jak przedmioty formowane są wobec zastanego otoczenia. Prowadzę ostatnio kwerendę dotyczącą kultury materialnej, w wyniku której powstają teksty do publikacji. Skupiam się przede wszystkim na czysto praktycznych aspektach obiektów użytkowych w relacji wobec bardziej metaforycznych kontekstów oraz pierwotnej potrzeby kontaktu z materią fizyczną.

W chwili obecnej inwestuję swój czas, energię i środki materialne w zrealizowanie tego projektu, ale wciąż potrzebne jest mi wsparcie by go skończyć, a rezultaty móc zaprezentować szerszej publiczności. Projekt został wybrany przez ośrodek artystyczny La Fragua/The Forge prowadzący międzynarodowy program rezydencji artystycznych zlokalizowany w hiszpańskiej miejscowości Belalcázar. Zaproponowano mi dwumiesięczny pobyt twórczy w tym znanym ośrodku artystycznym mieszczącym się w piętnastowiecznych zabudowaniach klasztornych konwentu Świętej Klary. Piękne miejsce oraz twórcze środowisko! Towarzystwo związane z La Fragua asystuje artystom w procesie tworzenia oraz pomaga nawiązać kontakty z lokalnymi artystami i rzemieślnikami. Takie możliwości zdecydowanie pomogłyby rozwinąć projekt Narzędzia abstrakcji . Podczas moich poprzednich pobytów w Hiszpanii nauczyłam się jak stymulujące i kreatywne środowisko można spotkać w tym kraju. Zmiana miejsca oraz cisza otoczenia z pewnością pozwolą mi skupić się na nowych pracach. Moim celem jest stworzenie serii rzeźb, we współpracy z rzemieślnikami z okolic Belalcázar oraz używając lokalnie pozyskanych materiałów (drzewo oliwne, glina, włókna naturalne, metal).

Środki, jakie potrzebuję zebrać pokryją koszty związane z samą rezydencją (zakwaterowanie i opłaty administracyjne) oraz transport do Belalcázar. Będę bardzo wdzięczna za wsparcie mojej kampanii. Przyłączając się do projektu, staniesz się zarazem mecenasem oraz kolekcjonerem sztuki! Wszystkie przedmioty, jakie oferuję w kampanii (perki) to prace, które ostatnio wykonałam lub takie, które powstaną podczas mojego pobytu w La Fragua. W trakcie trwania rezydencji przygotuję materiały do drukowanego katalogu-zina, wydanego w limitowanej edycji. Elegancko zaprojektowany katalog będzie zawierał teksty (eseje) oraz ilustracje (szkice i fotografie) dokumentujące moje działania w temacie metaforycznych aspektów kultury materialnej. Po zakończeniu rezydencji będę się starała o wystawę powstałych prac. Zostaniecie zaproszeni!

Dorzuć się do projektu lub poinformuj o nim swoich znajomych! To może być bardzo ważny moment dla mojej działalności twórczej.

Możesz użyć narzędzi IndieGoGo lub wszelkich innych środków komunikacji!

[fot: La Fragua] Odwiedź: www.lafragua.eu lub www.facebook.com/lafraguatheforge

Chętnie odpowiem na wszelkie pytania: olga.micinska@gmail.com

na Wydziale Rzeźby Akademii Sztuk Pięknych w Warszawie obroniłam w 2012 roku.
Tworzę formy abstrakcyjne, w których łączę ze sobą różne materiały, faktury i
barwy. Z dbałości o proporcje i kompozycję powstają obiekty, które zapraszać mają do
zmysłowych eksploracji. Niektóre z moich rzeźb i projektów możesz zobaczyć tu:
www.olgamicinska.com lub w zakładce Gallery, na górze tej strony.
W ostatnich latach wiele podróżowałam, odwiedzając warsztaty w
różnych częściach świata oraz ucząc się od wielu doskonałych artystów i
rzemieślników. Tym samym zyskałam doświadczenie w pracy manualnej, a także
pogłębiłam  zainteresowanie symbolicznego
ładunku w ręcznie wykonanych obiektach. Odkrywając kultury związanych z
różnymi miejscami, zaczęły pociągać mnie wątki sztuki rdzennej, ludowej,
wernakularnej. W projekcie Narzędzia
abstrakcji, chcę zająć się sytuacjami, w których warunki naturalne wpływają
na tożsamość twórcy, oraz jak przedmioty formowane są wobec zastanego otoczenia.
Prowadzę ostatnio kwerendę dotyczącą kultury materialnej, w wyniku której
powstają teksty do publikacji. Skupiam się przede wszystkim na czysto
praktycznych aspektach obiektów użytkowych w relacji wobec bardziej
metaforycznych kontekstów oraz pierwotnej potrzeby kontaktu z materią fizyczną.

W chwili obecnej inwestuję swój czas, energię i środki
materialne w zrealizowanie tego projektu, ale wciąż potrzebne jest mi wsparcie
by go skończyć, a rezultaty móc zaprezentować szerszej publiczności.
Projekt został wybrany przez ośrodek artystyczny La Fragua/The Forge prowadzący międzynarodowy program rezydencji
artystycznych zlokalizowany w hiszpańskiej miejscowości Belalcázar.
Zaproponowano mi dwumiesięczny pobyt twórczy w tym znanym ośrodku artystycznym
mieszczącym się w piętnastowiecznych zabudowaniach klasztornych konwentu Świętej
Klary. Piękne miejsce oraz twórcze środowisko! Towarzystwo związane z La Fragua asystuje artystom w procesie
tworzenia oraz pomaga nawiązać kontakty z lokalnymi artystami i rzemieślnikami.
Takie możliwości zdecydowanie pomogłyby rozwinąć projekt Narzędzia abstrakcji . Podczas moich poprzednich pobytów w
Hiszpanii nauczyłam się jak stymulujące i kreatywne środowisko można spotkać w
tym kraju. Zmiana miejsca oraz cisza otoczenia z pewnością pozwolą mi skupić
się na nowych pracach. Moim celem jest stworzenie serii rzeźb, we współpracy z
rzemieślnikami z okolic Belalcázar oraz używając lokalnie pozyskanych materiałów (drzewo
oliwne, glina, włókna naturalne, metal).
Środki, jakie potrzebuję zebrać pokryją koszty związane z samą
rezydencją (zakwaterowanie i opłaty administracyjne) oraz transport do
Belalcázar. Będę bardzo wdzięczna za wsparcie mojej kampanii. Przyłączając się
do projektu, staniesz się zarazem mecenasem oraz kolekcjonerem sztuki!
Wszystkie przedmioty, jakie oferuję w kampanii (perki) to prace, które ostatnio
wykonałam lub takie, które powstaną podczas mojego pobytu w La Fragua. W trakcie trwania rezydencji
przygotuję materiały do drukowanego katalogu-zina, wydanego w limitowanej edycji. Elegancko zaprojektowany katalog będzie zawierał teksty (eseje) oraz ilustracje (szkice i fotografie) dokumentujące moje działania w temacie metaforycznych
aspektów kultury materialnej. Po zakończeniu rezydencji będę się starała o wystawę
powstałych prac. Zostaniecie zaproszeni! 
Dorzuć się do projektu lub poinformuj o nim swoich znajomych! To
może być bardzo ważny moment dla mojej działalności twórczej.
Możesz użyć narzędzi IndieGoGo lub wszelkich innych środków komunikacji!



[fot: La Fragua] Odwiedź: www.lafragua.eu lub www.facebook.com/lafraguatheforge



Chętnie odpowiem na wszelkie pytania: olga.micinska@gmail.com

story: We engage the community in our second Friday Art Walk events from May to October, where we help fill local shops and restaurants with Art from local Artists'. We are in need of some funding to rent a space to call home, even if its short-term. We will be using the space as a gallery, office, and studio space. In order to continue as an Art Collective we need a space to meet regularly to plan and organize these events and exhibitions. Our plan is to propose to a building owner in Downtown Nampa the clean up and renovation of the space in exchange of a discounted monthly rent. We would propose a 5-6 month agreement during the Art walk season to fully facilitate the events, host exhibitions, and critiques to the artist community. We would use the funds to pay the rent for those 6 months, some studio supplies, and gallery wall updates (lighting, paint etc.).

story:
My Story And Why Should You Help

Photography is my life. It's a part of me. It is my mission to try to heal the world, to show how beautiful it is, to help open eyes, to love, to remind people how it feels to look at things without judgment.

This is my first chance to start something big. To spread the word. To open eyes.
                                                              www.ZivSade.com

  • I am a self-taught photographer, from a small village in the northern part of Israel.

  • I started to discover photography when i was only 10 years old and quickly became my middle school main event cinematographer.

  • At the age of 14 I discovered my first film camera and it was love at first sight.

  • At the age of 24, I opened "The Ziv Sade Studio” that quickly became an “institute” and a creative space for people to express themselves as well as a home for events and some of the most amazing and controversial imagery that Israel had ever seen.



  • At that time I discovered my true sexuality, became the most influential photographer in the local gay community and became involved in raising awareness for the LGBTQ community and minorities.

    My name was well known in the local photography industry as one of the busiest photographers in town, and I had the privilege of having some of the the most interesting and famous public figures nationally and internationally ( politicians, musicians and actors) in front of my camera.

    My emphasis was the connection between people and emotion. I strive to portray an emotion or a story in every portrait i take.

  • When Madonna posted my peace photo ( Portraying  A Jewish man & Muslim man kissing) I realized new how much influence art have. 

  • http://www.jpost.com/Not-Just-News/Behind-The-Lens-The-meaning-behind-the-controversial-Israeli-photo-Madonna-shared-403627
http://www.huffingtonpost.com/2015/05/19/madonna-instagram-jewish-muslim-_n_7313164.html

Here is some images from my latest exhibition and some articles :



  •  This will be my first chance to share new stories of the world, on a much larger scale, and to continue my journey in documenting this era and our generation.

  • This is the beginning of something big. This exhibition will help me start my career and my dreams in America. This will help me start what I've always dreamt of. Making a difference. 

What I need & what you get

  • I need 4000$ for prints and framing of the photos, and also for promotional materials. We are doing the exhibition in an open house in Venice Beach, Los Angeles and its a great opportunity to meet influential people that can help me get my work out there and get involved in worldwide projects.
  •                                                              (Example)
  •                                                                (Example)
  • When we will reach our goal I will be able to print beautiful and high quality, large format prints and frames.
  • The Impact
  • This is a turning point in my career.  This will expose my work to potential clients and people who can help me start creating large scale world wide social projects. In order to get to those people i need this presentation.
  • I proved I am consistent over the years, and my passion of making a mark and a difference in this world. I intend to continue on this road.
  • I have traveled to Africa, Spain, UK, and of course Israel in order to document people, cultures and places, and I promise that I will never stop.
  • I feel like its time for a change. Time for acceptance,  time for peace. With ourselves and with the world we live in. This is my goal  And i need your help to do so. I have a great manager that is very ambitious and very well connected, and who is helping me produce this show.

  •  Risks & Challenges.
  • I have vast experienced managing people and productions. I have more then 9 years of experience in the photography and production fields.
  •  Other Ways You Can Help
  • Please help me spread the word about my campaign !

Thank you ladies and gentleman and for making a difference!

At the age of 14 I discovered my first film camera and it was love at first sight.



At the age of 24, I opened "The Ziv Sade Studio” that quickly became an “institute” and a creative space for people to express themselves as well as a home for events and some of the most amazing and controversial imagery that Israel had ever seen.














At that time I discovered my true sexuality, became the most influential photographer in the local gay community and became involved in raising awareness for the LGBTQ community and minorities.

 This will be my first chance to share new stories of the world, on a much larger scale, and to continue my journey in documenting this era and our generation.
 
This is the beginning of something big. This exhibition will help me start my career and my dreams in America. This will help me start what I've always dreamt of. Making a difference.

When we will reach our goal I will be able to print beautiful and high quality, large format prints and frames.
The Impact

  This is a turning point in my career.  This will expose my work to potential clients and people who can help me start creating large scale world wide social projects. In order to get to those people i need this presentation.

I proved I am consistent over the years, and my passion of making a mark and a difference in this world. I intend to continue on this road.

I have traveled to Africa, Spain, UK, and of course Israel in order to document people, cultures and places, and I promise that I will never stop. 
I feel like its time for a change. Time for acceptance,  time for peace. With ourselves and with the world we live in. This is my goal  And i need your help to do so. I have a great manager that is very ambitious and very well connected, and who is helping me produce this show.



 Risks & Challenges.




I have vast experienced managing people and productions. I have more then 9 years of experience in the photography and production fields.

 Other Ways You Can Help


 

Please help me spread the word about my campaign !
   Thank you ladies and gentleman and for making a difference!

story:
Hola  Co - "dream" -creators! My name, if we have not  met is Tamika Rivera. I have been  accepted to my first  artist  residency in  Oaxaca ,Mexico April 2016. I will be a part of a master instruction embroidery program as well as  developing my own works during the three week program. Programs like this are so important to keep  indigenous traditions alive and help fund music program for  inner city  youth in Mexico.   Im honored to be invited as one of Arquetopia's  international artist in Residence. 

Super excited  for you to be coming along on this journey with me!  

 

Arquetopia Oaxaca
Calle Morelos 105
Col. Santa Cruz
San Pablo Etla, OAX  68258  MÉXICO

www.arquetopia.org (Main Site) / www.arquetopia.com  (Blog)
www.facebook.com/Arquetopia / www.facebook.com/ArquetopiaOaxaca


What We Need & What You Get

Ok!  Although It's amazing to be accepted  April is right around the corner! It is definately a challenge to organize this and leave for a month as an artist. 

what to do? Time to  reach out to my fellow dreamers   and offer some amazing  perks in exchange for your awesome dream donations! 
Bare minimums here: 

  • Program cost  $ 2310
  • Plane fare full price (no benefit discount ) ,travel lodging , local travel ($890)
  • Anything over the goal price will be greatly appreciated and  will be used toward ,Extra food ,lodging  & art supplies ,more projects,  helping create more work and more  opportunities to support local economy. 
  • Oh you get to enjoy all the Perks too!
  • Sacred heart alter candle  ($15)

     TRAVEL CANDLE ($25)

    OAXACA 9oz  100 % SOY CANDLE  ($40)

  •    I "artwork" OAXACA TOTE ($50)      

    Cuyo Talisman Necklace   ($100)   PHOTO REFERENCE ONLY (SOLD OUT)                                       

  •  NEW! Oaxaca inspired "Mother Earth Bracelet" ($75) 

  •  


  • Perks $200 and over get special gifts from the region and candles!!

Risks & Challenges

  • Nothing but blue skies with your help and high vibes! 
  • Im fully committed  to this Residency and my art I will take the responsibility of all other costs not raised 

Other Ways You Can Help

 just  cause you can't contribute, that doesn't mean you can't help :)

  • Please share my campaign with your community!
  •  use the Indiegogo share tools!
  • show your support on facebook and instagram  @tamikanin 
  • send me high vibes on my travels..xo

story:
Intro

My name is Ellis O´Connor and I´m a visual artist working in painting, printmaking and photography from Scotland. 

I use this visual language to challenge assumptions about the natural environment, to reinterpret the grandeur of natural land forms, and to re-present this visual information laden with power. 

I develop my attachment to the barrenness of rock and fragile lands, and show ambition by working in places of sparse population. While humans are absent, the spectral presence of the viewer who sees this land understands that it Is not ‘empty’, but rather filled with the same elements that sustain all life. I am the recipient of many awards; I exhibit my work consistently and internationally and have also been chosen for a significant number of artist in residence programmes around the world.


My Campaign

I have been invited among a select group of artists and scientists worldwide to participate in The Arctic Circle Residency Programme in October 2016 for three weeks around the remote and northern Archipelago of Svalbard.

I couldn’t be more excited for this opportunity as not only is it a place that will deeply influence and enrich my practice, it is also a place I have wanted to venture to for a long time because of the unique landscape and impressive geological wonders. For three weeks the other residents and I will sail together on an ice class barkentine tallship exploring Svalbard, a High Arctic archipelago just ten degrees from the North Pole, creating, collaborating, observing and documenting as we go.

This residency is incredibly important to me as it is in Svalbard where the effects of progressive climate change are the most apparent and where wildlife and the sea ice is significantly under threat. It is a place of wonder yet fragility and I find it important for my practice to record the shifting of the landscapes and the effects that global warming is inflicting on the Arctic.

I aim to record, document, and build up a large body of new drawings/ paintings, prints and photographs all made on the voyage through the Arctic and all directly connected to the place and what I observe whilst on the expedition. I hope to instill love for the landscapes in people so they too can be inspired to conserve this place that is significant to our future as a whole.

In addition to being a life-changing personal experience, this trip holds untold potential for the enrichment and development of my work. My whole art practice and key ideas are directly related to the atmosphere of remote places, a visual documentation of the shifting of landscapes in the north so being able to go on this expedition will provide me with the right visual material for my work and go forward immensely with new creative work.

You can imagine how being immersed in that extreme environment will impact the work that I create, expanding upon and evolving my art practise work into something richer, informed by real visual experience.

Here is a press release on my trip! http://www.dundee.ac.uk/news/2015/arctic-expedi...


What I Need & What You Get

Even though I’ve been awarded this unique residency, I still must raise funds for expenses related to this expedition and this is where I am asking for your help. I must raise £4,300 to join the residency which will cover all of the expenses on the expedition and secure my place. The remaining funding will go towards travel costs to and from Longyearben, cold weather clothing and art materials which will be used to make new work on the residency.

By supporting me on this project, not only will you be investing in me and an important expedition but you will also receive unique benefits by funding this project which are listed at the right hand side of this page! Any donation from you will go a long way in realizing this opportunity.

If you are interested in helping but unable to donate, please share this with your friends and social circles. Any additional exposure I can get is an immense help!

My project as a whole is significant not only to the environment and documenting what is truly going on in the north of our planet but also invaluable to my art practise. It allows me the opportunity to immerse myself in a fragile and overwhelming environment and the chance to capture exactly what I see and showcase this back to a wider audience.

I intend to produce my work and showcase this on a worldwide scale because of the importance and relevance it has to our relationship to the land and global warming as a whole. Upon return from this expedition, I intend to showcase my work consistently and extensively throughout exhibitions, a printed and online publication and an array of documentation.


Risks & Challenges

The only risk I can think of in terms of the production of my work and expedition is the uncertain conditions and visibility in the high arctic. The Archipelago of Svalbard is the closest Island to the North Pole so the weather and sea conditions whilst on the boat cannot be foreseen hence production of work every so often might not be as productive as what I would like it to be. However, having lived in the North of Iceland throughout the winter and being exposed to wild arctic weather, I feel that I am fully equipped mentally and physically for any challenge I will face in the Arctic! I intend to fully immerse myself in the place as much as possible and document and work as much as I can whilst letting the unique surroundings inspire me constantly, plus cold places are always my favourite anyway!


Other Ways You Can Help

Please also share this campaign by using the Indie gogo share tools!

You can follow along on my journey preparing for my upcoming trip to the Arctic on my:

Website: http://www.ellisoconnor.com/

Blog: http://www.ellisoconnor.wordpress.com/

Instagram: https://www.instagram.com/ellisoconnor/

Twitter: https://twitter.com/ellisoconnor1


Thank you all so much!

follow along on my journey preparing for my upcoming trip to the Arctic on my:Website:
http://www.ellisoconnor.com/ Blog: http://www.ellisoconnor.wordpress.com/Instagram:
https://www.instagram.com/ellisoconnor/
Twitter: https://twitter.com/ellisoconnor1
Thank you all so much!

story:
Help me make improvements to my Pottery teaching studio.
The campaign was a great success and the studio got the required upgrades, It was well used throughout 2016 and kept busy with pottery sessions and classes. The winter months in this area are very quiet for passing trade and so if you wish to continue to support the studio through the lean times, you can do so by buying pottery from the www.balnacra.com website or through this page. Many thanks !
update 15th Feb 2016 - Target met - see end for details- STRETCH GOAL ADDED- THANKYOU!

I need to crowdfund to make some improvements in my ‘Pop Up Pottery’ teaching studio space. This would pay for storage containers, timber for make shelving units, some raw materials for glazes and promotional flyers.

Who am I ? and why a Pop Up Pottery studio?
The Pop Up Pottery started last year. I've been working in North West Scotland as an artist, potter and teaching for nearly 30 years, but haven't had a pottery studio for a few years. I was juggling lots of jobs, including Firefighting - but a damaged right arm and other health problems meant I had to retire early from being a retained watch manager at the community Fire station. So I thought I'd try getting back into teaching pottery. For a temporary studio space I rented out an empty community owned historic former blacksmiths building as a ‘pop up Pottery’. 

How the first year went.
It needed a lot of work to stop the Smithy building flooding and to make it usable. I opened for Easter 2015, when tourists start to visit this beautiful and remote part of The Scottish Highlands. Quickly the Pop Up Pottery became very popular. People were buying my pots faster than I could make them. Visitors and locals alike were dropping in to have a go at pottery, booking group sessions, coming along as a family holiday activity and joining in with regular pottery classes. I started gathering more tools and equipment, working flat out and full time to look after and process everyone’s pottery, which I post onto them, when the pots are finished.

The challenges.
I have been working with the building’s owners- a community charity- to find funds to install a better electricity supply, fix the roof leaks, to put in some better lighting, and to make the building usable throughout the winter by putting in some insulation. These will be costly but really help preserve the building in the longer term. Recently The clay and Pottery has been suffering frost and ice damage, in the winter there is virtually no passing trade, and It has also been too cold to have students in, and it has been tough going not being able to earn or make pots to sell during the busy summer months. Spring isn't far away though and i'm keen to get the studio more organised and improved quickly- as it will get busy with visitors again after Easter 2016. While i'm waiting to get the building work done, i need to be ready with fixtures and fittings, this is what i'm looking to crowdfund.

What your help will do.
Any amount below or above the target is going to be a great help. £20 will buy me some raw materials to mix up new glazes. £15 will get me some storage containers for glazes and slips. Most importantly I want to tidy up the clutter and have more space to store drying pottery. I would like to build bespoke ladder style shelving units that fit into the building, these will take heavier items like clay at the bottom and go up to into drying racks. If the funding allows, I will get some more flyers printed, and make some nice display shelves too. So many people enjoyed coming and trying pottery in 2015, I want to be able to take the studio to the next level, so more people can come and explore more techniques, with more ease and comfort. It's not just a business for me, it is about sewing the seeds of inspiration and creativity in others. Pottery is not something it is easy to try and set up at home, yet it is so enjoyable, so rewarding- it is wonderful to be able to provide facilities so that everyone can get the opportunity to try this exciting medium.

I hope you feel inspired to chip in and make a pledge in exchange for art and pottery, It will help me out so much, any amount small or large. The Pop Up Pottery Pilot year proved there is a demand for this sort of studio space, that people are willing to travel far and wide to come and have a go. The more funds I can invest the faster it will grow.

Find out more and shout it out!
If you can't contribute but would like to help, please share and tell others about this campaign. If you are in the area I'd love it if you came along to the studio to see what it is all about. For those further afield, you can find me on facebook, twitter and at www.balnacra.com

UPDATE 15th Feb 2016
It's been incredible ! We've made the target already- I have been so moved by the support. Thankyou all so much. What next?
I'm adding a  STRETCH GOAL
an extra £100 on top of the £600 already raised will allow me to buy some concrete floor sealant to stop horrible wheeze making dust going everywhere everytime I sweep up. I'll do some tests, It should cost around £70.
I will also get some stove black paint and some fire cement to plug up the holes where smoke comes out of the wood stove....and if possible a bag or two of regular cement to help repoint the walls.

Thankyou !

story:
About Me:
I have a great job; I get to show off artists’ books to visitors at Abecedarian Gallery. I show books to people who love and buy them, and I show books to people who have never seen such a thing!
About my project:
In 2014 I raised money so I could show books to people who live in small towns, far away from museums, galleries and universities. I visited 10 towns in Colorado and 5 towns in other states. I showed artists’ books to over 1000 people of all ages, at events held at libraries, art centers, galleries, bookstores. Even a bistro on a golf course! All completely free of charge to the towns, organizations and individuals who came to see the books.
The project was a wonderful success. This coming summer I hope to continue Artists Books on the Road. This year donations are tax-deductible to the extent allowed by law.
What I already have:
I have a lot of wonderful books to choose from, I have a roomy car and good packing crates, I have a great assistant running the gallery while I am away. I have a new list of libraries, community centers and art galleries I want to visit. I have invitations from places I visited last year who would like me to come back.
What I need:
 The only thing more I need is money - for gas, for lodging, for extra insurance for all the precious books.
What you get:
Whether you choose a perk, or give the gift of cash, your donation is tax-deductible to the extent allowed by law. As to perks, here are some of the wonderful things you can get when you help me raise money for my adventures (click here for full descriptions and images):
A nifty business card book.
Bookbinding tools such as a Portable Piercing Cradle (or kit to make your own).
A set of scoring jigs.
Mail art postcards
Long stitch journals in various styles
Mystery perks selected from work donated by artists’ supporting my project.

Artists Books on the Road is a sponsored project of
Fractured Atlas, a non-profit arts service
organization. Contributions for the charitable
purposes of Artists Books on the Road must be made payable to
Fractured Atlas only and are tax-deductible to the
extent permitted by law.

And . . . even if I don't reach my goal, I will be able to use whatever funds have been contributed for my project.  I'll take as many trips as I can with the money raised.

This means that you will get your perk no matter what - woohoo!

Trip costs vary, depending on how far away and how long I need to be away. If I reach my goal of $5000 I estimate being able to take a combination of  7-8 short trips (150 miles away or less) and 3-4 long trips (150-300 miles away). On every trip I should be able to visit more than one library or art center. The more I raise, the more places I'll go.?
PPS . . . if you live in Colorado, New Mexico, Wyoming, Nebraska or Utah, send me ideas of places I can go (and who to talk to about scheduling a visit)

story:
I've been an artist my whole life, with about two decades of work in painting, digital art, graphic design and sculptural installations in my professional portfolio. I show whenever I can at festivals and art events, and here in Vallejo I'm hosting an open studio about once a month. Selling art is one of the main ways I'm supporting myself right now. Even with all of that going on, like most artists, more that half of the work I do is unpaid. I still bite my fingernails in between gigs and sales, wondering if the rent will be covered next month. 

I want to keep contributing to the color and vibrancy of Bay Area culture. I want my art to keep brightening the homes of appreciative people. This campaign is to gather resources to help make that happen. 

One part of the vision for making my studio a success involves creating small, affordable prints to offer studio visitors. While my larger canvas prints are made through a high-end production house in Berkeley, it would be wonderful for me to have my own printer to make smaller prints, so I can easily control quality and keep the retail price reasonable. 

A successful campaign will pay for a high-quality printer, archival inks, and fine art grade paper, plus packaging materials and shipping costs to start production and send out prints in time for the holidays. I would be so excited to help you with your Xmas gift shopping!

Years ago I was crushed when hundreds of dollars worth of my in-studio made prints were lost in transit from a show overseas. In the aftermath, I never really had the time or the means to replace them. I'm finally feeling like I'm ready to start over.

Lately, you hear so much in the news about artists being displaced from their homes and workspaces. Let's change that narrative! Artists are a resourceful species!  I was reluctant at first to be among those needing to move all the way to the North Bay to get affordable space. To my surprise, life in Vallejo has been a refreshing change of pace: quiet, distraction-free, and with a lively art scene. I'm still just a short drive from the people and the creative energy that inspire me and bring me joy. 

The Bay Area is where my creativity really took root and I began to see how an artist might not just survive, but thrive. It hasn't been easy. There have been tears shed here and there, but it's all been worth it. I give so much credit to the incredible community and irrepressible scene. I have a symbiotic relationship with lovers of art and I feel like every piece of art I create is a team effort. I'm so grateful for all of my teammates!

Prints for most of the donation perks will be made by me, in my North Bay studio, with the brand new printer you'll help fund. I have a brand new digital painting, titled the Breakout Archetype, that I've just launched as a very special incentive to contribute. 

You can choose any image from my digital gallery for your perk:

http://www.vibrata.com/fineart/content/digital.html

Or choose a t-shirt as your perk...

I'm excited to make t-shirts with society6! Here's an example of what one will look like. These premium quality American Apparel all-over print shirts feature original art from seam to seam. The cotton-soft 100% polyester wicks moisture and maintains a rich color throughout. All over print tees are unisex fit, so women should make size selections accordingly and order a minimum of one size smaller. Please Note: Every shirt is uniquely produced using a sublimation process that can create anomalies in some areas, typically under the arm, that leaves small portions of fabric white.

Women Sizes Small Medium Large X-Large
Size 0-2 4-6 8-10 12-14
Chest (inches) 30-32 32-34 36-38 40-42
Waist (inches) 25-26 27-28 30-32 33-35

Men's/Unisex Sizes
X-Small
Small
Medium
Large
X-Large
2X-Large
Chest (inches) 30-32 34-36 38-40 42-44 46-48 48-50
Waist (inches) 28-30 30-32 32-33 33-34 36-38 40-42

I'll have more updates and images soon!
 

Did you read all the way to the bottom? Unbelievable. You've already been helpful. Please consider showing financial support for a local artist and help keep the Bay Area beautiful!

story:
Having done the doc review thing for years, I decided it was time to leave the desk and get a life. Last November I found myself muttering, "I hate my life..." After just a few moments of reflection, I decided that I did not hate my life, I was simply in need of a new life, or rather, a life change. I have always loved teaching, almost as much as I love creating my jewelry and my art, and so I went back to school...again. I now have a TEFL certificate, so I am certified to teach English as a foreign language. I didn't have the proper experience for the high paying gigs in Dubai, I was too old for South Korea, and China said I was just right.

When one decides to teach English abroad, one soon finds out that it is not cheap to give of your time and experience.  I have come to understand that, with very few exceptions, you are required to pay for your own airfare to the country of choice.  In addition, for China, you are expected to put forth at least three (3!) months rent, plus a "key deposit" to the landlord to get your apartment.  Granted, the cost of living is much cheaper, and I can cook my own meals, I still have to continue to pay my student loans and credit card bills at home.  I will be making approximately $1200 per month, and may get a housing subsidy, but the initial output will be a high hurdle to overcome.  I am looking for help to get out of the life...you know you want to do it too...and that is where you come in.  If I had $5 from each and every doc reviewer looking to escape the life....I could fly first class around the world!

story:
La Centrale


Fondée et issue des mouvements féministes en 1973, La Centrale Galerie Powerhouse est un des plus anciens centres d’artistes autogérés du Québec. 

Le centre a pour objectif d’offrir une plateforme pour les langages en art actuel portés par les discours féministes, les théories du genre, la diversité culturelle et la transdisciplinarité. La Centrale s’engage dans le développement des réseaux d’échanges professionnels à l’échelle locale, nationale et internationale.

Le centre célébrait récemment ses 40 ans en 2014, réaffirmant ainsi son statut de plus ancien centre d’artistes au Canada.


Une nouvelle ère approche! 


Cette campagne de collecte de fonds permettra à La Centrale d'accroitre sa présence au sein de sa communauté, de stimuler les projets éducatifs et de soutenir les pratiques féministes, en 2015-2016. 

La programmation s’articulera autour de la question centrale de son mandat : la sous-représentation. Outre les expositions régulières, les événements de performance, les résidences en galerie et les projets en partenariat, La Centrale initiera une série de tables rondes en vue d’ancrer sa programmation dans le contexte actuel et d’engager un dialogue entre les artistes et les publics.


L’impact de votre don


Avec 5 000 $, nous pourrons bonifier le mandat de plusieurs façons :

  • En accroissant la visibilité des membres et artistes de La Centrale, via un site internet et des entretiens vidéos dédiés aux membres
  • En proposant plus d'activités de médiation et d'ateliers éducatifs en lien avec les expositions
  • En développant notre communauté à l’échelle locale, nationale et internationale
  • En mettant en oeuvre un programme d’échanges internationaux

Un don c'est :

  • Démontrer un fier appui pour La Centrale
  • Soutenir les projets du comité actions éducatives visant à promouvoir les pratiques féministes dans les milieux qui y ont peu ou pas accès
  • Soutenir la visibilité d’artistes et d’initiatives moins ou peu représentées
  • Stimuler la diffusion des pratiques féministes à Montréal, au Québec, au Canada et ailleurs!

Déjà, La Centrale a plusieurs grands succès à son actif


  • Une collection de publications bilingues mettant de l'avant des artistes et auteur.e.s féministes
  • Le PRIX POWERHOUSE qui souligne chaque année la pratique d’une femme artiste, ou toute personne qui se considère comme telle, de la région montréalaise ayant atteint ou dépassé le stade de mi-carrière
  • Une communauté intergénérationnelle d'artistes féministes actives et engagées 
  • 40 ans de diffusion et d’action en art actuel via des expositions, performances, tables rondes, ateliers, soirées de projection, publications et des fêtes

Contreparties

En contrepartie, nous vous offrons des paquets de publication historique de La Centrale, ainsi que notre nouvelle ouvrage à paraître : Impact féministe sur l'art actuel !


Nous avons aussi des oeuvres originals d'artistes membres de La Centrale ! 

Des oeuvres imprimées en édition limitée !

Pour plus de détails, allez voir en image nos contreparties dans la section GALERIE.

La Centrale, une communauté


La Centrale est constituée d'une communauté de membres artistes et actrices du milieu culturel très présente dans les projets et le développement des activités de la programmation. La Centrale, c'est le reflet de ses membres.

Cette campagne de financement aide La Centrale à réaliser des projets structurants et innovateurs qui s’inscriront à long terme dans les activités du centre. 

ATTENTION! Après avoir participer à cette campagne de financement, vous risquez fortement d’être interpellé.e par La Centrale et de vouloir participer à nos projets!

D'autres façons d’aider

Venez voir nos expositions, assistez aux vernissages, partagez vos expériences, mais surtout parlez-en à vos amis et dans vos communautés!

Vous pouvez aussi devenir membre de La Centrale!

http://www.lacentrale.org/types-de-membres


Marquer l’histoire


Trois femmes faisant partie du groupe nommé les Flaming Aprons placent une annonce sur un babillard pour lancer un appel aux femmes artistes désirant se réunir pour discuter des difficultés d’exposer leur travail dans un contexte professionnel. C’est ainsi que prend forme Powerhouse.

La galerie était située au 2e étage au 1210 avenue Greene dans un 4 1/2 et elle comprenait deux salles d’exposition. Les membres fondatrices sont: Elizabeth Bertoldi, Leslie Busch, Isobel Dowler-Gow, Margaret Griffin, Clara Gutshe, Billie-Joe Mericle, Stansje Plantenga et Pat Walsh. Au cours des huit premiers mois d’activité, la galerie a fonctionné grâce à l’appui des membres, des artistes exposantes et des femmes qui ont soutenu ses activités. 

La toute première exposition a eu lieu du 20 mai au 21 juin 1973. Ce n’est qu’un an plus tard, le 24 mai 1974, que la galerie fut incorporée sous le nom de Galerie et atelier la Centrale Électrique / Powerhouse Gallery & Studio. Le centre a déménagé plusieurs fois, avant de s'établir en 2004 sur le boulevard Saint-Laurent, dans un espace avec vitrine sur la main!

Depuis plus de 40 ans, La Centrale diffuse et stimule les pratiques féministes en art actuel. De nombreuses femmes artistes, commissaires et historiennes, dont plusieurs ont développé une riche carrière sur la scène locale et internationale de l’art actuel, ont contribué aux publications et expositions phares du centre.
story_txt:
La Centrale
Fondée et issue des mouvements féministes en 1973, La Centrale Galerie Powerhouse est un des plus anciens centres d’artistes autogérés du Québec. 
Le centre a pour objectif d’offrir une plateforme pour les langages en art actuel portés par les discours féministes, les théories du genre, la diversité culturelle et la transdisciplinarité. La Centrale s’engage dans le développement des réseaux d’échanges professionnels à l’échelle locale, nationale et internationale.
Le centre célébrait récemment ses 40 ans en 2014, réaffirmant ainsi son statut de plus ancien centre d’artistes au Canada.
Une nouvelle ère approche! 
Cette campagne de collecte de fonds permettra à La Centrale d'accroitre sa présence au sein de sa communauté, de stimuler les projets éducatifs et de soutenir les pratiques féministes, en 2015-2016. 
La programmation s’articulera autour de la question centrale de son mandat : la sous-représentation. Outre les expositions régulières, les événements de performance, les résidences en galerie et les projets en partenariat, La Centrale initiera une série de tables rondes en vue d’ancrer sa programmation dans le contexte actuel et d’engager un dialogue entre les artistes et les publics.
L’impact de votre don
Avec 5 000 $, nous pourrons bonifier le mandat de plusieurs façons :

En accroissant la visibilité des membres et artistes de La Centrale, via un site internet et des entretiens vidéos dédiés aux membres
En proposant plus d'activités de médiation et d'ateliers éducatifs en lien avec les expositions
En développant notre communauté à l’échelle locale, nationale et internationale
En mettant en oeuvre un programme d’échanges internationaux


Un don c'est :

Démontrer un fier appui pour La Centrale
Soutenir les projets du comité actions éducatives visant à promouvoir les pratiques féministes dans les milieux qui y ont peu ou pas accès
Soutenir la visibilité d’artistes et d’initiatives moins ou peu représentées
Stimuler la diffusion des pratiques féministes à Montréal, au Québec, au Canada et ailleurs!


Déjà, La Centrale a plusieurs grands succès à son actif

Une collection de publications bilingues mettant de l'avant des artistes et auteur.e.s féministes
Le PRIX POWERHOUSE qui souligne chaque année la pratique d’une femme artiste, ou toute personne qui se considère comme telle, de la région montréalaise ayant atteint ou dépassé le stade de mi-carrière
Une communauté intergénérationnelle d'artistes féministes actives et engagées 
40 ans de diffusion et d’action en art actuel via des expositions, performances, tables rondes, ateliers, soirées de projection, publications et des fêtes

ContrepartiesEn contrepartie, nous vous offrons des paquets de publication historique de La Centrale, ainsi que notre nouvelle ouvrage à paraître : Impact féministe sur l'art actuel !
Nous avons aussi des oeuvres originals d'artistes membres de La Centrale ! 
Des oeuvres imprimées en édition limitée !Pour plus de détails, allez voir en image nos contreparties dans la section GALERIE.


La Centrale, une communauté

La Centrale est constituée d'une communauté de membres artistes et actrices du milieu culturel très présente dans les projets et le développement des activités de la programmation. La Centrale, c'est le reflet de ses membres.
Cette campagne de financement aide La Centrale à réaliser des projets structurants et innovateurs qui s’inscriront à long terme dans les activités du centre. 
ATTENTION! Après avoir participer à cette campagne de financement, vous risquez fortement d’être interpellé.e par La Centrale et de vouloir participer à nos projets!
D'autres façons d’aider
Venez voir nos expositions, assistez aux vernissages, partagez vos expériences, mais surtout parlez-en à vos amis et dans vos communautés!
Vous pouvez aussi devenir membre de La Centrale!
http://www.lacentrale.org/types-de-membres


Marquer l’histoire

Trois femmes faisant partie du groupe nommé les Flaming Aprons placent une annonce sur un babillard pour lancer un appel aux femmes artistes désirant se réunir pour discuter des difficultés d’exposer leur travail dans un contexte professionnel. C’est ainsi que prend forme Powerhouse.

Les membres fondatrices sont: Elizabeth Bertoldi, Leslie Busch, Isobel Dowler-Gow, Margaret Griffin, Clara Gutshe, Billie-Joe Mericle, Stansje Plantenga et Pat Walsh. Au cours des huit premiers mois d’activité, la galerie a fonctionné grâce à l’appui des membres, des artistes exposantes et des femmes qui ont soutenu ses activités. 
La toute première exposition a eu lieu du 20 mai au 21 juin 1973. Ce n’est qu’un an plus tard, le 24 mai 1974, que la galerie fut incorporée sous le nom de Galerie et atelier la Centrale Électrique / Powerhouse Gallery & Studio. Le centre a déménagé plusieurs fois, avant de s'établir en 2004 sur le boulevard Saint-Laurent, dans un espace avec vitrine sur la main!


Depuis plus de 40 ans, La Centrale diffuse et stimule les pratiques féministes en art actuel. story:
Thank you for the support every one!

Due to the success of the Zephyr and all of your incredible support I now have a website where you can purchase the Zephyr and other spinning things. Available now on www.db-tops.com

 

The Zephyr and Me...

Hello, My name is Dalton Bissell. I am an artist from the Pacific Northwest of the United States with a passion for both kinetic and utilitarian art. Spinning tops are my latest fascination since they are in motion and quite useful at the same time. Myself and many others carry small fiddler objects to help pass the time, relieve stress, and keep our wandering minds at bay. The Zephyr keeps my attention easily, spinning for how ever long I want and mesmerizing me with its unending dance. Gentle breaths of air keep it spinning while allowing me a chance to take a deep breath.  Now that's something that people often forget to do... take a deep breath and relax because it is good for you! That's right, the Zephyr is good for you. Take a look.

What exactly is it?

-Air assisted spinning top, you blow down it spins faster.

-Stainless Steel alloy, it's durable and looks impressive.

-Grade 25 Stainless Steel Ball Bearing, it's a smooth spin.

Risks & Challenges

The main obstacle is to make sure they all work properly. Accuracy is important with any spinning top, so each top will be tested to ensure it's spin. The next hurdle to clear will be shipping, each top will be shipped via USPS with tracking numbers for each shipment. This ensures their safe and swift delivery.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't contribute to the campaign but you still want to see it succeed please share it with as many people as you can. Post it on your social media pages, facebook, twitter, anywhere... and thank you so much for all your support! It means the world to me.
